author: {'steamid': '76561197980018531', 'num_games_owned': 1234, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1590292424}
review:
A legendary mashup.

Pros: 
+ Like Mean Bean Machine? Puyo's basically that but better. Also Fever mode rocks.
+ Tetris x Puyo Puyo mashup works! (mostly)
+ Good story and cast. The Tetra crew deserve to be in every successive Tetris game.
+ A hilarious script. Easily one of the funniest games since Portal 2


Cons:
- Terrible competitive balance. Puyo Puyo vs Tetris matches HEAVILY favors the latter, even after patches
- Story mode assumes you know all the non-Tetris cast and does nothing to introduce them. Go read the Puyo Nexus wiki. It won't take long to know the major players.
- Dark Prince is a lame English name. "I'M IN LOVE WITH SATAN" sounds better.

Tetris creator Alexy Pajitnov stated in an interview that Puyo Puyo is the only game that could match up with Tetris. Based on the results, I'm inclined to agree. 
Disclaimer: He designed puzzles for the original Puyo Puyo.

Arle for Smash!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980692360', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 2103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1677408864}
review:
[h1]TL:DR VERSION:[/h1]
[b]This is actually a neutral review[/b], I am only marking it as negative so you can read this checklist: 
[*]You like BOTH Puyo Puyo™ AND Tetris®
[*]You either don't care for ranked only play, like to suffer competitively, or are really, really good at either Puyo Puyo™™ or Tetris®®
[*]You've got friends to play with


If everything checks out, get it on sales. If not, reading further might help you decide. 


[h1]Nostalgia revamped[/h1]

Puyo Puyo™Tetris® (®™)™ tries, on one hand, to pluck the nostalgia string present in those gamers who fondly remember green and yellow minos raining down to the sweet 8 bit sound of Korobeiniki. On tthe other hand, it smashes their brain with a complementary serving of mean multicolored beans. I know, this sentence is a rollercoaster of emotion but then so is the game. 

For those who don't know, Puyo-Puyo Tee-Em is the PG version of an R-Rated adult-men-only playgroup: you stack pairs of differently colored balls in various ways until some disappear, letting the ones on the top fall towards the bottom and triggering combos. For those who don't know Tetris (Circled R), it might be time to move back under that rock from which you just crawled out: you're reading this on the internet, and the next logical step is some variation on rule 34. Stay inside, stay pure. 

Mind you I have nothing against either Puyo Puyo Tee-Em or Tetris Circled Ar, the latter reminds me of this sweet time when I was bullied in school for it being my only Game Boy cartridge, and having consistently played the former with my now ex-wife gave us some safe reasons to shout at each other even louder. So there you have it: nostalgia.

[h1]The Power of Friendship (But not too much)[/h1]

Nostalgia isn't the only reason why I bought the game, though. See, I wanted to play some 'easy to pick up, hard to let go' type of game with some of my friends and maybe even also strangers. Tetris (CIRCLED AR) came to mind but the free "Tetris Friend" web app has closed down and I'm not completely feeling its successor. Also I don't know of any other way to play Puyo Puyo (TEE-EM) online. 

The first thing I did was play with my online friend. When they were done saying mean things about the size of my penis and my social habits because somehow they didn't like being reduced to a proverbial pile of cold, salty, losing ashes.

I then played with my not-ex wife and funny enough she told me the exact same thing about my penis, but then again, proverbial ashes don't break my bones and this marriage is stronger than the previous one.

After that I tried to play with my online friends while having my wife join-in as a local second player. Nope. Cannot. It's coach OR online, you can't have both, you spoiled, spoiled millennial. 

[h1]GIT GUD PIPIPIPI GU GU GU[/h1]

Then I thought I'd like a challenge and entered the story mode. My wishes were answered: I love Tetris cIRcLed aR but I'm much less proficient at Puyo Puyo tEe eM and, surprise, this mode requires you to be good at both or no soup for you tonight. 

Story mode also taught me something: there's only so many times my ears can be exposed to "PIPIPIPIPI" and "GUGUGUGUGU" before they shut down and punch me in the groin. I finished it though, I'm still missing some stars because I'm neither a completionnist nor an IBM mainframe. 

After that I proceeded to mess around in the menus and got sucked back to year 2000, when terms like User Experience and Quality of Life were thought to be corporate jargon and where, for instance, it was completely fine to choose an avatar literally without seeing it. Good times. I attempted to buy some skins for minos and puyos with some in-game money, too, but I'd rather pay my grandma real money to stare at her wallpaper for half a day. Those skins are so ugly no cream will ever fix them. 

So finally I went online and for 15 whole minutes the only opponent I could find among the 300 or so that were supposedly there with me was a player in Canada, ranked 51 locally and marked as a professional. I, on the other hand, am a player in Indonesia, ranked F* you everywhere. That's when I got my ego rectally checked, and realized that all that was said about my penis was true. That is to say, the matchmaking is really, really bad and I'm not the only one to complain about it. Oh, and last time I checked, the unranked lobby was empty, so there's that, too. 

[h1]CONCLUSION: It's fine, but buy on sales[/h1]

There's so much more to say about this game, how Tetris (CIIIIIIRCLED... AAAAAAR! (sei ken!)) and Puyo Puyo (TEEEE EMU (no jutsu!)) aren't supposed to be mixed-up, how the fusion mode sucks the essence of both, how I naively think that Tetris Friend was not only free but a much more accessible and streamlined experience, but actually there's only one conclusion: 

Just many old board games (Checkers, Otello, Chess, etc...) Tetris®®®®®® and to a lesser degree, Puyo Puyo™™™™™ are games where the simplicity of the gameplay is the source of its depth. The rules are known by many, easy to learn, and all that's left to do is to make it simple for people to get together and play it.

Here SEGA gets tangled in too many bells and whistles. On their own, both games play great, as expected, and they are as fun as they ever were. Modes that bring novelty to the genres by fusing them together, though, makes for a gameplay too clunky for parties or too uneven for serious players. 

Get it on sales if you really want a revamped version of either Puyo Puyo (Chtulu) or Tetris (Ph'tagn) which you can play with your overseas friend or your couch mates. If you don't like Puyo-Puyo, there are still free, browser based alternatives out there that are worth checking out.

review:
I bought this game on sale because quarantine has me on a Tetris kick for reasons I still haven't completely figured out, and even though I'm total garbage at Puyo Puyo and not terribly familiar with the lore it's still loads of fun. You'll probably be as confused as me by the story mode since it seems to contain a bunch of inside-baseball Puyo Puyo franchise references, but it's cute all the same.

Worth it for Tetris alone; Puyo Puyo is an added bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130212420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1689292456}
review:
This is the most fun and addicting puzzle game i have ever played. Swap mode is a blast and extremely fast paced. It can get pretty intense if you play online. 

The biggest flaw however, is the matchmaking system. I'm a huge Puyo Puyo fan, and so i'm not terrible at the game, and i think my tetris is decent (Even though i have a lot to learn yet) But 60% of the time you are gonna encounter a player that's far, far (like no joke) more skilled than you, and that kinda ruins the whole experience since games last for like a minute or so.
The other 40% of the time you are gonna play with someone around your same skill level and there's when the game shines the most. 

Story is what you would expect for a Puyo Puyo game, with tons of silly dialogue and innuendos, there's also a lot differents modes to try out and they all have fun gimmicks involving both Puyos and Tetriminos.

Overall, this is a must play, and we definitely need more players in order to get a proper matchmaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057019005', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1689632162}
review:
Grundlegend ist das Spielprinzip "PuyoPuyo" eigentlich wärmstens zu empfehlen, wenn man den Klassiker Tetris mag, was in diesem Spiel als wirklich geniales Crossover gelungen ist. Und das nicht einfach nur, dass beide Spiele einfach drin sind, nein, sondern dass man auch bspw. Tetris vs. PuyoPuyo spielen kann sowie weitere Modi (auch der typisch unfaire "Party"-Modus á la Zufallsprinzip mit mießen Power-Ups, mit dem man seine Freunde aus dem Haus jagt) und beides miteinander extrem gut ausbalanciert ist. Beide Prinzipe haben unterschiedliche Weisen, wie man Combos aufbaut und zusätzliche Moves wie der klassische T-Spin bei Tetris, mit dem man dem Gegner zusätzliche Reihen/Puyos einjubelt. Zudem ist die Optik top-notch in seinem Stil, der Soundtrack ist wirklich liebenswert und auch die Singleplayer-Story hat seinen Charm, welche auch noch mit echt guter und abwechselnder KI bereichert ist.

Jetzt da aber nur vor allem ein einzelnes Problem, das den Spaß auf lange Zeit echt verderben kann...
Die Steuerung...
Leider hat man sich dazu entschieden die sog. Instant-Drops bei der Controllersteuerung auf LS-Oben und die sog. Fast-Drops auf LS-Unten zu setzen. Leider passieren mir persönlich jedenfalls zu viele Input-Fehler (egal ob Controller mit analogen Stick, primärem D-Pad oder auch bei Fight-Sticks), die man meiner Meinung nach auf die Buttons oder Schultertasten hätte legen können. Nun kann man sich sicher denken, dass man dann einfach die Steuerung ingame ändert und dann damit das Problem behebt. Aber das lässt die Steuerung nicht zu... naja, genauergesagt, kann man zwischen ein paar Presets wählen, die sich dem Problem aber leider nicht annehmen. Nun könnte man zwar damit argumentieren, dass man das über 3rd-Party Programme wie X360CE fixen kann, aber da muss ich dann auch sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel einfach auch gerne via Remote Play Together spielen will und dann wird jede zusätzliche (externe) Konfiguration nur noch ein Graus. Leider habe ich das Spiel bisher nicht wirklich mit Tastatur gespielt, aber es lädt einfach zu sehr dazu ein, es mit Controller zu spielen. Und es ist einfach nur demotivierend sich seine Combo durch einen Instant-Drop zu ruinieren. Vielleicht nicht einmal, oder zwei mal - aber es passiert einfach immer wieder und mit jedem Mal dämpft es immer mehr den Spielspaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856202354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3436, 'last_played': 1679650216}
review:
재밋음. 리그를 돌린다면 같은 점수대 사람이 뜨면 돌리는걸 추천함. 누가 랭커랑 붙어서 탈탈 털렸다는데 그거 랭커 만나면 바로 튀고 같은 점수대(+- 800 까진 괜춘한듯)뜨면 하셈
다만 뉴비가 많지 않아서 만나기 힘들다는게 문제임. 아니면 자기 실력을 올려서 대결해도 괜찮을듯함

review:
The story mode is really childish, but this game is the only way to play Tetris on Steam.
I'm not a fan of Puyo Puyo, so I dont know how good it is in this game, but Tetris was handled pretty well here (althrough its pretty hard to screw up TETRIS).

Get it on a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310379749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1677179820}
review:
Mi favorito (aunque solo lo compro por Tetris). Este juego tiene unos estímulos visuales y sonoros que te hacen vivir la emoción con cada línea, combo y el que te permita poner el audio en japonés es genial (así ya no tuve que comprar una versión importada del PPT en japones). Una curiosidad adicional versus las versiones de consola es que entre round y round la música no se reinicia a diferencia de las versiones de consola. Eso mantiene la emoción de la banda sonora (la cual es magnífica). Tiene total compatibilidad con el mando, yo lo uso con un mando de Xbox y funciona genial.

El único problema es que si activas la vibración, el control vibra demasiado fuerte y largo con cada hard drop, parece que no está optimizado para la vibración.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326999621', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5740, 'last_played': 1687394845}
review:
For a person who plays competitive Tetris as a passion, i'd say this game is one of my favourite games of all time.
The game mechanics are amazing and the way they managed to collide Tetris with Puyo is unthinkable. 
My only issue is the online matchmaking. I somehow get managed to always match up with someone that always plays with a DT-STSD opener or a C4W, and it's pretty annoying at some times. It's be nice if matchmaking was based off of not only rating, but also off of consecutive wins.

I give this game a 9/10. Amazing game SEGA, i hope to see more Puyo x Tetris content from you some time.

review:
테트리스도 뿌요뿌요도 매력적인 게임이지만
이 게임은 쓰레기임.
해금을 위해 궁금하지도 않은 스토리를 밀려면 대충 만든 모드를 플레이 해야 하며
인터넷 대전은 레이팅제한 없이 아무나 만날 수 있고, 레이팅 조작 또한 가능하다.
핑이 조금만 안 좋으면 키보드에 콜라쏟은양 아주 불쾌한 조작감을 선사하며

무엇보다 3만원인게 어이가 없다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169805845', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1701, 'last_played': 1605579011}
review: I got this game because I wanted to be able to play Tetris together with my girlfriend, and it ended up being so much more than I expected! Not only is Tetris fun as always, but I've learned to love Puyo too. I played locally with my sister, who loved the game so much she bought it and showed it to another friend who loved it so much [i]she[/i] bought it as well! Just tonight, my whole family played together and they all really loved it. A great game to play with friends, but even then I love the adventure mode as well. I didn't expect to even touch adventure mode, but it's turned out to be really fun and addicting too. I really recommend this game for anyone who love cute things, puzzles, or wants a fun casual game to play with friends/family. Thanks for helping me make some great memories with my loved ones, puyo puyo. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198123679154', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1667452917}
review:
A classic puzzle series from overseas trying to get a leg up on the English speaking community, Puyo Puyo  made a bold move and teamed up with Tetris to finally show us what we've been missing. So, was it worth it?

Absolutely!
Amazing dubbing, fun writing, and addictive gameplay means this game is very recommended for puzzle geniuses or just a group who wants a fun party game. The only gripes I have are the shoddy online and matchmaking, and the horribly unbalanced Tetris in high-level gameplay. Those things aside, however, this game is a must buy for anyone who even THINKS they like puzzle games. Don't pass this one up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050250311', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6260, 'last_played': 1648818334}
review:
Decent, but not great.
TLDR: Buy it for singleplayer/local multiplayer or not at all.
-------------------------------------------------------------
+Nice single player/local multiplayer

-Online multiplayer has latency issues, but that's rarely a problem because
-It is absolutely dead, and when it isn't
-Only veterans are active making it very difficult to gain rank for intermediate players

+-Campaign is extremely cringey, which can be kinda funny (at times...)

+-If you are colour blind Puyo can be impossible, but you can buy a skin where each puyo is shaped like the first letter of its colour (red puyos are R, blue are B, etc.) making it playable

+-Kind of "slow" tetris (e.g. slow line clear delay) but this is not necessarily bad as it brings its own set of challenges

author: {'steamid': '76561198876111275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2055, 'last_played': 1594968715}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris es un juego que mezcla dos juegos de puzzle diferentes , Puyo y Tetris , logrando dar una experiencia divertida tanto si eres un jugador de Puyo Puyo o uno de Tetris , ademas , incluye un modo historia no muy largo pero cumple con entretenerte completando los desafios que tienen muy buena dificultad ni muy facil ni muy complicado ( este modo te puede garantizar unas 2 o 3 horas de juego si continuas hasta los capitulos extras ) , pero si la historia se te hace pesada  hay muchos modos single player ( que se agradece , ya que a dia de hoy no muchos juegos se molestan en incluir modos de un solo jugador ) de Puyo y Tetris ademas de traer el modo Challenge para probar tus habilidades en los Rankings.
Aunque no todo es perfecto en este juego hay cosas malas como el Matchmacking en el modo online que puede ponerte con los top 3 mundiales ( esto puede corregirse para encontrar duelos a tu nivel ) , tambien agrego que hay input lag a pesar de tener una conexion bastante estable , pero fuera de todo es un juego bastante recomendable tanto Singleplayer como Online o Multiplayer con amigos.

review:
优点：个人认为目前pc上最好玩的tetris，人物设计，冒险模式也不错。没有汉化问题不大，两个版本语音血赚。
缺点：匹配机制有问题，联机容易闪退，优化极差。
总结：有ns还是玩ns版的吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198361286758', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1590721710}
review:
I wouldn't recommend buying this game. There's a noticable input lag and it bothers me. All that's left of the multiplayer now are the gods of the game, best in the world, so if you like fighting the literal gods of Puyo Puyo and Tetris, I wouldn't recommend the multiplayer. 
     The singleplayer is just kinda "eh"? It's nothing spectacular, it just feels bland. Storywise, and somehow, the gameplay feels bland too. The game overall doesn't feel great, nor does the gameplay.

     Don't get me wrong, I love Puyo and Tetris, but if you want to play Puyo or Tetris, look somewhere else.      
There's many free alternatives for Puyo and Tetris, that feel much better and responsive, and have multiplayer that people still actually play.

Maybe in 2018 and 2019 this game was alright, but not in 2020. Don't buy.
3/5. It's not horrible, and there's obviously some effort put into it, but there shouldn't be any input lag in the singleplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114203682', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1645104250}
review:
虽然我热爱这个游戏，热爱Tetris,但PC就是一坨屎
联机网络体验极差，掉线卡顿真PPT
匹配分数差距极大
游戏途中闪退
疯狂吃键，联机卡吃，按的快了吃
无中文。
哦，我的上帝，如果你在NS上也有PPT你就会发现是两个游戏体验，上面提到的问题全都没有。

要是想在电脑上体验带Ranks的方块，可以去玩免费的worldwidecombos。
但要是想在PC上玩PPT，就要做好心态崩溃的准备

author: {'steamid': '76561198202187653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1614129087}
review:
É um jogo espetacular para os fãs de Tetris ou Puyo Puyo, com modos que irão fazer passar raiva ou ficar mais calmo do que Buda. A experiência de jogar sozinho é maravilhosa, quando está a noite e chovendo, mas de jogar com um amigo ou mais é perfeita.
Recomendado para qualquer pessoa e se quiser começar a jogar Tetris ou Puyo Puyo esse jogo é muito bom para tal. Com diversos níveis de CPU e diversas alterações de controles, para que você tenha uma boa experiência.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080178247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1641482998}
review:
私はwiiU版・PSVita版も所持しているのでそれらとの比較も書きます。

日本語は音声のみなのでMODなどで日本語化しなければ多少は苦労するかも知れません。
しかし、UIは簡単な英語ばかりなのでゲームとしてプレイする分にはそれほど苦労はしないと思います。

ネット対戦は回線相性のいい相手とならほぼラグはないです。(私の回線は日本でping7~9・下り100~200mg・上り500mgぐらいです)
ただし、ぷよテト特有の変な場面での処理落ち?のようなラグはwiiU版・PSVita版ともに同じ仕様です。
当然ですが緑アンテナ指定をしたとしても回線相性の悪い相手もいるようで酷いラグが発生する場合もあります。

プレイヤーもそこそこ居るため対戦相手には困らないと思います。
ただし、基本的に初心者はほぼいません。(稀にいる)
最低限は上級者かそれ以上の人たちです。
ただ、初心者とのマッチングを気にしなくて良いため心置きなく暴れられます。
全力で戦えるのは素晴らしいです。

review:
Feels like a console game ported to PC without effort. Probably because it is.
- Clunky and slow UI with an organisation that makes little sense
- Slow loading times for no good reason
- Garbage netcode that makes everyone lag if one player has high latency
- Garbage balance and matchmaking
+ Good tetris

author: {'steamid': '76561198974449613', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1981, 'last_played': 1612757687}
review:
One of the most fun ways to play Tetris under guideline rules, without having to go through a battle royale scene. Also possibly one of the few Tetris games that has a solid storyline (apart from Tetris Worlds). Community is still active here, although not as much as in other platforms, like the Switch. And the English VO is spot on, on most of the characters. Puyo Puyo is a nice addition to one of my favorite puzzle games, although I play it only as a side.

For the downside, though, garbage blocking is missing in Versus (but exists in Swap), but we're okay with that. Going online may have some disturbance. Ranked is just brutal, early players (2K rating) sometimes had to deal with pros (10K rating) and get obliterated. But sometimes ranked is broken, causing disconnects and unexpected change in rating.

Overall, despite the struggle online, Puyo Puyo Tetris is still enjoyable in singleplayer and local multiplayer. Just make sure you have a friend along, unless you're okay battling ruthless AI (both in-game and external bots like Zetris) on your own.

review:

홀드, 회전 입력... 있었는데요, 없었습니다. ^ㅗㅗ^
아, 야발 키씹개망겜... 키씹에 렉에 스트레스 극도로 받으시는 분은 저처럼 랭겜 끊으시고 친선충되기를...

당신이 만약 뿌요러라면, 테사기테사기테사기테사기....(고인물 이상 한정)

review:
Even if you don't like Puyo Puyo, this game is one of the best ways to play Tetris.

Edit: This is no longer the case and if you want to play Tetris, then I would recommend Tetris Effect Connected and if you want to play Puyo Puyo then the most accessible option is probably Puyo Puyo Champions. This Game is still good but if you are only buying it for either the Tetris or Puyo, then I would get the games I mentioned above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130549459', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2511, 'last_played': 1702864884}
review:
It is alright. The storyline is pretty compelling to hear with some other characters voices. I was kind of noobish of playing tetris during adventure mode, but eventually, I've beaten all the levels. Multiplayer sparked interests when you first watch the trailer... until you actually play it for yourself. 

The puzzle league has unorganized groups of skilled players. I often play against users who are ranked over Top 4000 or Top 500 in the world. They absolutely crushed me under a minute per round. Sounds ridiculous, isn't it? The developers could have change the way matchmaking works by detecting the opponent's ratings similar to your own. The publishers should have also lower the price. 

If you're looking forward only to play online to win, then consider not buying it. Otherwise, you will obviously be in a bad mood and might throw your controller out your window if you haven't gotten a refund yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187494163', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1586500869}
review:
For those who are not aware, Puyo Puyo is a falling-block puzzle game in which you must connect four or more Puyos of the same color in order to pop them. You'll quickly learn, however, that the real challenge of the game comes from setting Puyos up so that they pop in chains. Gravity is constantly at play in this game, so you have to plan ahead to keep Puyos from popping until you are able to set off a chain reaction. It can be very difficult for beginners, but it is extremely fun once you start to get the hang of it. The tutorials can give you some good pointers and examples of common chaining patterns, so definitely give that a look.

While I am not a fan of Tetris, I am glad that a Puyo Puyo game has finally gotten an international release.  Here in the US, the last entry we ever saw was Puyo Pop Fever.  Unfortunately, this game does not have a large selection of modes from you to choose from. Puyo Puyo always runs in Tsu rules, though Fever dropsets still seem to be a thing which is odd. There is an Endless Puyo mode as well as Endless Fever (no standard Fever unfortunately), Party mode, and Tiny Puyo mode...
As for the Tetris side, you can do solo runs of Ultra, Marathon, and Sprint.
There is also a Swap mode which is a battle mode that will switch you between Puyo Puyo and Tetris. I hear this mode is extremely fun for fans of both franchises, but due to my lack of interest in Tetris, I really can't comment.
Fusion mode is terrible, but luckily you barely ever have to use it in the main story.
You can do battles both online, locally, and against the CPU.
Adventure mode is a level-based game that takes you through all of the various versus and solo modes. Sometimes it can be as simple as score trials. The story is really cute, and the English voice acting is surprisingly good here. It makes me really wish that more Puyo Puyo games could be globalized, cuz come on, who can hate the charm of this unique series?
The only thing that makes completing Adventure mode really hard for me is the implementation of Tetris. I'm not nearly good enough at it to withstand a battle. You have to be very quick and plan out your combos.
If you like Puyo Puyo, then I can definitely recommend this as it's been a long time since we (outside of Japan) have been treated with an entry in the series. If you like Tetris, and are at least curious to try out Puyo Puyo, then I'd recommend this to you as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155726997', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1649685413}
review:
It's two great puzzle games in one, tetris with puyo puyo. There are a lot of other fun modes to make the game great with people that never touched puyo/tetris, so don't be afraid to play this game with your friends because  at least party mode doesn't require being a master puzzle player to win, it's like smash.

Online sucks but I bought this game for local play so yeah, it's worth it. Also, it's remote play compatible. 

Buy it on sale, maybe full price.

review:
+) Simple HUD and Interface
+) Cute characters and BGM
+) Story is funny in a pure(?) way.

-) Main menu was a bit disorienting.
-) No difficulty settings.
-) The game is designed with an anticipation; Everyone who plays this game loves these two puzzle games so much that they will gladly spend hours to become masters of the game.
-) Although the story is cute and hilarious the match up is very unreasonable. I think it is supposed to be some kind of a joke but it just seems awfully constructed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156880128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4939, 'last_played': 1656059352}
review:
I try to like this game and honestly probably give it way too much time. But the more I play it, the more I ask why this was allowed to release in the condition it's in. And I specifically mean the problems exclusive to the PC version, setting aside the matter of the concept of mashing two completely different and hugely incompatible games together, which was a bad idea from the beginning.

The control mechanics are some of the worst in any tetris game I've ever played. The number of dropped inputs is incredibly high, and there are random frequent pauses that can range from around half a second to more than a full second, typically when clearing lines/puyos and being damaged. And this is in offline play.
The online experience is also frankly horrible. No matchmaking control at all, and all the problems above are only made worse. At some times, I'm struggling to even play, and other times, it's basically unplayable.

If it's between this version and console, take console. Or better yet if you have a switch, don't bother at all and just stick with tetris 99, and if you want puyo, there are plenty of puyo games as well as online puyo for free to vastly cheaper.

After 15 additional hours of gameplay, I've labeled this game as unplayable and have decided to quit. I can confidently say this is one of if not the worst iteration of both puyo and tetris, especially tetris. Literally play anything else and you'll have a better experience.

review:
It's fun, but I would only recommend it if it costs like 12 Euro.
You can also play with an XBoxController (which can be fast enough if you use the lower pad on the left side) - I prefer it.

Also, if you are not a complete pro the online multiplayer is a total trainwreck (like 99/100 player are pros or bots that will destroy you in less than 15s).

This game runs on Manjaro Linux with Proton out of the box.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058495104', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2346, 'last_played': 1665464338}
review:
Really liked this game. I wasn't in it for the story, just the endurance and versus modes. They are very fun when against friends. The online multiplayer is difficult as you meet very fast players who can beat you in a minute.

Anywho, I still play the game. There are other game modes to make it more fun if you're bored of tetris and ways to spice it up (such as faster falling blocks - spicy).

author: {'steamid': '76561198053728261', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1614581120}
review:
Existem diversas combinações aleatórias, uma delas é Puyo Puyo com Tetris.
Particularmente, eu prefiro tetris, mas com a adição do puyo puyo, até seu modo de pensar em uma jogada pode mudar, as vezes a melhor opção é guardar uma peça pra próxima "troca" de modo.
Algumas features são muitos malfeitas, como o sistema de multiplayer onde é obrigatório o "garbage" tornando o multiplayer com amigos muito desbalanceado e não funcional; Mas no geral é um excelente puzzle pra passar o tempo com a galera e até mesmo pra se jogar sozinho (E tem diversos modos pra isso)

author: {'steamid': '76561198019620774', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1580083630}
review:
Dead game, usually 200 players at once at a time. Matchmaking is completely random and you'll run into 40k players most of the time. Netplay also sucks, freezes at random, I've lost the count of times where it froze at the end when I was winning 2-0. Some freezes forces me to restart the game. Dead and buggy, not very surprised. This game would be still expensive if it was free.

TL;DR One of those games you wonder why you quit, then remember immediately after picking it up

Edit: The game isnt so bad actually, realized that bugs dont occur that frequently. I'm also slowly getting used to getting stomped by veterans. I would give this game a postivite vote if they brought some kind of elo range preference selection for matchmaking.

Edit 2: Nvm, the game resetted my rank down to Student and my puyo/tetris playrate to 50% for no reason. Buggy as hell, still a downvote

Edit 3: Bugs are frequent. Final conclusion: Would buy in a $1 bundle pack

판마다 그지1랄이니 승률조작은 덤

AI 유저 농락
가끔 잘하는 애들이 나온다
근데 조절을 너무 티나게 한다
내가 봇이랑 노는게 아니라
봇이 나랑 놀아주는 느낌이랄까

석유과 뉴비가 매칭됨
당연히 몇십년한 유저를 한두시간 한사람이 이길수 없음
잡아도 랭크좀 맞춰서 해주면 좋겠다

P.S 파티 모드 승부 조작 거지 같네^^ 막힌곳 뚫는 족 족 아이템으로 다 막아 버리니^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197997402955', 'num_games_owned': 9057, 'num_reviews': 374, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1578839057}
review:
Folgt uns auf: [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/32139821/]German Review Group Curator Site[/url] für weitere Reviews und [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/35795476-Wolferatus-Review-Group/]My Curator Site[/url], wenn ihr mehr von mir lesen wollt.

[h1][b]Puyo Puyo™Tetris®[/b][/h1]
https://youtu.be/bXusn55QZC4 
[h1][b]Publisher:[/b][/h1]
Sega ist ein japanisches Unternehmen, das offiziell 1952 in Japan gegründet wurde, der Name SEGA leitet sich von „Service Games“ ab. Das Unternehmen hat mittlerweile über 10.700 Angestellte. SEGA stellt außer Konsolen- und PC Spiele auch Spielautomaten her.  

2005 stellte SEGA die Entwicklung von Spielekonsolen ein, nach dem Nintendo allerdings solchen Erfolg mit seinen Mini Konsolen hatte, wurde am 19. September 2019 der Mega Drive Mini mit 42 vorinstallierten Spielen veröffentlicht.

[h1][b]Story:[/b][/h1]
Puyo Puyo oder Tetris? Oder beides? Du hast die Wahl. Spiele gegen den Computer oder Freunde, versuche dich im Multiplayer gegen unbekannte und steig in der Rangliste auf. Du stehst eher auf einen Story-Modus? Dann starte deine Kampagne und werde zum Puyo Puyo-Tetris König/in. 

[h1][b]Anmerkung:[/b][/h1]
Dieses Spiel bekommt von mir nur ganz knapp eine Positive Bewertung, da es mir aber Spaß macht und ich nicht viel Wert auf den MP lege. Eigentlich würde ich Neutral bevorzugen, aber diese Möglichkeit gibt es leider bei Steam nicht. 

[h1][b]Gameplay:[/b][/h1]
Wähle zwischen Adventure-, Solo Arcade- und Multiplayer Arcade Modus, dein Spiel aus. Im Adventure Modus spielst du die Story die sich zwischen Tetris und Puyo Puyo abwechselt, im Solo Arcade Modus kannst du dann verschiedene Spielarten wählen wie bspw. Versus oder Party, hier spielst du gegen den Computer. Im Multiplayer Arcade trittst du gegen andere Spieler auf der ganzen Welt an.

Puyo Puyo Tetris ist nicht für Kinder geeignet, ich würde schon fast sagen, es ist nicht mal für Anfänger geeignet die keine Skills drauf haben wie ich. Die KI kann nicht eingestellt werden und in den meisten Modis schafft man nicht mal 5 KI-Gegner, weil sie einen mit Skills raushauen ehe man sich versieht. Ein lockeres Spielen wie es damals beim Tetris Gameboy Spiel war ist nur bedingt möglich. 

Das Spiel wurde definitiv für Hardcore Spieler entwickelt. Bis auf den Story Modus sind nämlich fast alle Modis kaum zu schaffen für Anfänger, man muss ziemlich schnell sein und die Steuerung vor allem perfekt beherrschen.  

[h1][b]Sound und Grafik:[/b][/h1]
Der Sound ist gewöhnungsbedürftig, kann im Solo-Modus aber angepasst werden. Der beste Sound ist natürlich der modernisierte Themensong von Tetris, er hat zwar nicht ganz so Ohrwurm-feeling wie das Original, macht aber dennoch viel Spaß. Die Grafik ist gut, schöne Charaktere im Anime lock, verschiedene Puyo Puyo Figuren die man auswählen kann und die Tetris Steinchen sehen natürlich in ihrer Farbenpracht genauso aus wie man es gewohnt ist.

[h1][b]Tutorial:[/b][/h1]
Das Tutorial erklärt dem Spieler wie Mechaniken und Tricks die man einsetzen kann, allerdings zeigt das Tutorial bei der PC-Version nur die Keyboard Steuerung und nicht die Steuerung mit dem Controller.  Man kann auch nicht mit Übungsspielen üben, sondern muss sich quasi die Videoclips einprägen. Dadurch ist auch kein leichter Einstieg möglich, da keiner der Modis im Spiel dies zulässt. (Ausnahme - Story Modus)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1966432172
[h1][b]Multiplayer:[/b][/h1]
Solltet ihr keine Profis sein, vergesst den Multiplayer gegen Radom Leute, ihr werdet zu 98% gegen Spieler antreten, die euren Rang weit überschreiten als Anfänger. Ich hatte überwiegend Gegner die zwischen den Top 2500 und Top 16000 waren. Die Gegner machen einen so schnell fertig, dass man nicht mal 4 Tetris Steinchen gelegt hat, was definitiv keinen Spaß macht und auch keine Herausforderung ist, da man null Chance hat.

Der Multiplayer ist nur dann zu empfehlen, wenn ihr ihn mit Freunden Spielt, die euren Rank ungefähr haben bzw. dieselben Skills wie ihr. Sollte einer eurer Freunde das Spiel nicht besitzen, aber gerne Spielen wollen mit euch könnt ihr ihn einladen, Puyo Puyo Tetris unterstützt Remote Play und funktioniert sehr gut.

[h1][b]Adventure Modus:[/b][/h1]
Im Adventure Modus spielt man mit einem beliebigen Charakter gegen die KI in einer Art Story Modus. Es gibt verschiedene Stages mit jeweils 9 Level. Die Stages wechseln sich mit Tetris und Puyo Puyo ab. Der Adventure Modus ist gut spielbar, hier ist die KI nicht so extrem wie im Single Arcade Modus. Die Schwierigkeit steigt mit jeder Stage und jedem Level etwas an. Für mich persönlich der beste Modus den man zu beginn spielen kann, da man hier die Spielvarianten kennenlernt und nach und nach besser und vor allem schneller wird.

[h1][b]KI:[/b][/h1]
Die KI ist bis auf den Adventure Modus ziemlich stark, man sollte sich gefasst machen, recht schnell, vor allem zu beginn, besiegt zu werden. Desto trotz macht es Spaß und ist eine ziemliche Herausforderung. Ich hätte mir zwar vor allem am Anfang gewünscht, dass die KI etwas lockerer beginnt, damit man einen schnelleren bzw. leichteren Einstieg in Tetris oder Puyo Puyo findet, aber naja, man kann nicht alles haben, zum Glück stehen uns dafür die Einstellungen Battle und Endurance zur Verfügung, die etwas Abwechslung bieten.  
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1966432224
[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1]
Puyo Puyo Tetris ist ein gutes Spiel, leider im Multiplayer für Anfänger, gegen Radom Leute unbrauchbar. Sollte man sich dieses Spiel also dafür anschaffen, kann ich vom Kauf nur abraten, es sei denn ihr seid richtige Profis und könnt mit den Top 20.000 Spieler der Welt mithalten, denn das werden zu 98% eure Gegner sein. Dies wird sich auch nicht mehr ändern, da das Spiel sein letztes Update im Mai 2018 bekam.

Ebenfalls keine Kaufempfehlung von mir, sollte man dieses Spiel seinen Kindern kaufen die unter 12 oder 14 sind. Das Spiel ist definitiv nicht für Kinder geeignet, sondern wurde mehr für Hardcore Spieler erstellt. Sollte allerdings euer Kind so ein Hardcore-Zocker sein, dann nur zu. 

Ich empfehle das Spiel in einem guten Sale mit mindestens 40% an Spieler, die eine Herausforderung suchen, gerne den Story Modus spielen möchten und mit Freunden via Remote Play Spaß haben wollen. Die verschiedenen Modis machen Spaß, bringen Abwechslung und durch den Story Modus lassen sich neue Musikstücke usw. freischalten.  Man hat viele Charaktere zur Auswahl, jeder von ihnen hat seine Fähigkeiten und Stärken, die man im Spiel einsetzen kann. 

Leider ist es nicht so gut wie Tetris damals auf Gameboy oder Tetris Effect, wer aber gerne Puyo Puyo spielt kommt auf jeden Fall auf seine Kosten. Wer sich nur für Tetris interessiert, sollte auf Tetris Effect warten und diesen Titel ignorieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135396975', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6423, 'last_played': 1657764571}
review:
Over 100 hours later I think I can finally review this. TD;LR at the bottom.

Puyo Puyo Tetris is a game where you can rep your waifu or husbando while playing Puyo or Tetris. The best part? One player can play Puyo while the other plays Tetris!

For $20 you get:
[list]
    [*]A full story mode, which is cute, funny, and a great way to learn the basics of Puyo and Tetris.
    [*]Challenge modes for single player which include 3 challenges for each game. (Endless Fever, Endless Puyo, Tiny Puyo, Marathon, Ultra, and Sprint)
    [*]Five Online, Local Multiplayer, vs AI game modes (Versus, Fusion, Swap, Party, and Big Bang)
[/list]

The multiplayer in this game is fun! You have the choice of playing in a game mode room for Free Play or going head to head in Puzzle League, which is the competitive mode of this game.

But due to the age of this game there is some downsides for this online mode. Here in the west there is not as many active players online. The ones who are active are high skilled Tetris/Puyo players, or new players just picking up the game. The matchmaking is horrible due to the lack of players. Most of them are in Asian countries which I've noticed to cause a bit of lag while playing in some games, sometimes to a point where the game is unplayable due to the delay between pieces. Luckily you can filter out players with a poor connection. Learning as much your preferred game mode and building skill is the best way to ranking up and winning.

So maybe you want to just play offline with AI to learn, but hey how do I change their difficulty?

The difficulty of the AI is actually linked to the character chosen! Here's a quote explaining a bit how they work!
[quote=Mimosa] For Puyo, Schezo, Ecolo, Dark Prince and Ex are amongst the best players. Turning on core AI (by pressing the L1 left bumper) makes them even more powerful, and can do up to 12 chains occasionally.

For Tetris, the AI is comparatively mediocre, since the AI doesn't know how to do T-spins, but they are very good at Tetrises, downstacking, garbage management, and perfect clears, and also combos, so they can still provide a decent challenge, especially if you turn on core AI.

The most powerful AI Tetris players are Feli, Dark Prince, Ex, and Ecolo, although Rurue can give quite a decent whopping at times, just not as powerful as the first 4.

I think, if I had to rate the AI opponents, Dark Prince's Tetris, with core AI enabled is around a 7000-rated human's skill. So ya, they will provide you with enough practice until you are ready to face skilled human opponents. Core AI for Ecolo Puyo is about a 10000-13000 rated human player's skill, maybe more [/quote]

While playing I have found there to be more Tetris players and less Puyo players. (If you're someone more interested in ONLY PLAYING Puyo Puyo I reccommend Puyo Puyo Esports which only costs $10 but is known to go on sale for only $5! Just note matchmaking takes waaaay longer.)

Also the lessons in this game suck, like holy crap, especially since most people in the west don't know what the hell Puyo Puyo is. If you want to learn to play Puyo Sega released official how to play videos on their YouTube made by really good Puyo Players.

TD;LR This game is cute, online can be difficult, watch YouTube to learn Puyo, and have the ultimate waifu war.

edit: fixed some spelling errors because i have a writing level of a middle schooler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004492155', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1580039919}
review:
I will start by saying, I DID NOT pay full price for this nor would I recommend anyone pay that cost.

I have 2 sides to my recommendation.  
Side one...
Hell yeah!  Awesome fun, totally amusing.  Really good story mode, not to easy not too hard that you wanna smash your face against the computer until your teeth push into your brain killing you on impact.
Tons of different VS modes against computers, so you wont really run out of things to do.  Its like throwing on the retro Dr Mario or Tetris and playing.  Its good to have around for those days.

Side Two...
NO!  The online play is something that just drives me nuts.  Not saying I have not attempted and will not continue but their matching system is just a bag of d**ks.  
You will not play against someone at the same capacity or skill level as yourself and work your way up to those higher ranks through grueling hours of torturous fun...
You will play against people who seem to be able to teleport those Tetris blocks into spaces so fast you cannot even see the movement.  However, their skill level at Puyo is less than amusing.  That wont matter. The Tetris portion of it will drive you batty.
If you are lucky enough to play against someone with less of a skill level than you than chances are you are playing on a LAN system, with friends, or you are one of those block teleporters from a distant land.

All in all.
Sale price purchase.  I would recommend it, but for online play or full price... I wouldn't bother personally.  
Only reason I am saying no is because sale prices dont come often and its more likely going to be a full price purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363287153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 201578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 134800, 'last_played': 1712152100}
review:
// 뿌요뿌요테트리스2가 나옵니다. 뿌요든 테트리스든 다른 무료플렛폼에서 즐기면서 실력 쌓으시다가 2가 나오면 구매하시는걸 추천드립니다.






해도해도 끝없이 늘어나는 실력이 보이는 갓겜

아.. 그리고 매칭 되었을때 플레이하지 않고 나가도 패널티가 전혀 없으니까 비슷한 점수대를 맞춰서 하세요....



망겜망겜하는 사람이 너무 많은것이 고까워서 추가로 서술합니다. 렉, 렌뽑같은게 남아있는건 분명 문제라고 생각하고 부정할 생각도 없습니다. 하지만 이 점은 제가 즐기는 멀티가 가능한 다른 많은 스팀게임에서도 문제가 되고있는 부분이고 그 문제때문에 게임의 전체를 흐리는 사람은 없었으면 좋겠습니다. 프리플레이라는 수단도 있고 상대의 지역을 보면서 랭크게임에서 회피를 하면 렉, 렌뽑을 어느정도 회피를 할 수 있습니다. (실제로 네트워크 불안으로 인해 매칭이 종료되면 패널티 없이 강등, 승급전은 승리한 것으로 처리하고 무조건 40점을 줍니다.)

이 게임의 본질은 뿌요뿌요 테트리스 입니다. 벨런스는 둘다 처음 시작하는 경우가 아니라면(이 경우에는 뿌요뿌요가 훨씬 유리하다고 생각합니다.)서로의 실력이 많이 오르더라도 정말 잘 맞는다고 생각하고(단지 테트는 뿌요를 뿌요는 테트를 어떠게 상대해야 하는지를 몰라서 상대가 더 좋게 보이는것 뿐입니다.) 테트리스끼리의 승부를 겨루고 싶으면 jstris나 테트리스99 같은것으로 즐기면 충분히 해결이 되는 부분입니다.(2가지의 게임 전부다 무료로 즐길 수 있습니다.) 뿌요뿌요와 테트리스 둘 모든것에 애착이 있거나 교차로 상대하는것이 즐거운사람에게는 유일한 게임이고 스왑, 파티, 빅뱅, 모험등 대전말고도 매우 많은 컨텐츠로 즐길 수 있는 게임입니다. 저 역시 정말 모든 단점을 상쇄할만큼 테트리스로 뿌요를 상대하는 것과 스왑모드로 항상 재밌게 플레이하고 있는데 많은 사람이 이 게임만이 가지고 있는 유일한 장점 보다 그냥 대충해도 눈에 보이는 단점만으로 평가를하고 남한테 왜곡됀 시선으로 볼 수 밖에 없게 만드는 말을 하는데 볼때마다 마음이 많이 아픕니다.

테르리스, 뿌요뿌요 라는 장르 자체가 잘 하는 사람은 보고 따라서 구매를 하고 즐기면 그렇게 못하는 자신이 화나고 진입장벽이 높게 느껴질 수 밖에 없습니다. 요즘은 빌드라는것이 정착해서 뿌요뿌요를 하던 테트리스를 하던 그럿것 때문에 더 거부감이 있을 수 있지만 본인이 익히기 싫다고 해서 암기게임 같은 인식을 가지는건 매우 잘못된 일이라고 생각합니다. 무엇이든 자기가 노력해서 얻은것이고 그것을 비하하는 것이 아닌것 같습니다.

속히 말하는 뿌요뿌요의 개구리식 쌓기와 테트리스의 와이드류를 매우 싫어하시는 분들이 많은데 그것들 모두 파홰법이 있는 것입니다. 그런것 때문에 뭐라고 하거나 랜뽑등 비매너 행위를 하는건 정말 잘못된 행위라고 생각합니다.

끝으로 어쩌다 다른사람들의 리뷰를 쭉 읽어보게 돼고 보다보니 제가 좋아하는 게임의 인식이 많이 안좋은거 같아서 좀 마음이 답답해, 긴 글을 적습니다. 맞춤법이나 문맥이 따로 정리를하며 퇴고를 하지 않아서 글이 많이 부족할 수도 있고 난잡할 수도 있지만 생각하고 있는걸 한 사람에게라도 전하고 싶었습니다. 한국문화가 무슨 게임이든 좋은점보다 눈에띄는 문제점이나 본인이 싫어하는걸 그 본질보다 훨씬 크게 키워서 전파를 하고 그런 프레임에 씌워져서 본인의 판단도 흐리는 사람이 많은거 같아서 이렇게 적게 되었습니다.

이 게임이 문제가 전혀 없다고 생각하는 것이 아니라 같이 장점도 봐주면 좋겠습니다.
혹여나 이 긴 글을 읽어주신 분은 정말 감사합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862447192', 'num_games_owned': 2493, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 3849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1592081699}
review:
This is a great game , especially for fans of puyo puyo. For those not familiar with Puyo Puyo..it's basically what you grew up with as dr. robotnic's mean bean machine/kirby's avalanche.

There is a story mode, arcade mode, local and competitive play. Competitive play is fairly active , which is surprising since this is actually an older puyo puyo game than the one released a few months back.

The only issue I actually have with this game is that puyo puyo has an unfair disadvantage in competitive play against tetris. With the the tetrinomos you can press up to immediately have them drop to the bottom where the shadow is. Puyos unfortunately have no such control. When playing against a high level tetris opponent,  this can be a bit harsh.

review: Si tu objetivo es jugar online y mejorar tu rango y habilidad, me temo que va a ser muy difícil gracias al terrible matchmaking que tiene. Yo acabo de comprarlo y me toca contra el top 3 de Estados Unidos y contra gente que triplica mi rango y habilidad constantemente. Si no te molesta esto compralo. La historia y los modos de juego son muy entretenidos, cabe recalcar. Otra cosa que me olvide decir es que en el online casual también hay problemas, no hay salas para jugar.

review: 정말 재미있는 게임 고인물이 많고 그 고인물들은 뉴비를 봐주진 않지만 자신의 레이팅에 맞는 상대를 만날때가 많아 실력차가 많이 나지도 않고 만나지 못한다고 해도 싱글 플레이가 있기 때문에 실력을 키우긴 충분함.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058158705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 156730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118631, 'last_played': 1602782018}
review:
이 게임은 한번 구매하시면 두번다시 결제할 필요가 없으며 약 2년간 플레이 해본결과 그 어떠한 패치도 없기때문에 여러분이 익히신 모든 기술은 훗날에도 꾸준히 통할 것입니다.

그리고 다른 유저들도 아주 친절하여 여러분이 게임에 대한 조언을 구하면 아주 친절하게 가르쳐주기도 하고 또한 인터넷에 많은 자료들이 있습니다. 한번 시작해보시면 즐겁게 플레이하실수 있을 것입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180527198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9603, 'last_played': 1571885986}
review:
As an avid tetris fan I was excited to purchase this game, I've never played Puyo-Puyo but I thought it looked fun. The two game styles sort of mix but they don't really compliment each other in a way that I was hoping. The competitive aspect of the game leaves a lot to be desired, most glaringly the stark advantage Tetris players will have over Puyo players. And I realize the game is for little kids but the story was so boring that it became a chore to even skip the dumb little cutscenes. 

I like playing Puyo and Tetris but honestly I could've saved myself the $30 and just played the browser version like I do at school.

review:
Its fun if you get past the trash matchmaking and really try to improve. It sucks in the beginning so its better to start off with a friend you don't mind losing against. Once you get into the 15k rating range it really starts to get fun, and almost nobody quits past that point.
Good luck have fun! I can't imagine myself not playing this game anymore, its insanely fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137292798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5276, 'last_played': 1616403092}
review:
このゲームで対戦する場合、テトリスだったらテトリス、ぷよだったらぷよ同士といった形で、同じもので対戦しないとバランスが悪すぎてゲームになりません。
テトリスVSぷよぷよの場合は、ハードドロップが使えるテトリス側有利とされていますが、攻撃力については圧倒的にぷよのほうが高く、バランスがおかしいことになっています。
ぷよ側が2連鎖しただけでテトリス側は、テトリスを受けたのと同じぐらいせり上がってきますし、こちらがテトリスで攻撃しても、相手が3連鎖するだけで相殺されるどころかお釣りまできます。
要は、一度でもぷよ側に連鎖を許せばテトリス側はリカバリーが不可能となります。あとはジリ貧です。
テトリス側は1度のミスすら許されず、1度でもミスすればその時点で負けが確定します。それぐらいバランスが劣悪です。
ちなみにぷよ側4連鎖でテトリス側は即死します。テトリスやT-SPINで相殺してもそのままブロックが天井を突き抜けるレベルでせり上がるので即死します。
相手の連鎖を見てからrenやT-SPIN、テトリスで反撃してももう遅いです。連鎖組まれて着火された時点で負け確定です。

ぷよテト2が発売予定されていますが、ゲーム作りが壊滅的に下手なSEGAなので、バランスの悪さは相変わらずなのでしょう。
SEGA以外の会社に作ってもらえることを祈ってます。

ネット対戦はレートが機能していないので論外。話になりません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198312338619', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1675006885}
review:
Would I recommend it?

Yes. But...
This game is more focused on Puyo puyo than on Tetris. There is endless puyo puyo, but not endless tetris. The puyo puyo challenges are more difficult than the tetris ones. For me, who bought it for tetris, because it's the only game that offers t-spins etc. on PC, it's way overpriced for the original price.

EDIT: Well, there is actually endless tetris. It's just cleverly hidden. You need to go to Solo arcade->Challenges->Marathon and there is an option called Lines, which offers two options - 150 and endless. It's not 100% endless, because unlike Endless Puyo puyo, the Endless tetris's kill screen is an actual kill screen, but that was exactly what I was searching for.

review: This is a great mashup of the two greatest realtime puzzle games. I love how I can play Tetris adepts using my superior Puyo skills, and am not forced to suffer the indignity of being bad at Tetris multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036010778', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3415, 'last_played': 1587248682}
review:
To me, this is the best official version of Tetris I have played, I don't play PuyoPuyo so can't really comment on that side of the game. The story is silly, yet charming, but I mainly play multiplayer versus friends.

I tried to play the competitive matchmaking too, but it seems that only the really hardcore players queue for it - so it's very painful for the average level player. I wouldn't say I am bad at the game by any stretch of the imagination, but I've yet to get the hang of Perfect Clears and T-Spins, unlike the majority of people who play on Puzzle League.

I guess it's great if you're an advanced player and want a challenge, but comp was not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045575660', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 6175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 73, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1712328654}
review:
본인은 테트리스만을 위해 이것을 구입했는데 싱글 진행중 뿌요뿌요를 해야하는 파트가 나와 진행이 되지 않아

약간의 아쉬움이 있다.

온라인 플레이는 일단 인풋렉이 존재하여 실망감이 크다. 그리고 몇몇 빌드를 외워야하는데 캐쥬얼한 마음으로 접근하기엔

가격대가 높다고 생각한다. 

초심자들은 정가구매를 추천하지 않으며 할인율이 제법 높게 나왔을때 구매해 놓고

뭐 다른 테트리스도 다 마찬가지겠지만

review:
I would otherwise give this game a positive review. However, there are serious problems that must be addressed.

The game lags as hell and doesn't handle packet loss and latency very well. The controls are decent when playing versus bots, but abysmal when playing online as input delay can definitely be noticed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000752379', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3035, 'last_played': 1641043445}
review:
El juego que introdujo a medio planeta a Puyo Puyo gracias a tener Tetris en el nombre.

PPT actúa como buena introducción tanto a Puyo como a Tetris moderno, tanto si conoces alguno de los dos como si no conoces ninguno de antes. Sobra decir que los personajes y la música son geniales, así como las voces tanto inglesas como japonesas. El modo historia es sorprendentemente bueno, ya que aunque no sea un argumento súper profundo, las interacciones entre los personajes son todas 10/10 (si has jugado modos historia en otros juegos de Puyo sabrás a qué me refiero).

Mi mayor queja sobre PPT (y sobre Puyo en Steam en general) es que el matchmaking en online es una completa locura, ya que es imposible jugar con gente de tu mismo nivel. A diferencia de en consolas, en Steam el juego ignora por completo el nivel del jugador a la hora de decidir con quién enfrentarte, por lo que fácilmente te podrán poner contra el mejor jugador del mundo incluso si acabas de empezar a jugar. Además, y como es natural, online está plagado de jugadores que únicamente juegan Tetris, por lo que si juegas principalmente a Puyo, lo vas a pasar mal (Tetris está en una muy fuerte ventaja con respecto a Puyo, aunque inicialmente parezca lo contrario; abajo lo explico si realmente te interesa), aparte que en escasas ocasiones encontrarás jugadores de Puyo. Para rematar, el sistema de partidas online tiene severos problemas de rendimiento, de forma que si el otro jugador tiene un PC mediocre, el bajo rendimiento de su ordenador se traslada al tuyo en un intento de sincronizar a ambos jugadores.

TLDR: Para el single player y para jugar con colegas, PPT en Steam es perfecto. Si quieres jugar online en general, mejor en consola. En cualquier caso, PPT merece totalmente la pena.

PD: Siento la necesidad imperiosa de quedar como un nerd y explicar por qué Puyo está en fuerte desventaja en este juego:
- Tetris tiene hard drop (caída instantánea de las piezas), Puyo no (por defecto)
- En Puyo, si tu pieza se parte en dos, tienes que esperar a que acabe la animación para ejecutar el siguiente movimiento (mientras Tetris sigue jugando)
- En Puyo, la recepción de basura tiene una animación que tienes que, de nuevo, esperar a que acabe de reproducirse para poder seguir jugando (de nuevo, Tetris sigue jugando). Este tiempo le permite a Tetris hacer combos en los que Puyo tan sólo puede poner una pieza entre que le caen líneas y líneas de basura
- Center 4 Wide está completa y absolutamente roto y bien ejecutado es prácticamente imposible de contrarrestar (de hecho está tan roto que hasta algunos jugadores de Tetris en otros juegos de Tetris exclusivo lo miran mal, no es una cuestión de Puyo)
- La basura en Puyo cae por encima del tablero, estorbando en tus siguientes movimientos. La basura en Tetris cae por debajo, aumentando tus movimientos especialmente en patrones como Center 4 Wide
- La basura en Puyo ocupa más que en Tetris, ya que el tablero de Puyo es más pequeño que el de Tetris

El resultado final es que aunque Puyo pueda generar más basura con movimientos cortos, Tetris tiene en general más flexibilidad, capacidad de absorción de daño y escalabilidad de sus ataques a largo plazo. Puyo tiene ventaja en ciertas situaciones (puede generar más daño de forma explosiva por ejemplo), pero contra jugadores de alto nivel Tetris suele tener la ventaja

review:
아 진짜 다른거 다좋은데
렉이 너무 심하다. 렉이 너무 심해.
진짜 심함.
그리고 유저수가 적어서 그런가 맞는 등급과 매칭이 잘 안됨.
고인물이 하도 많아서 거의 그냥 탈탈 털리는 경기 위주긴 한데
비슷한 사람과 붙으면 재밌음.
단 렉이 너무 심함. 진짜 심함. 진짜.
극심함.

review:
Habs mir nur für Tetris geholt.

Viele verschiedene Modi und einstellbarer Endlessmode für Puyo sowie für Tetris.

Online ist es für Leute, die nicht innerhalb von 3 Sekunden nen Turm bauen können, leider fast unmöglich zu gewinnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061095767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1575124692}
review:
As a solo/local multiplayer it's a pretty nice game (I mean, it's tetris/puyo), however you can't customize your joystick controls, so you'll be stuck with just a few presets.
As an online game it's quite bad. It frequently crashes upon entering multiplayer matches. However if you get lucky enough on ranked matchmaking you'll probably just end up with some real high level opponents.

review:
一人が購入していれば3人ソフトを購入していなくてもリモートプレイで4人プレイができるのがなかなかいいと思います。
誘われてリモートプレイで始めましたが、とても楽しかったので自分でも購入しました。
デフォルトで日本語に対応はしていませんが、日本語化パッチを配布している方がいるのでその方のパッチを導入してやってます。

review: Absolutely worth the cost if you are a fan of Tetris.  It can be a little difficult if you are new to get into the online scene because everyone left is a veteran of the game, but the story mode is still fun and challenging and it is a good starting game for any new tetris or puyo players to learn and hone their skills in the offline modes and then attempting to work their way through online ranked.  Besides the online scene, the game is incredibly well made, very smooth and nice to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866754103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1694727067}
review:
이 게임은 진짜 시간 떄우기 너무 좋은 겜입니다. 
나름 손 풀기에도 좋고 특히 저사양이라 어디서든 즐기수 있죠. 하지만 딱 한가지 문제점을 말하자면, 다른 온라인 사람들과 붙을때 너무 고인물들 이랑 붙습니다, 아무리 당신이 초보여도 말이죠. 한마디로 랭킹 레이팅 시스템이 정확한 역할을 해주지 못하고 있다는겁니다. 
이점만 고치면 너무나 좋은 게임인거 같습니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043071848', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 13314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9112, 'last_played': 1683726721}
review:
게임 하나로 뿌요뿌요랑 테트리스를 즐길 수 있습니다.
뿌요든 테트든 하나 붙잡고 진득이 할 수 있는 분들에게 몹시 추천합니다.
캐릭터별로 인공지능 난이도 차이가 있어서 조금씩 수준 올려가며 연습할 수 있고, 일반 인공지능들을 다 정복했다면 패드의 L1 버튼을 누른 채 선택하면 강화 인공지능과 게임할 수도 있으니 굳이 대인전 안해도 오래 즐길 수 있습니다.

로컬 멀티플레이를 하기 위해서 컨트롤러를 연결하거나 가상 컨트롤러 프로그램을 사용해야하는 건 아쉽습니다.

그리고 시그가 귀여워

author: {'steamid': '76561198071241478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5744, 'last_played': 1609932686}
review: Despite I love PPT, either for its art style and how it combines tetris and puyopuyo into pvp battles, I must say this is the worst game for newcomers for either puyopuyo or tetris because of the price and the lack of player base(especially for rookie players). You will constantly face top players even if you are at the lowest rank. Go for Puyo Puyo Champions if you want to learn puyo, and literally any modern tetris game like Tetris99 will do the trick. I only recommend this game if you are moderately skilled at either puyo and tetris and you are really in love with puyo matching tetris (and vice versa).

author: {'steamid': '76561198806412151', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 22657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18784, 'last_played': 1708535152}
review:
솔직히 게임서버가 안좋은건 맞습니다
그래도 게임이 재미가없는것은 아닙니다. 여러가지 빌드도있고 점점 쌓는 속도가 빨라지는 나의 모습을 보면서 만족감이나 실력이 늘었다는 성취감도 얻을 수 있고,랭킹시스템으로 자신이 얼마나 잘해졌는지 확인할 수 도있어서 좋다고생각합니다.고인물게임이니 뭐니 솔직히 게임에 안고인게임이 어딨습니까
열심히해서 이길생각이나해야지 '아 다 너무 고여서 못이김 그냥 안함' 이러는건 그냥 끈기가부족한겁니다.
노력만하면 충분히 해볼만한게임입니다

author: {'steamid': '76561198085749649', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6969, 'last_played': 1676164585}
review:
Great game, very fun to play, has Japanese voices available unlike the Switch version.

The game follows the Tetris guidelines very closely (except 1 very hard to reproduce bug), 12 frames DAS and 2 frames ARR (200 ms DAS and around 33ms ARR), if you spin a piece too much (15 times I think?) it goes down by one and locks into place, the SRS is implemented perfectly and the low gravity and lock delay make it easy to build even when you're at the top of the screen.

The matchmaking is very bad, there is a rating system and a rank system but none of these are used, you just get matched up randomly with whoever is online, and since there aren't tons of players, you'll start to get avoided by a lot of them if you're too weak/too strong, it's still easy to find a game in less than 20 seconds most of the time though, but if you're looking for an opponent at your level you might have to wait like 30 minutes.
If someone is afk in the queue, they will block you, usually the best to do is to wait for them to exit it, I guess that resetting a lot might could allow you find another player doing the same as you but it might take a long time.

Now about modern Tetris, I won't explain the rules but some things have to be noted. The first one is that the opener is very important, it's an enormous amount of free lines sent if you do it properly and it sets your board for the next part of the game. If you mess up here you're most likely dead. The worst opener to deal with is clearly the 4-wide opener, you need to get a lot of lines out really fast to stop them from stacking too high and sending an enormous combo to your face. If that happens you're basically dead and there is absolutely no counterplay which is probably why a lot of people hate this opener. Fortunately, not many people actually 4-wide you, I'd say only 1/5th of players or less do that.
Overall Tetris is very competitive and based a lot on speed, precision, knowledge, and pattern recognition, and is the reason why I bought this game. You also tend to improve faster against more skilled players since they force you to play faster in order not to die, though the ones which are the best at openers will definitely kill you within the first 30 seconds no matter what you do (these are not many though). To end this, I'd like to talk about perfect clear openers, these are really strong against lower skilled players and can end the game in less than 10 seconds, not even kidding. Against faster players, they are a nuisance but can be dealt with by downstacking well, but since the holes are not very split, it will often be about doing a lot of tetrises, which means that you'll most likely have to do T-spins at the top of the screen to survive first.

I won't talk much about Puyo since I'm not a Puyo player, all I can say is that the only way to properly beat a Puyo player is a constant damage input with absolutely no stop, otherwise you can welcome a 7-chain or more that will instantly accompany you to the top of the screen

Optimization wise (or netplay I don't know), when you get 4-wided, or at least when the other combos a lot, the game starts dropping a lot of inputs and if you're not very attentive you're definitely gonna misdrop and die. It really is a pain in the ass and I'm sure it could have been fixed a long time ago if the devs actually cared about the PC version since this doesn't happen on Switch.

I'd recommand buying this game if you want to have some fun playing Tetris, doing the campaign and especially if you like the characters, voice lines, graphic design, I also heavily recommand this game if you like both Puyo Puyo and Tetris.

Tetorisu Ikimasu

author: {'steamid': '76561198027987749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1610572299}
review:
Me and my family offten kill some time with puyo puyo tetris,  as far I researched best tetris on market.
Its good family game.  I recommend it.

Only 2 issues I got with this game: 
1. Im old school gameboy tetris guy. so  my brain didnt evolved for those new age tetris rules. Im brain dead for t-block combos throu gaps,  (I watched tutorials, I still cannot put any t-block throu other bricks and those mutiplayers kids do it like champs, their entire tactic is evolved around this while my brain is dead for this), this wasnt possible in classic tetris. 
Maybe make multiplayer mode with classic tetris rules without this t-brick combos?  

2. Multiplayer (only hardcore guys play it), not funny when you are rank 90k on ladderboard and you get pited vs guy who is 500th    (loses vs those guys makes you feel bad, because you getting outclassed to oblivion)   Imagine piting Manchester united vs. local redneck village club , thats exactly how multiplayer feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378349148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2636, 'last_played': 1690384657}
review:
一つのソフトでぷよぷよとテトリスの両方を遊べるのでおススメ。モードも恐らく充実してる。(40ラインのタイムアタックやコンピューターとのエンドレス対戦等)ただしオンライン対戦も考えるのなら評価は下がる。理由は以下の通り。


マッチングシステムの問題。
マッチングシステムが機能しておらず、やり始めのレートは２０００であるのに、普通に２００００前後のレートの人と簡単に当たる。逆に言えばすぐに強い人と対戦できるので、ぷよぷよまたはテトリスに相当自信のある方は逆におススメできる。


人口の問題。
フリー対戦の所に入ると、左下にオンラインの人数が表示されているが多くても２５０人超えてるかどうか。もっとも時間帯によってさらに多い時もあるかもしれないが、私は多くてその人数しか見たことがない。一番肝心なランキング戦？ではそんな表記はないので、同じ人とよくマッチングすることや、フリー対戦で部屋がないあっても一つか二つである事を考えれば、フリー対戦の表示はランキング戦にいる人も含んでの人数かもしれない。


ラグの問題。
オンライン対戦でラグが発生する。特にテトリスならブロックを消してキャラが声を上げる時。慣れれば問題はないが、そのせいで置きミスがある場合も。設定で回線の相性？悪い？相手とマッチングしないように設定はできるが、元から人口が少ないのにそんな事すればもうお分かりかと。


以上から一人で遊ぶのであれば非常におススメできる反面。オンライン対戦も考えるのならおススメできない。人口が増えて欲しいので多くの人にやってもらいたいが。


ただ、ランキング戦で勝てない、勝てなさそうな相手とマッチングすればペナルティ無しで退出できるので、粘れば似たような実力の人とマッチングできるのでどうしてもPC版じゃないとと言う人は買っても良いかと。ただし、退出した際は最低でも５秒してから再度マッチングを。そうでなければほぼ同じ人とまたマッチングするので。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970711212', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1567027475}
review:
Your enjoyment from this game will depend largely on your love of BOTH Tetris and Puyo Puyo.

For those looking to purchase this game because you love one, but are not fussed about the other, will likely grow frustrated with the main campaign mode, as you are often switching between the two, and never really feel like you are playing a settled game and getting in to a rhythm.

The story of the main campaign is a load of guff (what did you expect?) but a game like this is much better when it comes to Multiplayer.

There are a few modes to choose between, and all of them can be fun, but the amount of fun you can get out of the game will also depend on your level of skill. There are some very good players out there, and being paired with someone who is clearly much better than you will have you punching your monitor in no time.

Best for: Fans of BOTH games

author: {'steamid': '76561198342784544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1601224113}
review:
Un jeu dynamique, au gameplay très riche, encore faut t-il s'intéresser un minimum au puzzle games (et s'y investir)! 
La fusion de Tetris et de Puyo est un vrai régal, surtout en versus ! Cette version est archi complète, propose énormément de modes un peu plus casual où tout le monde peut s'y amuser !
Cependant, le online semble désert, et c'est très frustrant de se retrouver constamment face à des monstres faute de nouveaux joueurs, il n'y a aucune prise en compte du ranking...
Je recommande, mais uniquement si vous avez des bons potes avec qui doser le jeu, si vous êtes tout seul, c'est cool aussi, mais vous pouvez oubliez le online ! (ou alors être très patient lors des matchmaking)

review:
HARD AS HELL!!!!!!!!!

BE WARNED! This may look kid friendly, but any child, and I do mean ANY child WILL be throwing a temper-tantrum because of how difficult this game can get. I am warning you now, this game is BRUTAL! Specifically, the adventure mode has a LOT of unfair CPU difficulty spikes, specifically, Ecolo, the boss I am STILL, after TWO HOURS am STILL trying to beat. The game's mechanics are fun. The character art is cute and adorable, and I LOVE the music. The game performs well on ANY system. Hell, a POTATO could run this game, making it extremely accessible if you're limited by the tech you're using. HOWEVER, be sure you are ready to deal with a late-game difficulty spike. It's sudden, unfair and WILL relentlessly kick your ass like no tomorrow and without mercy. There are no difficulty settings because this game is trying to train you for the online mode, which is fine, but all I want to do is unlock the other characters. 

Oh yeah... There's plenty of unlockables here. Characters, stages, credits, etc. There's also NO MICROTRANSACTIONS, at least as far as I am aware. But just being microtransaction-free is a MAJOR plus in my book. 

Overall, it's cute, brutal, but still pretty fun, despite the somewhat unfair difficulty spikes.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198106939391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 9232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4122, 'last_played': 1616348417}
review:
What a lovely combination of two great puzzle series. This game is a must for all who love tetris/puyo/puzzle games. But if you like playing online, this ain't for you. Let's explore the ups and downs of the game (+, +/-, -):

+Tetris and Puyo = simple and awesome gameplay.
+It's very addictive, in a positive way.
+The characters are colorful, strange, funny and well designed. That's not much in this game, but it's still a positive.
+The colors are damn great. The game looks lovely.
+Various game modes provide something for everyone. It's also easy to customize matches.
+There is a story mode! It's fun, but strange...
+/-...and not always in a good way. So much randomness and geekiness.
+/-Sometimes, the game almost crashes, but doesn't. You'll definitely notice the slowdown thou.
-Online modes suck. To me, this is nothing; I don't play online because I don't like it. And even if I did, I would be paired with people "1000 levels" above me. That happens to everyone, I am not that special. Also, the game crashes in the mode from time to time. In short, online mode is a small hell in a golden game.

Puyo Puyo™Tetris® is the best Puyo or Tetris game available on Steam. It's a great game you don't want to stop playing. Buy this game and enjoy our addiction... but don't go online. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005097380', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1572029549}
review:
I've liked the Puyo Puyo franchise for a long time.
My first exposure to the franchise was back in the Sega Mega Drive II days. I was a kid, I had just started grade school, and on my 6th birthday I received the Sega Mega Drive II as a present from my parents. It was a bundle of console and a game: it came with the cartridge of Sonic Collection, which included Sonic, Sonic 2, and Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine.
Now, I had already played Sonic a couple times on my uncle's console at that time, so I knew the game (and I liked it), and the fact that it had a sequel wasn't surprising to me (bear in mind, I was a kid in the 90s with no access to Internet or videogames information: I didn't know there was a sequel, it just wasn't surprising) but I knew nothing about the third game of the set, and reading "Machine" in the title I thought it would be a racing game.
Well, cue my surprise when it turned out to be a puzzle game. Most surprisingly, though, was the fact that it ended up being my biggest time sink on the SMD2.
I didn't have much experience with puzzle games up to that point, just some Tetris on friends' Game Boys (I wouldn't have a Game Boy of my own until a few years later, when Pokémon came out, and even then still no Tetris on Game Boy for me), but it truly got me hooked. There was something addicting about the gameplay for me, even as a kid, and I actually really liked the bgm a lot, so sometimes I would just play to hear the music while playing.
Fastforward to the Game Cube era, Puyo Pop Fever came out to the West, and I managed to eventually buy a copy a few years later; it wasn't an easy game to find around here, so it had to wait for when I finally had Internet and a prepaid credit card. I loved the fever mode, and spent hours in the endless fever.
I liked the game so much I ended up double dipping and I bought in on the Nintendo DS as well, so I could play it on the go when I felt like it.
Some time later, a sequel came out... only in Japan. And then other Puyo games came out, but they never made it over here.
I eventually ended up importing a Japanese 2DS to play Chronicles (got the limited edition with the OST included on day 1), though it wasn't quite to my taste (the puzzling itself was too simplistic in the story mode).
Then, news of Puyo Puyo Tetris came out, and it also was slated for a western release. Needless to say, I was delighted.
I bought the Switch version at launch, and when it was released on Steam I ended up double dipping.
If you've been reading up to now, you'll realise I've been digging this franchise for a good while, so you might want to take my review with a grain of salt, but I believe this is a strong entry in the series. It has to offer the best in Puyo and it comes with Tetris, and the Swap and Fusion modes are a nice twist, though I still find Fusion to be quite confusing; Swap's a blast, on the other hand.
If you're into puzzle games, this one's definitely a top pick. It has something for everyone, from the Puyo enthusiast that's been playing for years, down to the casual gamer that has only played Tetris every now and then.
The Story mode lets you get familiar with the various game modes at a good pace, with an increasing challenge, and the Arcade mode lets you simply play what you feel like playing, ranging from the good ol' infinite puyo, down to Big Bang mode, which is a blast (and Tetris Big Bang is even more addicting and fast paced than Puyo's Fever mode).
The biggest downside is that the online multiplayer is generally empty nowadays, but back in my days online wasn't an option to begin with.
Overall, yes, I wholeheartedly recommend this game; whether I'm too biased or not is up to the reader to decide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040483651', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1567582426}
review:
This game has a lot of annoyances and quirks, especially for having such a large online competitive scene. It feels like they built this game for a very casual audience, and once the entire game was built, they decided it was simple enough to add Puzzle League too. Still, it's one of the most popular places to play ranked tetris games competitively online on PC (even if better un-official games exist) so the community is absolutely the biggest reason I bought this game.

This part is just ranting about details, feel free to skip all this and just read the last bit. The game is locked at 60fps, which is a little ridiculous for a modern competitive game released in 2018, in the age of consumer 240hz monitors. If they didn't want reviews to say that, then they shouldn't be advertising Puzzle League on the store page. And it also sets your monitor to 60hz too! If you have a high-refresh rate screen, you have to alt+tab out and back in to force your monitor into its native refresh rate. But then when you do that, the game seems to set itself into windowed-borderless-fullscreen mode even if you set it to regular fullscreen in the settings, so now my adaptive refresh rate isn't kicking in anymore. So that causes much more inconsistent frame times to the eye, and slightly higher latency. There are a ton more small details like this that all add together and drive me a bit crazy.   
On a high-resolution display, the game still appears to be rendering almost everything (even text) in 1080p? the edges are fuzzy and have visible aliasing artifacts everywhere. For a completely 2D game!   
When you change some of the settings, and try to move to a different settings tab, it gives you a prompt saying "your changes haven't been saved...." with a yes/no button. In every other program I've ever used, "yes" will save and "no" will discard. Well this game is the opposite for some reason, it's actually asking if you want to discard your changes. Also why do I have to save my keyboard controls before I'm allowed to even look at my gamepad controls?  
When you first start up the game, multiplayer mode is locked at first. But it doesn't tell you what you need to do to to unlock it?! Why do I have to pull up google for something like that.  
The constant voice clips when you clear a line get pretty irritating pretty quickly in my opinion. But I can just mute the game. But basically all the youtube clips of this game are extremely annoying to listen to, too!  
There are little animations that play when you clear a line. they block your name tag and mostly block your score. So the fastest players (where you're most likely to want to see their name or their score) have their details hidden about 85% of the time or more.  
There are a lot more things like this that I've noticed, but it's hard to remember them all for a review. Just know that this game made no attempt to be perfect....

To be clear this game isn't garbage or anything. If you're younger, just getting into Tetris/Puyo Puyo, and enjoy comics, then this game's adventure mode will probably be well suited for you. But if you're buying it to compete online, don't expect this game to be as well-polished for competitive play as other games are. But whatever, I can live with it.
