author: {'steamid': '76561198150215535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2156, 'last_played': 1631917544}
review:
First, I got addicted to the Puyo Puyo minigame in Sonic Mania.  Then I played a bunch of Kirby's Avalanche to try a real Puyo Puyo game. Then finally, I got this game.  I got it mainly for Puyo Puyo, but it has Tetris in there as a bonus.

The controls for Puyo Puyo are very responsive, far better than the early games in the series.  You can precisely place your pieces even when the action gets to the top of the playfield.  There is no Hard Drop button though.

Played around in the online mode, sometimes I can even beat the Tetris players with ratings of 10000+, even though I'm not all that good at Puyo Puyo.

Using an Intel GPU, the game has some framerate issues.  I needed to turn off Vsync to get 60FPS, and the game runs the computer hot.

Sometimes there are issues with matchmaking.  You sometimes get matched with someone who doesn't start playing, then you go out, then go back in, and the person is still there.  You need to wait a minute before they're gone.

Now the bad:  There is no good VS CPU mode at all.  Only online against other players.  Most online players play Tetris, and if you find a Puyo Puyo player, chances are they are a pro who gets 6+ combos without breaking a sweat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071865132', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1605991306}
review:
[i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] is a mismash of two iconic and fun puzzle games in their own right, and while the game in general is fun, with colorful and cute presentation, I initially gave this game 
 a "Not Recommended" mainly due to the overall lacking online component but after giving it some more time, I've enjoyed it enough to the point where I can recommend the game in light of that problem. If you care mainly about single-player or just playing locally with friends, then there's little concern to be had with buying this game, as single-player is fun, even though you could get bored really fast if you're very good at the game, since the CPU opponents may prove unchallenging, or you may find the story mode going on for too long.

If you care more about playing online than the lengthy single-player story, or maybe you lack friends to play with. In that case you can play online via [b]Puzzle League[/b] (a ranked matchmaking mode) [b]Free Play[/b] (an online lobby mode) or by inviting friends. However, the former two modes will likely offer a very inconsistent experience, and is the reason why I initially gave this game a thumbs-down review. There are [b]usually only a few hundred players online at any given time[/b], meaning that while it is possible to find matches with players around your skill level, it may take a while to find them, and in between that time you can expect to find some of the best players around, who can defeat you very quickly if you do not have a decent grasp of either game type. The pro players will also often leave if they see your rank is very low, which can make it even harder to find matches. If you have some guts, and patience, sticking around for a while, taking some beatings along the way, can reward you with more balanced matches later on. But if you are very new to either competitive Puyo or Tetris, online will be very unforgiving and could discourage you quickly. Most of the players will be Tetris users too, as it seems that Tetris has a higher skill cap than Puyo; for solely Puyo players like myself, Puzzle League will be a great challenge.

If you love either of the two classic puzzle games here, and you couldn't care less for multiplayer unless it's with friends, this game is almost a sure bet. I bought it mainly for the online play and I was dismayed at first, but grew to be more patient, and I've found more than a handful of good matches, even against players ranked much higher than me. If you were curious about this game for the multiplayer, too, if you're not prepared for some serous pain mixed in with the fun, then it's a little bit harder to recommend, so be careful.

[b]Pros:[/b]

- Colorful, vibrant presentation

- Tetris and Puyo Puyo are fun games and mostly replicated well

- Many game types for both single-player and multiplayer, including a lengthy and challenging story mode

- Very easy to navigate through menus and pick up and play

- Puyo vs. Tetris is balanced, albeit in a strange way; Puyo can be much easier to learn but Tetris is very rewarding at higher skill levels

[b]Cons:[/b]

- While online play can be fun, the small online playerbase makes playing in Puzzle League *very* inconsistent, as you can easily get matched with top players or completely new ones, and finding a game in Free Play is tough as well

- Voice acting is cute and adds a lot of personality, but can get grating at times

- Difficulty curve is steep due to the somewhat lacking tutorials and very high skill ceiling, which may discourage newer players

- Controls cannot be completely re-mapped to your preference; instead there's only a few presets

- You may encounter varying degrees of slowdown

- Nearly impossible to find people you played with, unless they're on a top spot in the leaderboards, since the game doesn't work with Steam's Recent Players feature

author: {'steamid': '76561198113169152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1548276931}
review: Как ярый фанат всей серии игр ожидал от этого "коллаба" чего-то большего. Серьезно, я знал, чего можно ожидать от puyo puyo, то огромное количество режимов, с которым игроки встречались в 15 или 20 годовщине, вспомнив даже про режим SUN 1996 года. Постоянно создавались клевые режимы, постоянно что-то улучшалось.  А здесь..? Да, здорово, сочетание двух игр в одной, несколько вариаций одного и того же режима игры, причем самого стандартного. Локализация оставляет желать лучшего, имхо.  На удивление, даже мобильная пазл рпг вышла гораздо лучше. Надеюсь, что sega выпустит что-то интереснее в будущем. Ну и, не знаю, проблема ли это исключителньно у меня, у игроков в рф, но пвп работает только мировое с рейтингом, в остальных показывает стабильно много народу онлайн, но ни одной комнаты не отображается. Действительно очень расстроен, денег своих не стоит, как по мне. Сделал запрос на возврат средств.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066182603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1547862622}
review:
Leider muss ich dem Spiel eine negative Rezension geben für meine Sicht. Je nach Anforderung an das Spiel würde ich aber auch eine Kaufempfehlung abgeben:
- Wenn du Single Player und Tetris oder Puyo Puyo magst: Kaufe es!
- Wenn du online oder mit Freunden an einem PC (max 1 Spieler an der Tastatur!) spielen magst: Kauf es, wenn du ein Gamepad hast.
- Wenn du Online gegen fremde spielen willst und ein krasser Experte bist, kaufe es und stelle dich der Herausforderung
- Wenn du als Anfänger online spielen willst (so wie ich), kaufe es nicht!

Der Grund: Jedes Match gegen Fremde war extrem unbalanced! Ich musste mal gegen Platz 2 weltweit, mal gegen Platz ~500 Weltweit, mal gegen Platz ~2000 weltweit spielen, was erstens überhaupt keinen Spaß macht und zweitens nach ca 20 Sekunden schon vorbei ist.
Entweder spielen nur noch die ganz krassen Freaks dieses Spiel oder das Matchmaking funktioniert überhaupt nicht.
Ihr müsst euch das so vorstellen dass ich als Anfänger für die Platzierung des ersten Steins schon ca 3 Sekunden brauche, während so ein Platz xxxx weltweit in 3-5 Sekunden schon sein erstes Tetris macht, wodurch ich einige Strafsteine bekomme. Das ist wirklich nicht übertrieben. Diese Pros knallen locker 3 Steine pro Sekunde runter die perfekt ausgerichtet  und platziert sind.
Ich habe ja auch grundsätzlich nichts gegen solche Spieler, aber ich als Anfänger möchte doch bitte gegen andere Anfänger spielen und nicht gegen den zweitbesten Spieler weltweit. Selbst wenn das Matchmaking erstmal "lernen" muss wie gut ich bin, sicherlich muss es sich nicht die Spieler von ganz oben zuerst nehmen. Online Spielspaß war daher nicht vorhanden, obwohl ich das Konzept des Spiels wirklich gut finde.
Ich werde das Spiel leider wieder zurückgeben, da ich Single Player langweilig finde. Ich schließe aber nicht aus, dem Spiel irgendwann nochmal eine Chance zu geben. Wäre schön, wenn ich mein Review dann bearbeiten kann :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198103852002', 'num_games_owned': 1557, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1547857398}
review: No real AI difficulty settings (only a "handicap") mean the game is impossibly frustrating and difficult for novice players while also trivially easy for Puyo Puyo or Tetris experts. I remember playing the original Puyo Puyo on the SNES and it was accessible for all ages, the same of course is true for Tetris; I'm not sure who Sega is catering for here but with this difficulty it certainly doesn't include children. Why do characters determine difficulty and not a simple user setting?

author: {'steamid': '76561198121846263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2618, 'last_played': 1577784947}
review:
뿌요는 안해봐서 모르겠고 테트리스가 하고싶은 사람들은 사지마십시오. 존나 븅1신같은 게임입니다.
1일단 좌우로 움직이는 속도-das가 존나 쳐 느려서 꾹 누르는거보다 연타로 가는게 더 빠를정돕니다. 소프트 드랍은 말할것도 없겠죠?
2두 번째로 서버가 존나 개병1신입니다. 누가보면 뿌요나 테트리스가 존나 무거운 게임인줄 알겠음. 서버가 병1신이면 님은 평소랑 똑같이 입력을해도 테트리미노는 다르게 움직입니다. 렉이 좀 눈에 보일정도로 심한판에서는 느낄수있겠지만 이게임은 공격을 보낼때, 받을때 전부 렉이걸립니다. 렉이 걸리면 내가 방향을 바꾸고 내렸는데도 아무것도 안움직이는 기적을 보실 수 있습니다.
3애미뒤진 포와이드들이 너무 많습니다. 이새끼들은 즐겜하는척하다가 질거같은 상대 만나면 바로 돌변해서 포와이드를 시전합니다. 포와 악용하는 이 새끼들이 문제인건 맞는데 렌공격이 존나 강력하다는걸 알면서도 방치하는 뿌테운영진이 더 나쁜새끼들입니다.

모쪼록 테트리스가 하고싶은 여러분들 이 개같이 비싼게임 사지마시고 가족이랑 치킨을 사드시길 바랍니다. 너무 궁금하다싶으시면 사셨다가 2시간 전에 환불하세요. 아마 환불하라고 안해도 환불하시고 싶으실겁니다. 테트리스가 하고싶으시면 폴란드 테트리스를 하시길 추천드립니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094626853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1546435723}
review:
[h1]A Divorce Due To Irreconcilable Differences[/h1]
[b]and It Hurts to give this reivew [/b]

As a Tetris and Puyo Puyo fan, this game had been sitting in my wish list for a long time. In a cold winter night in 2018 between the candy canes and fried chicken coupons, I finally took this game back to my cozy cabin during the Steam Winter Sale. "It's going to be a super fun and exciting night," I said to my nerdy self.

[b]Marriage of Bad Port & Bad Computer[/b]
Sadly, it had taken me 5-6 tries each time just to open the game, not to mention that it would crash midway during different modes. No it didn't have the gumption to even give me any error messages to troubleshoot, so I tried anyway to look up a fix on the discussion forums but nothing worked. 

Don't get me wrong though, because the different modes and gameplay were enjoyable WHEN I got to run. But at this rate, even at a discounted Canadian price of $16-17 bucks is still too much for having a game that crashes more than 10x within an hour. Yes I'm being super lenient--I want to like it and I REALLY wanted it to work but alas, I had to refund it. 

If you are looking for North American retro Tetris vibe, you most definitely wouldn't get it since the game leans more towards the Puyo Puyo vibe with anime critters. On the other hand, the sounds and gameplay both emit strong echoes of casual Asian Arcade vibe when you play it, and you get to choose your own mode and battle style (Tetris tiles, Puyo Puyo blobz or a mix of both).  It can still be fun if your computer runs it. 

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
If you wish to get the game, I'd recommend that you'd browse the discussion forum for potential errors, bugs, or troubles so you'd be mentally prepared to encounter them. Meanwhile, I will have to give this a "don't take my money" recommendation and it hurts. Maybe I will give it a try again in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205251197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9446, 'last_played': 1700175005}
review:
ぷよぷよ好きもテトリス好きも楽しめるゲームです。
オンライン人口はそこそこいるので、初心者でも中級者でもマッチングに困ることはありません。（絶対勝てないなーという人もいっぱいいるので、多分上級者でも困らないでしょう）
初心者でもオンライン対戦で徐々に上達することができます。
ただ、実力差のあるマッチングも発生するので、その時は、マッチング回避するか大金星狙ってギャンブルしましょう。

元々ぷよぷよプレイヤーでテトリスは初めてでしたが、少しずつ練習してテトリスでもある程度勝てるようになりました。

キャラクター数も充実していて、キャラ選択、連鎖やREN、勝利や敗北でキャラがしゃべってくれます。
画質もきれいです。（昔やってたぷよぷよと比較したらびっくりしました）

一勝負10分未満で終わるので、いつでも楽しめます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198198041682', 'num_games_owned': 38, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 17289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10779, 'last_played': 1684366993}
review: 90% of negative reviews are by scrubs complaining about how they got matched with 10K's in puzzle league. Pretty fun to play, but I would only recommend if you've played either tetris or puyo puyo before (as the game isn't very good for a new tetris player, in my opinion, and the game has taught me nothing about puyo and I'm still pure garbage at it.) However, this game isn't perfect. Many bugs exist, including one that makes puzzle league rating meaningless. Imput delay is also a huge problem, and has probably lost me a good 40 puzzle league matches by now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163172667', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1651122196}
review:
I would not reccomend this game for people who aren't good at either puyo puyo or tetris. That is unless you're ok with getting completely desetroyed by the ai cause the game seems to take the i'll teach you by making you suffer route. I'm better than the average story mode ai at tetris, but I get completly decimated at puyo. I would say to avoid buying this game unless you like a big challenge, or you already have good skills in at least one of the two games.


(Edit) I encountered fusion mode for the first time and it's terrible, like avoid it XD. My pc was lagging so hard that it would freeze for a few seconds if either the ai or I got too ambitious with the amount of garbage we were sending over

author: {'steamid': '76561198054987356', 'num_games_owned': 948, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 10809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1993, 'last_played': 1637973170}
review:
Very fun and colorful dual puzzle game combining the basic elements of Puyo Puyo following the Tsu format and Guideline Tetris. If you enjoy either of those two series this is a must buy game but it's very likely you already own it.

For the uninitiated, even novices to Tetris or Puyo Puyo (recognizable in the west as Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine and Kirby's Avalanche), this competitive puzzle fighter has the benefit of being a relaxing and fresh experience for those pursuing a comforting expereince and an engagning multiplayer expereince for the more competitively focused. These two games are the grand daddies of puzzle games for a good reason. 

Buy on any system you find most convenient.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987798399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1640520877}
review:
La réalisation générale de ce jeu est très très propre.
Que ce soit Tetris ou Puyo Puyo c'est du tout bon.
Le gameplay devient très difficile à maîtriser avec des alternances de phase TETRIS/PUYO et là je peux vous dire que le bal commence et il faudra faire appel à toutes vos ressources intellectuelles pour venir à bout du mode aventure.
Le jeu vous demandera toujours plus, d'aller puiser dans votre logique, votre self control, votre malice et même dans votre capital de chance.
Je suis bloqué à 15% du mode aventure et le jeu est impitoyable mais il faut perséverer.
De plus il est possible de jouer jusqu'à quatre en local simultanément, on peu choisir son style (PUYO / TETRIS) ou se confronter dans des modes alternatifs bien pensés. On peut dévérouiller tout un tas de secrets (Niveaux / Personnages / Sons / ETC).
Il y a même un mode online.
Une réussite totale, un sans faute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797757684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 38975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19252, 'last_played': 1625046573}
review:
様々なプラットフォームで発売されているゲームです。その名の通り、「ぷよぷよ」と「テトリス」を両方楽しむことができます。さらに、有志によって(一部)日本語化ができるので、英語が多少読めなくても安心です。しかしながら、残念なことにいくつかバグと思われる箇所が、あちらこちらで報告されています。なおパッチも半年以上出ていないようです。

ネタバレ(？)になりますが、[spoiler]ストーリーモードを全てクリアすると、一部のキャラクターのボイスチェンジが開放される仕組み(だったはず)ですが、このゲームを再インストールしない限り反映されない、つまりボイスチェンジを使いたいなら手間がかかる模様です。[/spoiler]これ以外にもボタンの(細かい)判定や昇格 / 降格判定のミス(例：昇格戦に買ったのにリーグが上がらない)などが挙げられます。

みなさんも言及しているオンライン対戦についてですが、確かに格上(格下)のプレイヤーと当たることがたまにあります。お互いが気持ちよく対戦できないので、なんとかならないかというところ。ちなみにオンラインは(日本時間の)夜で300~400人ほど。また、ぷよぷよの新作が発売されたのもあるのか、テトリス勢の方が多い印象。

以上の理由から、PCでプレイしたい重大な理由がない限りは、他のプラットフォームのを購入するのを推奨します。ただし、ゲーム性については評価できますので、もし興味があったら…

author: {'steamid': '76561198021021584', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1672331792}
review:
Puyo Puyo™Tetris® стоит кажой потраченой копейки! 699 рублей за Тетрис и Пуё Пуё, пусть даже и вместе? Я люблю тетрис с детсва, когда играл в него на устройстве под названием Brick Game 9999 in 1.  В игре нет минусов. Режим истории, режим для одного, локальный мультиплеер, онлайн мультиплеер, магазин для покупки озвучек персонажей, внешнего вида Тетрамино и Пуё Пуё. Видов игры тоже предостаточно! Обычный: Versus, где вы вольны выбирать играть в Тетрис или Пуё Пуё.  Fusion: совместная игра в Пуё Пуё и Тетрис в одном стакане (это когда иногда сверху падают Тетрамино и давят своим весом Пуё Пуё)! Swap: где режимы Тетрис и Пуё Пуё меняются через определённое время.  Party: в нём, в ваш стакан выпадают кубики с негативными эффектами для пративника. Играете вы в Тетрис или Пуё Пуё, главное уничтожать ряд или Пуё Пуё рядом с кубиком бонуса. Big Bang: в нём вам нужно на скорость, быстрее противника, правильно ставить либо Тетрамино, либо Пуё Пуё, по вашему выбору.  Challenge: проверте, как хорошо вы играете в Тетрис или Пуё Пуё. 
Играть вместе, за одним экраном- это здорово! 
Если вам нравится Тетрис, то вам ещё и в Пуё Пуё поиграть возможность есть. Играйте с друзьями , отдыхая, или тренируйте своё умение и потейте, пытаясь сделать Т-спин и большое комбо! 
Игре ставлю 10 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090765334', 'num_games_owned': 1278, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1671264870}
review:
List TIme Kids!

Pros +: Art Style will age well
        +: Voice Acting is good
        +: Game Runs at 60 FPS
        +: A good game to go VS with friends
        +: Easy to Learn, Hard to Master
        +: Gives you tips here & there to make the game a bit easier (it gets harder than it looks)

Cons -: The Game can be unforgiving at times, so I suggest you always warm up before doing the story
          -: When you Alt + Tab the game sometimes may crash
          -: The Game was a bit overpriced, I think it should sell for $10, I bought my copy on Amazon
          -: The Keyboard controls are awkward, use an Xbox Controller to get the full intended experience
           -:Single Player at times can flat out be unfair

I Give it a Solid 8.7/10 IGN

author: {'steamid': '76561198376741409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2614, 'last_played': 1573389241}
review:
様々なプラットフォームでリリースされているこのタイトル。
他の機種を持っていないわたしが唯一プレイできたのはこのsteam版。

先行予約するほど期待に満ち溢れていたが
いざ蓋を開けてみると、オンライン対戦でのバグが多いやらなんのやら...
現在では大きく改善されているものの、いまだにレート差10,000でマッチングなんて当たり前
(人口が少ないから多少はしょうがないけれど)

とはいえ前述したとおり、現在PCでできるぷよぷよはこれだけなので
みなさん安い時に買って私とぷよぷよしましょう！

author: {'steamid': '76561198061721437', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 20423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1709599654}
review:

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198050411574', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1628077942}
review:
재미는 있는데 온라인플레이 두번째 매칭에서 세계 50위를 매칭하질 않나 레이팅 시스템이 왜 있는건지 매칭을 좆으로함
10시간을 넘게 해도 레이팅 신경 안쓰고 전세계권 10자리수 안 사람들이랑 매칭하는건 같음
온라인으로 하고싶은 청정수들은 절대 사지말고 뿌요나 테트좀 해봤다 해도 서버상태 병신이니까 사는건 깊게 고려하세요
온라인은 5판중에 한판정도 꼴로 입력이 씹힌다거나 줄이 안없어진다거나 하는 화나는 상황이 자주있음
아니 유비소프트 게임들은 좀 복잡하기라도 하지 왜 이렇게 간단한 뿌요뿌요 테트리스에서도 랙이 이렇게 심한건지
파티게임, 접대용으로 살거면 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561198118665799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1533873476}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris is the ultimate game for any Puyo, Tetris or Puzzle game enthusiast. The gameplay feels smooth, responsive and great to play. 

I absolutely adored the amount of effort put into making this game look bright, cartoony, and fun - something which Tetris games have lacked in recent releases.

It is important to note that although there are single and multiplayer options for original Tetris and Puyo Puyo, the main campaign mode of the game requires players to become gradually proficient in both puzzle game types, rather than specialisation in just the one.

However, Puyo Puyo Tetris does well to teach beginners how to play from the absolute basics, to very complex combo moves. The levels progress in a way which allows players of all skill levels to enjoy. The addition of new multiplayer/CPU versus game modes really helps to mix up these classic puzzle games a lot, keeping the gameplay fresh from level to level, and adding a little bit of challenge every step of the way.

Overall, I fully recommend this game to any Puyo Puyo and Tetris fans, as well as gamers who are new to the genre and want to give puzzle games a shot.

review:
I never really liked puzzle or tetris games, but PuyoPuyo Tetris is actually pretty fun to play. I like the character designs and the gameplay. 

It's much more fun with all the characters and the skills rather than traditional Tetris, also mixing Puyo and Tetris makes everything much more interesiting. I think the game is quite challenging because I'm having trouble passing the Adventure mode levels.
It's all about fun, I think it's a great game to play with a friend or family.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121686493', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2088, 'last_played': 1657908364}
review:
steamでまともにテトリスとぷよぷよが遊べるゲーム
ストーリーモードでは初心者にお薦めできる難易度でそこそこ楽しい

オンラインモードはぷよぷよを使う人が少なく、テトリスが多く感じる
そしてぷよぷよ対テトリスのゲームバランスも良いとは言えず、低レートだとぷよが有利で高レートだとテトリスが有利だと自分は感じた（あくまで個人の所感）

オンラインモードはあまりお薦めできないが、それでも1人プレイ、もしくは友人と一緒にプレイする場合にはお薦めできる作品

author: {'steamid': '76561198067848409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 18958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3726, 'last_played': 1617758735}
review:
The game is quite an enjoyable experience, mixing both Tetris and Puyo Puyo gameplay almost perfectly.

The game controls pretty swell, though that is to be expected since it's pretty much just 2 old time classic puzzle games packed onto one. Characters are endearing, at least in the story mode where they embrace the weirdness. But their in-game voice lines can get quite grating, especially the goddamn twins.

The online mutiplayer is... certainly something. You definitely shouldn't play it if you're a beginner at either of the game types. If you are somewhat experienced though, it can be fun at times.

The only things I don't really like about the game is the 2 new game types: "Fusion" and "Party". "Party" is OK, albiet at bit awkward at times with items dropping in spots you REALLY don't want it to drop. While "Fusion" is just a total clusterfuck that I just personally don't find fun, even while being experienced at both gametypes.

Puyo Puyo Tetris is the perfect game to buy if you happen to be a fan of either Tetris or Puyo Puyo, as you're allowed to enjoy your preferable game-style while learning about the other type. You can even choose what style you want to play with during Versus mode, so you're free to have Puyo VS Tetris matches, as well as Puyo VS Puyo and Tetris VS Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256348765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1637982674}
review:
オンライン対戦を熱望している方は絶対にこのゲームを買ってはなりません。
わたくしはテトリスで対戦しているのですが
ラグが物凄くひどく、開幕でオブジェを作り上げてしまうほどで対戦にならないことが常々あります。
対戦相手の方も本当にやりにくそうで、マスを一つずらして設置してしまったり、回転ミスがあったりなど。。。
対戦環境は劣悪といえるでしょう。

一人でプレイするとそこそこ快適にテトリスができるのですが、個人的にはレスポンスはあまりよくないと感じました。
対戦を熱望する方はおとなしくPS4、もしくはSWITCH版をご購入ください。

author: {'steamid': '76561198202784977', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1544919032}
review: Very nice game, always fun to get destroyed by RNG in Party Mode :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198286811752', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6433, 'last_played': 1617810577}
review:
테린이 늅늅이들에게 전하는 몇가지 소소한 팁

1.무조건 t스핀 하려하지 마라.연습이 안되어있으면 망하는 지름길이다

2.빌드를 연습해라.테트리스는 초반 빌드가 게임의 대부분이다.물론 움보같은 사람들은 빌드를 쓰지 않지만 테린이는 빌드를 써야함

3.자기보다 레이팅이 많이 높은사람을 만나면 나가라.점수 안떨어진다.

4.어찌하는지 모르겠으면 ai와 먼저 게임을 해보고 어느정도 되겠다 하면 랭크전이 아닌 다른사람들과 레이팅 상관없이 돌릴수 있는 Free Play를 돌려라.

5.블럭 세워서 두지 마라.나중에 놓을곳 없다.

6.스프린트 연습해라.만약 1분 30초대가 된다면 어디가서 계속 지진 않을것이다.

7.게임도중 상대가 튕긴것같은데 게임이 안나가질땐 무작정 끄지말고 뿌테를 가진 친구에게 프리플레이 방을 만들어 초대해달라 하라.무작정 나가면 레이팅만 떨어진다.친구가 없다면 어쩔수없다.

8.친추좀 해줘라.주변에 뿌테하는사람들이 없어서 외롭다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812311520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2840, 'last_played': 1552502413}

author: {'steamid': '76561198274231749', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1639075901}
review:
okay, this originally said "this game ruined my life" but let's write an actual review!

puyo puyo tetris is an incredible game, if you don't give up in a fit of rage after the AI decides to git gud. seriously. there's a HUGE learning curve, especially in puyo puyo.

the story, for all its simplicity and general lightheartedness, is actually pretty nice. it's a general "we have to stop the dimensions from colliding!" plot, but it still got me attached to these characters and their worlds. by the way, i've never played a single puyo game before, so there was no former attachment, i just love them. klug is best boy

the story makes fun of its own flaws and is pretty goofy, but the ending did bring tears to my eyes.

the voice acting is actually really good! i hate the noise sig makes when he gets hit by garbage and schezo's alt voice makes my internal organs retract into themselves, but it's really funny and pleasant! the voices suit the characters well (ESPECIALLY klug, sig, and feli's voices!) and honestly, the voice actors reading goofy writing in serious voices is the funniest thing.

my biggest complaint is the sheer difficulty of certain fights - 5-9 especially. that took me over 20 tries, and i still only 2-starred it! however, there's a few simple strategies you can learn to get around this

overall: buy this game. if you like falling blocks, you'll enjoy this. if you like cutesy anime characters and plots, you'll enjoy this. and if you like getting your ass kicked six ways to sunday, up-down, left-right, back and forth, handed to you on a silver platter by the CPU, you'll love this game!

review:
This is an amazing game. I have seen many videos about it hoping to get this. Although, there are some minor complaints I have for this game. These are about online mode.

1. One of the users I have encountered was AFK so I was unable to play. I suggest you add an AFK timer for the AFK people, just so we can play the game with others. I think about 5-10 Minutes. If you have already added it before this review, then I apoligize.

2. The other gamemodes are pretty much dead, like fossils in a baron dessert. Add an option for Random Gamemodes and we should be A-OK.

Anyways, love the game. Pretty neat crossover for both fans of Puyo and Tetris.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198290826748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1540807188}
review:
You might say that Puyo Puyo and Tetris are fundamentally different games, and that there is no way to balance them properly. And you'd be absolutely, totally and completely right, the balancing from one game to the other is horrible; usually Tetris can clear junk blocks easier, but Puyo Puyo seems to be able to create junk blocks easier, leading to a weirdly hectic and confusing mess that's strangely not just part of the appeal but so fun in of itself that I would recommend the game based on this fundamental inconsistency alone. Its competitive mode is a joy to play casually, especially with friends already familiar with Puyo Puyo. (Of course just playing one of the two games competitively is always fun on its own.)

The story mode is so cheesy and vapid as to be charming. I'm not saying that sarcastically, I do genuinely find the thing very charming because of its shallow qualities, not in spite of them. Its level of humor speaks to me in a way many games don't, I never quite laughed out loud but I always had a smile on my face when reading the dialogue. (Except the "guguguuuu" and "pipipiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii" but no game is perfect.) Even the lower quality English voice actors added to this, normally I'd be bothered by the English voice actors being a little lower quality than the Japanese ones but here it just works.

And as my first experience with Puyo Puyo? I loved it, as a concept. Hard to master, much less straightforward than Tetris, but fun as hell to learn. I won't do a full analysis of Puyo Puyo itself as a concept, but it's more than worth the time and energy spent learning its mechanics. I loved (most of) the game modes as well, not all of them but nothing's perfect. They each provide a fun challenge, especially played with other people, namely Switch.

It's not something to just buy on a whim. It's not something everyone will want or enjoy. But to the right person it's a definite recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312920433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 915, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1544313058}
review:
An absolutely wonderful game with lots of fun game modes. The characters are all special in their own way, very charming and wacky, and the story does indeed follow that same principle of wackiness to a... T ; ). No major complaints about anything, most negatives arent even noticeable. Story mode is short, but makes up for it by being highly replayable and the bonus modes. Honestly, i never get tired of the "story", and i must admit it made me cry more than once, both from laughter and sadness (it really hits ya in the feels).
The Puyo and Tetris game mechanics are wonderfully polished, and even add a whole new polish and level to the games themselves, even combining them.
All in all, I would definitely recommend this game to fans of innocent and simple but hilarious and touching stories, fans of the characters and both Tetris and Puyo Puyo fans. 10/10 especially for the low price of 20€
P.S. Schezo rocked my world, and now its your turn

review:
고인물이 상~~당히 많고 여러모드가 있지만 플레이가 생각보다 단조롭습니다.
dlc가 나오거나 업데이트가 이루어진다면 더 좋을것 같습니다.
잘 알려진 대로 기본적으로 테트리스가 유리하지만 뿌요도 익숙해지면 심하게 불리하다고 생각하지는 않습니다.
원가로 구입한다면 좀 아쉽겠지만 
33% 할인된 가격으로 즐기고 있는데 전혀 후회없습니다.
저보다 높은 티어의 상대를 아슬아슬하게 역전승하는 짜릿함이 상당한 쾌감으로 다가옵니다.

review:
꺠달음을 얻었습니다. 뿌요에도 테트리스에도 한낱 뉴비지만 AI 따윈 아무것도 아니라며 솔로플레이 대전에 안일하게 들어갔던 과거의 자신을 반성합니다. 
종교도 명상도 나의 방심에 대한 깨우침을 주지 않았습니다. 나는 아직 한낱 뉴비임에 갈 길이 멀다는 것을 알지만 이 깨우침은 헛된 것이 아니라 확신합니다. 
비록 AI와의 대결이었지만 나의 실수는 필히 상대의 기회가 되며 상대가 그 기회를 놓아주지 않는 이상 나는 필히 고통받는다는 것을 깨달았습니다.

비록 뿌요테트는 게임일 뿐이지만 어떠한 게임도 이러한 깨달음을 주지는 못했습니다. 저는 오늘 다시 한번 스스로의 자만을 반성해봅니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037486505', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1725, 'last_played': 1653426101}
review:
7.5 / 10

콘솔만 한글화에 찬밥신세된 PC판 뿌요테트.
그래도 게임을 즐기는데엔 아무 문제가 없다.

다양한 대전모드 지원과 장시간 플레이 가능한 싱글모드와 도전모드,
반복 연습이 편리한 인터페이스 등으로
넷플레이전에 조금 게임의 요령과 공략을 관심있게 찾아본다면
충분히 유입장벽도 넘어가볼만한 게임이다.

그렇다해도 그 장벽이 없는건 아니다.
오히려 콘솔판과는 달리 키보드를 쓰고 있기에
고인물의 조작속도 평균이 엄청나게 상향평준화 되어있어
상당히 난감한 편

테트리스쪽은 특히 심한편이라
다른 테트리스 좀 해봤으니 괜찮겠지라는 생각으로
공략 확인도 없이 넷플 들어갔다간
뿌테에만 있는 기묘한 빌드와,
심하게 자유로운 스핀판정을 이용한 테크닉에 처참히 박살나게 된다.

고전 대전퍼즐게임에 목마른 유저,
그 중에서도 도전정신이 있는편인 유저들에게 추천한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045148328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1564035012}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris es, como su nombre lo indica, la combinación de los 2 juegos de puzzles más populares de cada lado del Pacífico. Si ya has jugado Puyo Puyo antes (o Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine que fue como lo localizaron fuera de Japón) o el modo vs de Tetris Friends ya conocerás el concepto de puzzle fighter en el que se basa este juego, pero si no conoces ninguno de ambos casos, en palabras simples, de 2 a 4 personas compiten tratando de sumar puntos rápidamente resolviendo su puzzle, y al juntar altas puntuaciones, ya sea haciendo cadenas en Puyo Puyo o limpiando muchas líneas a la vez en Tetris, envían basura al resto de jugadores que les estorbarán en sus tableros. Ganas cuando el tablero del resto de jugadores se llene.
Además, está ambientado en el divertido mundo y con los personajes de Puyo Puyo con algunos nuevos personajes basados en las piezas de Tetris y una divertida historia que no ganará ningún Oscar por su profundidad casi nula, pero definitivamente te sacará más de una sonrisa, y si entiendes inglés el doblaje es maravilloso y le da personalidad a todos los personajes, [b]¡ASÍ QUE NO LO CAMBIES A JAPONÉS, POR FAVOR![/b]

Por supuesto, también incluye una gran variedad de modos incluyendo juego en línea donde puedes ser apaleado por asiáticos que hacen una cadena de 14 puyos antes de que toques el suelo, o modos individuales donde puedes jugar contra la máquina o simplemente jugar solo para mejorar tus puntuaciones.

Sé que los juegos de puzzles son muy infravalorados, pero háganme caso, este juego realmente divertido especialmente si lo juegas con amigos que entiendan de puzzles, [strike]nominado para los premios de Steam 2018 [i]Mejor con Amigos[/i],[/strike] y si realmente disfrutas de Tetris o Puyo Puyo [b]debes[/b] jugarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080529469', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1705108850}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris, es uno de mis juegos tipo puzzle favorito desde hace mucho,
es un gran titulo para jugar con amigos, en linea o incluso solo.
Cuenta con distintos modos de juego, el cual el principal y favorito mio es el Swapp, el cual intercala entre el tetris y el puyo puyo.

Si eres un seguidor del clasico juego de tetris o puyo puyo, este juego es para ti y si no dale una oportunidad a este titulo

I recommend this game to the upper class of society because 25$ means selling a quarter of my left testicle, which is harder than actually selling ur whole testy cuz quarter would hurt more than the actual whole. this game is fun to play with friends unless u have a friend with garbo internet who decides to cuckblock ur experience because u cant place a piece on the board cuz their lagging to much and the game ends before anything acually happens, id say this game should be rated R because it is restricted to the normal people in this world, and if they dare pursue this game, they won't be the same person, and they will become a toxic of the society. pls go on sale more often lovely game ty for this awesome mash up of popular puzzle games (Tetris and Puyo Puyo) ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561198122846209', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1580087338}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198409467506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1664445979}
review:
뿌요뿌요와 테트리스를 같이 할 수 있어서 좋네요.
둘 중 하나를 택해서도 할 수 있다는 게 더 좋고ㅎㅎ
다른 걸 골라서 색다르게 할 수 있어, 이걸 잘 활용하면 본인만의 플레이스타일로 재밌게 할 수 있을 거 같아요!

단점이라면 역시... 한국어.. 가 먼저 떠오르네요ㅋ..

또 하나 말씀드리자면, 이건 그냥 제 개인적인 생각입니다만..
온라인 매칭 쪽이야 왠만하면 그러려니 합니다.
그런데.. 매칭 될 때 랭크 차이가 너무 심하게 매칭된다고 해야하나..
즉, 1위인 분과 2천 몇 위인 분이 매칭되는 것처럼..
동등한 랭크에서의 매칭이 없다는 게 아쉬워요..;;;

그러려니 하면서 신경쓰지 않고 왠만하면 하고 있지만..ㅋ;;;

어디까지나 제 생각.. 입니다만ㅋ;;;

여하튼, 재밌게 하고 있습니다~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198051706734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2014, 'last_played': 1617938197}
review: No soy un fan de tetris ni un fan de puyo puyo, pero luego de jugar el demo en la nintendo switch de un amigo, de inmediato supe que debía comprarlo. Todos los modos son bastante entretenidos, y el modo historia es interesante, algo que no esperaba. No sé que tan estable sea el modo online, así que si quieres comprarlo por el modo online, averigua bien al respecto. El único detalle que no me agradó del todo es que algunos personajes son mucho más difíciles de vencer que otros, al menos para mí, pero aún así no fue algo que me impidiera disfrutar el juego. Totalmente recomendable

author: {'steamid': '76561198010898209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1636943426}
review:
It's impossible to balance two completely different puzzle games so they can be played competetively against eachother, but Puyo Puyo Tetris does a fine job of getting close to being balanced. It's fun to see the two games interact with eachother in the swap and fusion game modes, but most of the time I just stick to playing Puyo or Tetris.

Despite how much I like this game, slight differences in skill level can have a huge impact, leading to games feeling pretty one sided when I play online. Having even a little knowledge about Puyo set ups will help you easily dominate newish players and even some intermediate players, but the higher-level tetris players are nearly unstoppable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067089520', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2944, 'last_played': 1706668435}
review:
A premissa desse jogo é simples. Mesclar a franquia Tetris com a franquia Puyo-Puyo (aka Dr. Robotnik Mean Bean Machine/Kirby Avalanche) em partidas para até quatro jogadores, mas os desenvolvedores foram além e fizeram diversos modos diferentes de misturar estes jogos. Eles implementaram um modo intercalado, um modo simultâneo, um modo com itens e muito mais.

Este jogo é ótimo para partidas casuais com amigos ou até mesmo para partidas competitivas, já que o jogo possui um modo online ranqueado e mantém diversas das táticas avançadas como T-spin e afins.

Definitivamente uma boa adição para a sua biblioteca, não irá se arrepender.

(E o modo campanha é uma mina de ouro se tu quiser dar uma gargalhadas. Não do jeito que os desenvolvedores queriam, entretanto.)

review: Excelente jogo e muito divertido, jogo ambos os jogos Puyo Puyo e Tetris e misturando essas 2 franquias de jogos gênero Puzzle? é o dobro de diversão, modo online excelente onde se pode jogar até 4 players, portanto se vc tiver um amigo que ama esse gênero ou 3 amigos, melhor ainda, joguei com uma amiga minha no online e curtimos demais. Agora se vc for jogar partidas rankeadas, tenha muito tempo pra estudar esse jogo, pois ele exige muita paciência e concentração e muito reflexo. Mas ainda assim esse game é impecável. Nota 8.5/10 na minha opinião. Selo de aprovação do Guara ^^

review: Sig is a spacey boy, first introduced in Puyo Puyo Fever 2. Although he is sometimes shown smiling, he lacks emotions through his text, and acts passively toward things, save for his great fascination with insects. His lack of emotion in his speech lead to assumptions that he has some problems emoting. According to Puyo Puyo Fever 2, he derives from the neutral non-evil parts of a demon, and is ignorant of his origins. His left eye is red and his left hand is a large red claw, denoting his demonic heritage.

review:
After the horrors of what was Tetris Ultimate, it's so nice to get Tetris game that not only works, but is also more than decent. I do also much prefer fun looking visuals and more competitive and catchy music. And there's also Puyo there as well. 

My biggest issue with the game is how xbox controller is so bad with 2D games like this and for those constantly instadropping the vibration never stops, meanwhile Dualshock 4 is perfect, but there's no dualshock buttons and no rumble at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071046483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 28328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 51, 'playtime_at_review': 15615, 'last_played': 1712249161}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris (Japanese: ぷよぷよテトリス Hepburn: Puyopuyo Tetorisu) is a puzzle by Sonic Team. It is published under SEGA on eight platforms.

The series follows Arle and her younger stepsisters Amitie and Ringo, two Puyo Players who make up the identity of The Protagonists, an undefeated group of Puyo Poppers. One day, they are challenged by the keeper of dimensions to a nice game of merging two separate dimensions and bringing forth the death of everyone and everything and are victorious (but not really). As a result, the keeper dumps them onto a the SS Tetra, a spaceship that is inhabited by some of the most incompetent and unlikable people in the multiverse. Intent on maintaining their reputation as the undefeated Puyo Poppers, Ringo, Amitie and Arle plan to harass the crew onboard with Puyo Puyo and the newly discovered Tetris games until they crash-land their spaceship on their planet.

The series began receiving recognition in 2017, when it was ported to sensible platforms and localized for all the dumb americans of the world. It was reported in late 2017 that over a lot of people like it so then they looked at the PC and went "yeah, might as well". The English localization of the game was well received: the game was praised for it's character dynamics, game strategies, and animation and the disproportionately dumb and self-aware story and entertaining dialogue between the absolute tw@s that Sonic Team somehow passed off as characters with a (mostly) straight face.

All in all, fun game, totally not No Game No Life meets actual videogames, the characters are fun, Satan is gay, I'm gay for Ex, Tetris is still OP as fucc and MATCHMAKING IS STILL BROKEN.

SEGA, FIX YOUR FUKIN GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290354710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5908, 'last_played': 1670750300}
review:
I am running PC version, and there is an annoying bug I really have to report here. When I place a piece and immediately then hold the next piece, the hold doesn't work. It's apparently some software bug, because:
1. It's totally okay to place a piece and then "move" the next piece or "rotate" the next piece.
2. It can't be a performance issue, my hardware is i7 3770 and gtx 1050, not so good , but not so bad either. 
3. I play the game with my mechanical keyboard. I also try to use key-mapping tool vjoy to map the keyboard inputs onto a virtual controller. The bug is still there.

If you play tetris fast enough to run into this problem, you will find it quite annoying, resulting in so many misdrops. 

There is also another one serious bug, related to performance or something. When I play puzzle league matches, sometimes there is serious delay after line clear. I mean, I suppose I can control the pieces after 1 sec, but no, sometimes it's just longer than that, thus the misdrops. I think the software may try to load a sound track or a short piece of animation, I don't know, it occurs very often, and when the opponent is a puyo puyo player, the situation is even worse, maybe puyo sound tracks and animation take even longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055470261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2175, 'last_played': 1588261916}
review:
The game is fantastic although the lack of players makes online play extremely unbalanced. You'll be playing with people over 10 times your rating if there aren't enough people online and it's pretty un-fun getting smashed.

There are a few customizations in Tetris I would prefer to have (like movement speed,soft drop speed, and 180 rotation) but I would just chalk it up to game balancing so Puyo players don't get destroyed.

The price tag is a big barrier towards people who aren't bigtime puzzle fans and leads to the small online community. Hopefully future steam sales will remedy this.

My advice, if you want to play this, prepare to be stomped in the process of getting good. Learn openers and don't get too discouraged. Dodge players with 10X or more rating than you and you're generally gonna have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970188930', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1072, 'last_played': 1697259286}
review:
great game. fully feature complete. you get

- like 5 different gameplay modes
- story mode with an awful story and voice acting, but great challenge progression
- arcade mode for each gameplay mode
- online ranked and casual matches
- local and online 4 player multiplayer for each gameplay mode
- good music
- goofy voice acting with more characters and alt voices unlockable
- tutorials and practice modes
- replays
- different skins for tetros and puyos you can unlock

puyo puyo is great and tetris is great. i literally don't know what else you could ask for in a game like this. it's pretty much the definitive edition of both games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144331539', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1694915204}
review:
This is a good game, the adventure mode is amazing, although the onling matchmaking system is absolute bs.
At the moment I am below the rating you get when you first start the game, because everyone I have made matches with has been rank 1 of their region, because they seem to be the only people that play the game.
I find this very unfair for new players who want to get better at the game because there basically is no way to get better. I would rate this 5/5,
If you would fix the ranking system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180131450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1541450440}
review:
Le Tetris est revisité avec des "règles" un peu farfelues pour les puristes du genre, comme retenir une brique en mémoire (Hold)...Niveau ambiance le jeu se joue dans une atmosphère un peu Kawaii, limite gonzesse, avec une tekno infernale à défriser un mouton! (vous ne pouvez pas réduire le son dans le jeu, pour plus de cruauté ^^ Pensez à le baisser depuis Windows)  Plusieurs modes de jeu dispos, dont le plus intéressant (selon moi) qui switch entre le Tetris et le Puyo...
Gros point négatif du jeu, le mode Online (jouer avec ses potes ou d'autres joueurs). Quand on joue à deux amis les parties sont stables mais dès qu'on  inclu un 3eme et un 4 eme joueur la partie commence à peine que l'on est déconnecté du serveur, ce qui est dommage car les parties à 3/4 joueurs sont assez fendares....
En gros :
Un jeu qui associe Tetris et Puyo de différentes manières, plus au moins originales, incluant des petites règles que les plus malins exploiteront sans problème, question difficulté c'est plus le niveau des autres joueurs qui vous occupera mais si vous comptez jouer entre amis anticipez ce jeu comme une branlette : vous jouez solo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010124127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1541338772}
review:
The new Fusion mode is mindscrew, and literally no instances of it appear until the end of the game. It's complicated enough that it's not really fun to play anymore, especially when the AI understands all the mechanics behind scoring while the tutorial basically just says "Play Tetris and Puyo Puyo at the same time and have fun!". I know these titles are notorious for end-game difficulty spikes, but at least it's usually just trying to master mechanics you're familiar with to edge out an AI, not because of an information gap. When I throw a Tetris followed by a 4 combo at an AI, and watch them DOUBLE THAT back at me by just single/double chaining puyos over and over, it feels like I'm just getting punish for using the new mechanics.  

Also the "Get Three Stars in Party Mode" stages with a score cap are absolute rubbish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122666229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1541196487}
review:
Takes forever to find a game, and even when you do find one you're either matched up against a Tetris god, someone 4 widing or someone playing puyo puyo. Any of these games usually result in a loss unless you're one of them. Most times matchmaking, the game breaks and doesn't even find a game until I exit out of matchmaking and go back in. As I type this I had to exit the game because matchmaking froze and now I can't open the game again because Steam says it's already open. 
Also, even playing standard Tetris is hidden away and seems to cap at a certain level, and therefore the game doesn't get any more challenging. However, this probably isn't the reason you'd buy this game.
Fix matchmaking, and the game would probably be quite enjoyable, but because of these major issues with the game, I would not reccomend it to anyone who is looking for a good version of Tetris for the PC.

review:
-게임의 속도가 느려서 다른 테트리스보다 티스핀의 중요성이 높아 피지컬보다 뇌지컬적인 부분이 더 요구됨
-이펙트가 공식 테트게임 중에는 타격감(?)이 깔끔하고 좋음
-캐릭이 귀여움

단,테트의 경우 게임자체의 키씹 + 네트워크 렉 + 공격받을때의 잡렉으로 인한 키씹이 합쳐져 분노를 느낄수있고 핵이나 랜뽑유저들도 판치는 환상적인 온라인 환경에 뿌테2로 인해 유저마저 반갈죽 되버려 리벤지 시스템이 없는데도 리벤지 매치가되는 놀라운 상황을 볼수가 있는 갓-겜

author: {'steamid': '76561198062301817', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 1624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1599024756}
review:
This is the best game out there for action-puzzle lovers. I'm a big fan of the genre, and the main problem with many of them is that they're a bit dull to play alone: in this one, the amount of solo content and its depth is such that I've put a lot of time into it (20+ hours) while playing alone most of that time, and I still have a lot to do. 

The campaign is full of engaging challenges, making you go gradually through all of the game modes. I'm not too fond of the story, but it's decent enough for that kind of game, and it's joyful. 

There are very funky things that you'd have never expected to see, like the "swap mode" that continuously changes between Tetris and Puyo Puyo, or "fusion" in which you play a mix of both. 

I bought the game mostly for Tetris, as there wasn't a proper version of it on Steam until now, and I'd say that if that's your case too, you're still getting your money's worth. You'll discover a new game, Puyo Puyo, which you're probably not familiar with, you'll have plenty of Tetris-related challenges and modes, and you'll be able to play againt other people online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144462139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1706429850}
review:
Truthfully this is the best puzzle game on PC i have ever played this year
I have played Puyo puyo since Puyo Pop Fever realesed on NDS and it was really addicting game and you just dont want to stop. This one however, it still has a same vibe but this time it collaborated with Tetris which i would say a [i] Crossover Nobody Asked for [/i] but a still welcome one.

The artstyle was not really much have any major change from the previous installment (except puyo puyo chronicle...cuz wth was that) and while they also added more characters in it [b] [i] (even tho im kinda sad cuz they make Yu only just a cameo in this game...like come on SEGA, what the hell are you doing...bring back Yu and Rei :( ) [/i] [/b]

The game runs great anyway, they really implemented the PC port really well.
Thats all from me...nothing much to speak of~

Overall i will give it 
[h1] 9.5 [/h1] / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198359236725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 823, 'last_played': 1597885613}
review: Me parece un juego muy bueno. Aparte de ser infinito brinda un buen de modos de juego, es precioso, para los que nos gusta el estilo anime. Esta un poco desbalanceado el tratado swap entre puyos y tetris pero es naturaleza del mismo. No me gusto que en online no exista quickplay o solo tetris por que algunos juegan puyo y se rompe la partida. En las rankeds nada que ver, el rango en el que estoy que es hasta abajo me toca gente muy buena que sabe las mecanicas mas complejas como son el t spin y demas. Pero en general es un paquete colorido divertido y caotico y mas con amiguis .

author: {'steamid': '76561198061680298', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1635170701}
review:
I usually don't write reviews but since this is such an amazing game, I am going to get to it right now. Keep in mind that most of the things I am going to mention are based on my opinion and mostly about the Tetris modes (not Puyo Puyo), so decide for yourself:


[b]Gameplay 10 / 10[/b]
I haven't spent much time with the Puyo Puyo modes to give a good opinion about it (except from the story, and I suck at it). As for Tetris.. well it's Tetris and this game is probably one of the best Tetris experiences you're going to get. Default controls (which you can change). Clearing Tetris lines feels super satisfying, sound and visual popups for stuff like T-spins and Combos. Ability to hold onto blocks for later use and the next 5 upcoming blocks will be shown to you. It also uses a fixed algorithm that gives you at least one specific block every 7 blocks, so RNG shouldn't be a major reason anymore to screw you over.

[b]Content 9 / 10[/b]
There are a great bunch of different modes for both Tetris and Puyo Puyo and you are not forced to play any of them if you just want to stick to a specific one (except for the story). All of them feel really stable and fun like the Swap mode, which switches between Puyo Puyo and Tetris in intervals, though I spend most of my time on the normal Tetris modes including Sprint (clear 40 Lines as fast as possible) and Marathon (clear 150 Lines with the highest score possible, also increases block fall speed the more lines you clear).

[b]Design 9 / 10[/b]
The game has a really cute design. It has a big set of characters to play as, which doesn't affect gameplay at all, but on every Clear or Combo, each one of those have their specific animations and voice lines, which brings a lot of personalization into the game, especially in multiplayer. There is also an ingame store which lets you buy different looks for your blocks, alternative Voice Packs for the characters, etc. with the credits you earn ingame (this game has no microtransactions with real money at all, yay!) Keep in mind that the flashy animations and character design could be annoying to people who somehow don't have a tolerance to cute things.

[b]Multiplayer 8 / 10[/b]
Creating a room to play against friends is really quick and easy and supports up to 4 players, and each player can choose individually to play either Tetris or Puyo Puyo (or the host locks it to one specific mode only). There is also a Competitive mode in which you can increase your ranking, but I haven't touched it myself yet in fear of getting crushed. The only negative things about this is that the mode can't be changed after a match and forces you to create a new room. One or more players failing to request a rematch in time also leads to this dilemma. Since the creating of a room is fairly quick, this isn't that much of a big deal.

[b]Soundtrack 9 / 10[/b]
Nice variety of great tracks for the different modes, my favorites are Folktales from the Motherland (Tetris Theme Remaster), Fun Puyo Puyo Hell and Block by Block, Beat by Beat. I would've given this a 10 if it had the original Tetris theme. But I shouldn't complain, it would be weird if they didn't remaster the Tetris theme for a new game. Besides that, the sound files are very easy to replace, just slap the original theme in the game files and you're good to go.

[b]Story 8 / 10[/b]
It's a Tetris game, so it's quite surprising that it has a story mode at all. It's a bunch of chapters with different Tetris / Puyo Puyo challenges with J-RPG like cutscenes and for being a Tetris game, I think the story is quite nice and funny. It also works very great as practice until you decide to play against others in Multiplayer.

[b]Price 4 / 10[/b]
Okay, you might have looked at the price of this game and decided not to get it, and I understand. I agree that this game is quite overpriced for being a Tetris game. But considering how much effort has been put in the game and how well it works, I think it's 100% worth it to buy it during a sale at least.


[b]Overall[/b] (price excluded) [b]9 / 10[/b]
So far, only one other person on my friendslist owns this game and she got it as a gift from me. I think a lot of people like Tetris and this is the best Tetris experience you can get on PC in my opinion, so therefore I think this game deserves a bigger playerbase. Like I said, get it when it's on sale, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847603727', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3540, 'last_played': 1660456902}
review:
I had already been fairly good at Tetris marathon when I bought this game about a month ago, and so I knew I'd be faring fairly well in this game. After a month of playing off and on, I've finally recieved my last achievement. In my journey collecting every achievement, I've learned a couple of things:

1) It's a very long and arduous process collecting every achievement
2) You will probably find yourself playing the same gamemodes (marathon and endless fever) for hours if you want to have a chance at getting every achievement

But games aren't all about achievements. If you're looking for a good story campaign, this game has a fairly diverse set of gamemodes that will keep things fresh as you figure more out about the game. Online matches against friends can be pretty fun too, just be careful of ranked play, as there isn't a real matchmaking system (I was set up against the 28th best player worldwide on my first attempt). In my opinion, if you came here because you love Tetris, I think with enough practice you can come to enjoy Puyo Puyo on a similar level. To that end, I think that it's a very worthwhile buy if you already enjoy playing one or the other.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198249464184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2183, 'last_played': 1608269807}
review:
정말 좋은 게임입니다 뿌요놈의 시점으로 설명하자면 단순해보이지만 많은 전략들이 숨어있고 빌드가 있고 날빌도 있습니다

상대가 견제하는걸 주시하며 거기에 맞춰 자신도 대응하고, 견제보낸게 어쩌다 성공하면 추격타를 계속 넣어주고, 그를 위한 주연쇄를 끊는 기술이나 연쇄 중간을 부숴 헬파이어로 쏘아보내거나, 견제타를 쏠 일이 없을거같으면 주연쇄에 합류시키는 등.

근데 게임이 렉, 버그, 랜뽑, 동접자 등등 겜이 아주 더럽습니다.

그리고 밸런스도 한몫합니다. 아래부분에서 중수까지 뿌요가 유리한데 상위권가면 테트를 어쩌질 못 합니다.

솔직히 테트유저랑 하면 스트레스가 쌓여요..초보가 무슨 수로 부정형을 쌓아..초고수도 하기 힘든거잖아..

쓰다보니 열 받네??????

아무튼 뭐 테트쪽도 대뿌요전을 위한 빌드도 있고, 뿌요전과 테트전의 대응하는 방식도 다르다고합니다.

다른 테트리스 게임에 비해 느리지만, 반대로 피지컬에 의존하는 테트리스겜이 아니라는 뜻이고 좀 더 전략에 치중할 수 있다는 뜻도 되죠.

근데 렉이 걸리면 아무것도 못 합니다. 열받네??

뿌요뿌요e스포츠 언제 스팀에 내주니 SEGA야

author: {'steamid': '76561198048593814', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1691311563}
review:
わざわざsteamでぷよぷよテトリスを買う人間は手練ばかりなので、
初心者にネット対戦は敷居が高いと思われます。
（一応3DS版ではレートカンストしてましたが連戦連勝とはいかないです）

また、現状としてはサーバーがあまりにも貧弱なため、
フレンドと平和なバトルをしようとしてもまったく対戦が成立しません。

日本円で3490円となっていますが、間違いなくそれだけの価値はないと思われます。
１人プレイ用で2000円がいいところかなと感じます。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999342327', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1580527161}
review:
[b]Puyo Puyo[/b] and [b]Tetris[/b] are two titles that have been around for generations of video gamers, with the puzzle franchises selling millions of copies throughout multiple iterations.  In 2014, the two franchises combined together to form a collaborative throw down of the two styles, and has now been introduced to the PC as the beautifully articulated party game fans have come to know and love.

To understand [b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b], the bases of each game must be known.  [b]Tetris[/b] is the age old puzzle game that takes multiple 4-tile puzzle pieces which the player can rotate to fill spaces to complete and “break” lines, with the goal being to last as long as possible.  For [b]Puyo Puyo[/b], players have 2 tile columns of multiple colors, with the goal of combining 4 of the same color together to break them.  Adding combos together can multiply your score, as well as add penalty tiles to the opponent's board to increase the difficulty for them.  

[b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b] pits the two styles together in the Adventure mode, which tells a tale of invasion, demons, intertwining dimensions, and the clashing of characters between the two titles.  For veterans of the franchises, this is a direct sequel to the [b]20th Anniversary Puyo Puyo[/b] title; for beginners, this is a wild fever dream that will teach you the core basics of the two games.  Adventure Mode boasts 70 levels, with each level either playing against AI characters, or completing specific challenges.  Each level can earn up to 3 stars, depending on how well the level is played, and players can earn credits that can be used to unlock special skins and items to be used throughout the game.

With Adventure mode getting characters unlocked and skills tested, [b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b]' bread and butter comes from its multiple modes, as well as the 4-player local and online multiplayer.  This is where [b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b] puts on its creative cap, with five different modes to choose from.  Ranging from a traditional Versus mode, to combining [b]Puyo[/b] and [b]Tetris[/b] onto one board in Fusion Mode, to adding power-up items in Party Mode, to working two boards at a time in Swap Mode, to seeing who can hit the most set-up combos in the time limit in the Big Bang Mode; there is a limitless amount of replay-ability that leads to a lot of laughs with friends, and competitions with rivals.

Online Mode also adds a competitive mode for the players looking to show off their skills. [b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b] uses an ELO ranking system that keeps competing players together, which thankfully has a decent amount of players, so I myself didn't have too many squash matches on either side during my time spent playing.

For lifelong fans of either series, you know what you're getting yourself into when playing [b]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/b], but [b]SEGA[/b] and [b]Sonic Team[/b] have created a wonderful package flush with content, endless replay-ability, and a quality of gameplay that's easy to pick up, but ultimately satisfying to master.

[quote][h1]Follow [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33247611/]A Review Is Worth 1,000 Words[/url] for more content.[/h1][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198327026458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1576195074}
review:
Okay, I love this game. I really do. It's fun! But I have one single complaint. Free Play. A couple of friends of mine and I like playing this game together. Sort of. It becomes less fun when the one who happens to seemingly be more skilled than the other two wins every time. The only way I've found to handicap myself is by playing Tetris without hard drops. (I know that teams are a thing, we might be able to do that, but what if we actually want a 1v1v1?) Sometimes I want to play Puyo. But then I choose my friends' feelings over my own.
It'd be great if some more options could be added, like the Sweet to Spicy difficulties. (Really, that's all it should need, though more options than just that are nice too.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198100009028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1539562540}
review:
I love tetris, I spend a lot of time on tetrisfriends so when I saw this I was thinking it would be great.  First off, puyo puyo is way over powered compared to tetris online.  Also it seems to lag so much when I'm trying to go fast that I can't even go at full speed when I want to.

So overall if you want a puzzle game to enjoy that has a lot of content and is probably great for local multiplayer between non serious players, this might be great.  For someone like myself who wanted a good online environment this just doesn't cut it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098020656', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2296, 'last_played': 1703704142}
review:
Addicted. Absolutely addicted. I was hesatant and turned away by the theme in the beginning as I was never an anime fan, (and I am still not) but I decided to try this one. My only regret was not playing tetris when I had a gameboy. If you played Kirby's Avalanche or Dr. Robotnic... back in the day, you will absolutely enjoy this game. My only disapointment about the game is that it feels a bit unballanced if you play puyo vs tetris. The puyo side often has a bit more power over the tetris side leaving experienced tetris players constantly loosing. Swap mode however has to be the most fun giving you about 30 seconds in each mode to beat your oppenent(s).

I absolutely enjoy this game. 

Also, if my review isn't a good reason to get this game, just go to YouTube and search "Vs. 🅱️uyo 🅱️uyo".

review: 정말 똥게임이다.가끔 멀티를 하다보면 게임이 멈추는 경우도 있고 방에 들어가면 아무도 없는경우도 있고,하여튼 버그는 드럽게 많은데 그걸 고칠생각은 1도없어보인다.또,이 게임에는 소위말하는 '고인물'들이 넘쳐나는데 그렇다면 처음하는 뉴비들은 어쩌라는걸까.만나는 랭크에 제한을 두던가 해야될텐데 그런것도없다.리그는 대체 왜있는건지 모르겠다.여튼 ㅈ망겜임.개발자들도 게임관리 거의안하는거같은데 내가 이겜을 왜산건지 모르곘음.너무 후회됨.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060439824', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1536380867}
review:
If you have played tetris clones such as Jstris, Cultris II, or NullpoMino, you will find that this tetris is hard to adjust to due to the lack of tuning, which also makes the game feel "slow" for those that have played on those clones mentioned before. From a tetris fan's perspective the only redeeming factor is the vibrance and aesthetics of the game. The adventure mode was okay.

Would only recommend this game if you have not played on those clones extensively and/or want to play with Puyos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080613134', 'num_games_owned': 1132, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 29172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11721, 'last_played': 1673973842}
review:
여러분들이 테트나 뿌요에 관심이 생겨서 살려고 한다면 이글 봐주셨으면 좋겠습니다.

서버 쓰레기 게임.
좋은 게임 두개 섞어놓고 세가는 이게임 방치하다 시피 한다.
레이팅 5만점이 최대인데 핵써서 6만점이 1위하고 이딴 상황인데 밴 그런거 조차 없고, 서버는 감자서버인지 맨날 팅기고, 지들이 만들어 놓은 핑 차이 걸러내는 기능도 븅X적으로 작용도 안하고 그냥 3판중 1판? 이것도 많이 봐준거지만, 심하면 5판중 4판이 렉걸린다고 보면됨.
거기다가 테트리스 할거면 특히 더 짜증나는게 키씹힘 오지게 심함. 막말로 한판(2선승 따내는 한판이 아니고 별 1개 얻어내는 그 한판) 키씹이 적으면 3번, 많으면 5~7번 이난리 나는 게임.

스팀에 테트리스 할 수 있는게임이 별로 없어서 기대하고 샀는데, 돌아온건 방치된 쓰레기랑 꼬우면 꺼지라는 세가측 태도(사람들이 뭐 요구해도 안해주고)

솔직히 할 이유 전혀 없어요.
차라리 무료로 할 수 있는 폴란드 테트리스나 JSTRIS 였나 그거 하는게 여러분들 암은 덜걸립니다.

개 쓰레기 폐기물 게임 진짜 그냥 망했으면 좋겠다.

뿌요분들은 뿌요뿌요 크로니클이었나? 이런류 게임을 하는걸 추천드립니다.
이게임은 세가에서 관리를 해주지 않아요. 3만 2천원 받아쳐먹고 배불릴 생각만 하고 있지.

다시는 내가 니들 게임에 애착 붙이나봐라.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058857599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1632989432}
review:
Not only is this one of the best Tetris games to come out in recent years, it's also one of the best puzzle games I've played in general. I'm new to Puyo Puyo and I've enjoyed Tetris for many years. It's nice that you have the option to play either one of the two games separately, or you can play a number of crazy new game modes that chaotically combine the two. It's a recipe for some good times, and it's one of the most original and full-featured puzzlers to come out in a long time. With local and online multiplayer for up to 4 players and a plethora of game modes, there's something for everyone here. Don't buy the broken Ubisoft Tetris. Get this one.
[url]https://youtu.be/ldz5lX9yMEE[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041432652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1708284961}
review:
I can only recommend this game if you have a Nintendo Switch if I'm being completely honest.

The PC version is cripped by Denuvo DRM, and awful matchmaking bugs. Denuvo possibly is the reason why the game takes ages to boot (installed on an SSD as well) and causes some framerate issues (for an entirely two dimensional game with sprites). Matchmaking is awful due to the low population of players, and by the fact that there's this ongoing "Delete this Replay?" bug where it matches you against a bugged player that doesn't even exist, and readying up against this "player" or another matchmaking bug where you are matched against a clone of yourself crashes the game. Low population in this game forces you to only be matchmade with those well above your skill level, and there's no way to filter out skill levels. This game has a rage quit exploit that isn't present on the Nintendo Switch version either. It is possible to softlock your opponent by rage quitting, with no time out, where the Switch version awards a win on opponent's disconnect, or cancels out the match neutrally.

Otherwise the gameplay in this game is good for Puyo Puyo fans, as this is the only both English and PC varation of that game. However most of your battles will end up in Tetris vs. Tetris and you might as well just play on TetrisFriends for free if that's what you end up liking in the first place. 

None of the matchmaking bugs occur on other platforms, and the Nintendo Switch version is the most populated at the moment. If you are going to buy this game, I'd recommend to buy that version, or keep the PC version for (mostly) offline play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051870326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1701168480}
review: 윈도우 8.1 쓰다가 윈도우 10으로 업그레이드 한다음에 켜볼려고 했는데 자꾸 게임이 켜졌다가 꺼지기만을 반복하네요;;

author: {'steamid': '76561198011986779', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 4138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2679, 'last_played': 1652575053}
review:
So you got Teris and Japanese Tet... I mean Puyo Puyo. Two puzzle games that somehow got story. And you know what? It works.

The story isn't anything complex or big, but definitely funny (the 9th chapter just nails it all xD). It is something a child would understand and given the artstyle this is definitely something you could give an 8-year old. Of course that doesn't exclude any adults who like either of the puzzles.

The gameplay features Tetris in modern style, aka. holding blocks, T-spins etc. Basicaly that type where you just stack up tetriminos as quickly as possible and with some strategy in mind. Do you want to set up T-spins? Maybe 1-wide? Or 4-wide? Well how about centered 4-wide?
Now I know this sounds complex, but when starting out with bots and adventure you will gradualy get all the necessary skills to perform all of these strategies. There are also tutorials which explains basic controls, game mechanics and some of the strategies I mentioend before.

As for the Puyo Puyo, this thing look even more intimidating, but fear not, for there are also tutorials in game. You basicaly try to pop 4 or more puyos that are next to one another. They are affected by gravity allowing you to cause a chain reaction. Even when you are horrible at it or never even played it, the adventure mode should allow you to do some 2-3 chains and play somewhat decently, and if you want, you can go for sick 12 chains that will destroy your opponent instantly (unless they manage to respond to you attack).

There are also many other modes: Fusion which combines both Puyo Puyo and tetris, Tiny Puyo which gives you much larger board to perform like 20 chains or higher, Sprint where you have to clear 40 lines as quickly as you can and like 8 other gamemodes.

I would consider the characters to be the best part of the game. How they shout their spells and attacks when you are performing huge chain or combo and then that satisfaction when you see the amount of garbage you are sending to the opponent. Also, there is a person who found out why we are learning math... to beat up anyone unfortunate enough to cross our path. Don't understand? Play the game and check for yourself.

There is ONE bad thing about this game, and it's multiplayer. What exactly you may ask? It's definitely not toxicity since there is no chat or voicechat to do that. It's the matchmaker and how it matches you, the new guy, with a grandmaster, cause you know, that's totaly fair...
I would suggest sticking with bots. Each character has different difficulty. People like Tee, O or Amitie are easy, but people like Dark Prince, Ex or Ecolo will take your head, mop the floor with it and then throw you into their sea of garbage you just received to drown.

All in all, I cannot recommend this game enough. It's great! The bots offer enough challenge or relaxed gameplay so that anyone can enjoy it, either casual or hardcore gamer. I think the price justifies the quality (despite it's bumpy release...).
Go grab it and have some fun popping puyos or clearing tetriminos, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000632093', 'num_games_owned': 1206, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1534999535}
review: I was only in it for the online play and don't care much for offline, i'm sure that offline adventures is great but online is a fucking shit show, i was always paired with high leveled players and never had a even match, And the way you have to play tetris is confusing as fuck, it's like the game favouries more chaining combos than actual going for tetris and high scores. I would find myself pulling double tetrises just to be destroyed and have my board get filled by someone chaining combos in puyo puyo, which ment his fucking chain = 2 double tetris back to back + trashing my entire board. Fucking bullshit. If you want a good Tetris experience you will not find that here, but if you like puyo and tetris with cute designs go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046401547', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1669783960}
review:
Jesus christ. Gross.

I have 250 hours on the Switch port of PPT, got it the second it came out. It was my introduction to Puyo Puyo, and helped me learn how to play competitive Tetris. I love this game with all of my heart.
But this PC port is horrid.
I've tried it every few months to see where it's gone, and every time nothing much is changed as it feels. It's literally just slowly adding things that should have been fixed in the first place. Most of the patches seem to be audio related, too. 
I don't know if anyone else feels it, but other than big issues like no custom binds for controllers and such, FOR THE LOVE OF GOD THE GAME FEELS SO DELAYED
I play a lot of Tetris Friends and a bit of Jstris, and they are completely fine. It's just Tetris, it lets you put your moves out immediately, no worries. I play the Switch port all the time. Once more, completely fine. Feels like what i'm inputing is registering immediately.
But for this PC port, it's so horridly delayed on my first match back in a while I couldn't even make a t-spin. It all felt very delayed and sluggish. I even tried a VS CPU match, and nothing was changed. It was just a mess and I hated it.

All in all, I'd say just get any of the console ports. Switch, Xbox One, and PS4 are the best as I have heared. Online is still thriving and everything for Switch for sure, from my experience. Just don't get this PC port.
