author: {'steamid': '76561198085207298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1608933938}
review:
The below review is written by my friend [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/mosaicmario]MosaicMario[/url] who has been playing this game through my shared library for almost 100 hours. Since Vavle doesn't allow people to post reviews when they only have played the game via Family Sharing I have decided to post his review with my account.

To get started, I don't dislike this game, I actually love the Puyo Puyo franchise and this game as a whole but after spending almost 100 hours of "playtime" I came to the conclusion to give this port a thumbs down. [url=https://imgur.com/E7iIEI1][strike]I also mark this review as "Product recieved for free" because I've been only playing it via a shared library and don't intent to buy the PC-port for now.[/strike][/url]

In short, you play either Puyo Puyo or Tetris or, depending on the gamemode, both for a race to top out the other player. It's very simple, easy to learn, hard to master and super addictive. The game comes with a story mode, arcade mode and online mode. Story mode just gives you certain objectives while showing you various funny cutscene dialogues the series is known for. In arcade mode you can play the 5 different gamemodes VS, Fusion, Swap (my favourite), Party or Big Bang with CPU players and/or other human players locally.

All these things sound like fun and they actually really are but why is my review negative? Well, it all came down to the ill fated Online Mode I spent most of my time in. To begin with, online is a ghost town, the best you're going to see is about 500 players online and I have played the game to almost every daytime possible. Most of the time its somewhre between 200 and 300 players online, sometimes even less. There are rarely any Free Play rooms available and rarely do people actually join them when you open up a lobby. Matchmaking is busted in this version due to the ridiculously low playerbase. I myself am a 10K rated Star League player and I feel about right in this range, most people have a similar skill level at the same rating and it is fun playing against these people. The problem is finding people in this range. Most of the time I end up getting matchmaked against the same people over and over and over again and they are either 15K+, sometimes 20K+ Grand Master League players or they are newcommers and/or low rated players like 2K, 5K etc. This alone can become really frustrating without adding up the time you sometimes need to wait to even get to someone.

And don't get me started on all the technical difficulties the game sufferes from. First, lag compensation is absolutely terrible. More often than not the game lags out when chains or attacks are happening. The game just freezes for a quater to several full seconds, blocking all of your inputs. I've lost track on how many times I've misdropped a piece because the game wouldn't rotate that damn thing because my controlls being disabled for a split second and then losing such a game to such a mistake. Other times you get matches where every input you make feels like an eternity to actually do something, sometimes the game lags so far behind that it just stops you and then waits for your opponent to catch up which can sometimes lead to unexpected, even unfair results such as your opponent setting off their puyo chain before swapping to Tetris, leaving you kinda defenseless if they already have a good swap combo set up (If you could have set off your chain too you could have at least softened or returned the impact of the attack). Usually when being in a game lobby you'll see your opponents connection quality in bars but not in the PC-port. You can still set up a net speed limiter but even setting it to the lowest setting doesn't help because you won't find a single person on earth due to the miniscule playerbase. 

Then it can happen that people don't leave the matchmaking queue properly (which isn't their fault) ending up as a player with 0 Rating and the Rank "Delete this Replay?" and being unable to do anything with them. And it gets REALLY frustrating when the game decides to matchmake you with this "person" all the time, basically disabling you from online play. And this happened to me A LOT and all you can really do is wait for that person to come back online or for the server to fix itself which is highly doubtful since the server also likes to crash, crashing everyones game when being online and resetting some Rating points.

On the topic of crashes, this game likes to crash too. Sometimes the game is just stuck at the win/lose screen in online without advancing to the next screen, forcing you to close the game and DC, losing a bunch of Rating points, EVEN IF YOU WON. Then the game crashes when loading certain menus such as the character select screen. These issues didn't happen as frequent as all the ones mentioned above but are still annoying to deal with nontheless.

And to top it all off the game comes with Denuvo Anti-Tamper. I spare you the details as you may have heared the story a dozen times before already but basically you cannot even start the game without an internet connection (but play it wihout once launched).

Don't get me wrong, I don't dislike the game, I actually love it but the PC-port is just awful, constant performance issues, terrible online, low playerbase due to how late the game came to the PC. When the game works as intended I have an absolute blast playing it but more often than not online decides to disappoint me with the above mentioned issues and it just turns into a frustrating experience.

This port is only for you if you don't intent on playing this game on a portable device (online connection required to start the game) and if you are only interested in playing the story mode and/or playing against friends locally/online and/or if you and/or your friends don't own a PS4 or Switch and don't plan on getting one. From what I have heared the Switch has the most vital playerbase off them all there is also the PS4 version but I have heared most players are from japan and depending on the timezone you live in it can be hard to find players. Sadly, there is no cross play, least of all with Sony.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352741748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1595819418}
review:
Comparing Puyo Puyo and Tetris together is like comparing apples and oranges. Except, well, you get a fruit salad here, and you've probably eaten apples your entire life.
Of all the Tetris games I've played, this is the best one. Keyboard controls work so very well, and my friend told me that gamepad is a dream too. I've never played Puyo Puyo before, but I can say that it's a profound experience. As a beginner, I feel so great when I get a 4-chain!
As for the game modes, Fusion and Party should be reserved for... parties. Both are complete opposites to the game's online mode, which has become only for the experts. 
I won't give out any spoilers, but definitely play the story mode. I cried 3 times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074187654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2639, 'last_played': 1596090751}
review:
Honestly really fun game, plenty of different modes to try, play and so on. theres really like, only one mode I dislike (fusion.)

There are fun side modes that arent vs modes, some endless modes, and plenty of characters and customizations you can choose from. 

Outside of the fusion gametype the only thing I dislike about at least the pc verison of the game is the kinda cruddy way of quitting the game. Rather than just having a clickable "exit game" button, this game has you back out of menues untill the initial splash/title screen pops up, when said title screen is finished, a red button with a white X will appear. and you have to click specifically the center, after the X has fully appeared. If you do not click the exact center, or click it before the X's appearing animation was finished, it will progress you to the main menu, rather than quitting the game.


TLDR: 
Great vs puzzle game, outside of one kinda annoying game type and an honestly kinda jankey way of exiting the game.
Totally worth the money if you enjoy tetris, and or puyo puyo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044031294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1577900793}
review:
I bought this only for playing a good Tetris for PC (played on a GBA emulator before that). It's hidden away in the menu but it's a great and polished game.

To play solo Tetris:
Solo Arcade -> Challenge -> Marathon -> (pick a character) -> Settings -> Endless ON (otherwise it caps at 150 lines) -> Play

There are other fun modes, they are all very polished and run very well. From what I gather from the reviews, only downside is matchmaking system and online play. The game is REALLY good if you're playing local or solo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174071034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1640218792}
review:
Highly recommend with arcade controller. I use Mayflash F300 Elite. The Sanwa lever has restricter plate to change 4 way only. This game works well with lower side performance PC.

アケコンで遊ぶととても楽しいです。Mayflash F300 Elite を使っています。サンワ製のレバーで、４方向限定に切り替えられるのでとても使いやすいです。低スペックPCでも遊べます。

UIは英語だけですが、音声は日本語にもできます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025212332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1601866129}
review: This is a very fun game, and is the go to paid version for Tetris and Puyo Puyo at the moment. The game does have a few issues, sometimes I will get stuck after an online game ends and have to exit the game, and some menus are a bit wonky. The skill of players online is also much higher in this version than on other versions of the game, so it may take some time to see results in matchmaking. I still recommend the game to anyone who likes Puyo Puyo or Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039580509', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1611709402}
review:
pensaba: "que tan difícil puede ser el tetris, es obvio estará en desventaja el puyo, ya que el tetris es solo hacer lineas", pues, me trago mis palabras...

Esta muy bien equilibrado, ambos juegos mantienen su dinamica pero ninguno presenta ventajas sobre el otro, tiene ademas excelentes modos, divertidos, ya sea contra la CPU o multijugador (por internet posiblemente sea dificil jugar dado que juegan puros chinos y extranjeros posiblemente te echen de las salas).
No es apto para gente que no le guste perder, lo harás muchisimo en el modo historia, y posiblemente multijugador, es complicado como todo los puyos, con su clasica curva de aprendizaje "te dejo ganar los primeros niveles para que te pongas contento, pero luego cuando avances... será otra historia..." 

en fin hay que dedicarle tiempo y ser paciente para jugar bien... lo bueno que tienes modos entrenamito ja, si te gustan los puyos, compra, no te arrepentiras!

PD. Anda muy bien en Linux con protón 4.11 con el 5 no...

review:
매치 시스템은 별로 마음에 들지않지만 빌드만 몇개 외우고 T스핀 더블 하는방법만 알아도 70%는 먹고 들어간다 생각하는 게임
그리고 캐릭터 해금을 스토리 모드로 해야하는데 게임 패드 있으신 분들은 패드로 언락키 써서 캐릭터 언락해서 그냥 쓰면됨
딱히 스토리의 중요성을 못느끼겠음음
내 기준으로는 재미있고 많이 해도 질리지 않는 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198055770922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 23869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6217, 'last_played': 1689919159}
review:
Do you like Puyo Puyo? Do you like Tetris? Then you already have a reason to buy this game. BUT WAIT! There's MORE!
-Amusing dialogue
-Great characters & voice acting
-Godly soundtrack
-Insanely fun gameplay, especially with friends
-Numerous game modes and options to try out
-Online play really isn't that bad, as long as you have some level of skill (just don't accept matches with people high above your rank)

If you like puzzle games of this sort do give this amazing game a shot.

review: Great game, and the story mode helps evolve your plays as it gets harder at a good pace. My only issue is the lack of players online. I wanna game with people, but there aren't many people available. If you go on ranked you're more likely to be matched with a top tier pro. People say it's due to poor matchmaking, but I actually think it's because there aren't many players... playing, so it matches you with whoever is there at the time.

review: Que puedo de decir soy fan de tetris y hace mucho que no jugaba al puyo puyo, esta conbinacion me encanta es una forma renovada y divertida para jugar tetris y puyo puyo con personajes "kawaii" jaja. ya habia aburrido la tipica musica del tetris o del puyo y esto trae algo refrescante. Lo recomiendo mucho!

author: {'steamid': '76561198140282198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4112, 'last_played': 1588405078}
review:
with 68 hours on this game already i decided to give a quick review of the game.

Pros:
The story
Puyo Puyo
Single player modes
Multiplayer modes in puzzle leauge

Cons:
Getting matched with ppl way higher rating than you
CPUs are quite inconsistant with puyo and tetris (example is some cpus preforme better at puyo rather than tetris)
Puyo Puyo in ranked can be annoying if your still mastering tetirs (like me)

Overall i love this game and the cons do somewhat drag the game down and make it less fun, but i still love this game and i play it everyday!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097675823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1701048632}
review:
Puyo puyo tetris is a action puzzle game, this is my number 3 favorite game of all time, when I heard that a new tetris game was coming out, I was excited, and it is everything you want, there is puyo mode, where you need to mach 3 of the same color in combo, its very trick, there is also tetris, witch is my 3rd favorite game of all time ever, and of course the main atraction here is the mixed version where you do puyos match 3 game plus the making lines of tetris, its a very complete game, 2 player local, multiplayer, single player, story mode, many configurations including resolution, different button combinations, I recommend the second option, where the up button makes the tetris pieces go down faster, and space bar to hold tetris pieces, the hold function is used to change tetris pieces and collect "back to back tetris" technique, where you do 2 times a 4 line combo, its awesome, but the fun don't stop there, if the spaces mach the tetris pieces format, you can trick the game and fix mistakes when you get to level 10 speed, when you don't need to use the "go down faster" button anymore, this technique is called, t-spin and it is the most used tecnique between pro tetris players, with that stuff people makes drawings while playing the game, its not easy, but its possible to do t-spins with every tetris piece, I only know how to do them with the "t" piece, the pink piece, definively I can recommend this one, best tetris game I have ever played, plus puyo puyo, sure I like mach 3 games too, there is also tutorials in the game, all optional the way its supose to be, the game I can absolutely recommend for all skills levels, from casual to expert.

+one hundred plus hours of arcade fun
+awesome different skins for both the puyo and tetris
+many different modes including endurance where you play how much you want
+epic main menu and the opening its outstanding it even includes demonstrations
+you can also save your replays after playing game and watch later, fantastic stuff

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999274142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 7173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4150, 'last_played': 1581757354}
review:
As a huge Tetris fan, I highly recommend this game.

The singleplayer adventure mode consists of typical light-hearted anime shenanigans, but the missions and three-star system provide something to do for completionists and an incentive to learn Tetris if you're a Puyo fan, and Puyo if you're a Tetris fan.

The multiplayer mostly works well, with only the occasionally laggy match. The game offers a sort of competitive ranking system, which I wouldn't take too seriously -- but it doesn't hurt and is fun to watch your rank grow if you enjoy online competition.

However, I mostly spend time in the solo modes such as Tetris Marathon and the Battle modes vs CPUs. My favorite part is the Endurance mode which has you fighting CPUs of endlessly increasing difficulty. It turns singleplayer Tetris into a high-stakes time killer, and the AI eventually provides a decent competition for someone like me who falls somewhere between the casual Tetris player and the seasoned Tetris pro who has memorized every variation of the DT cannon.

The party modes that have you switching between Tetris and Puyo -- or even playing both at once -- are interesting, but don't feel as finely tuned as the long-running Tetris and Puyo games. You'll probably discover ways to cheese these modes while trying to three-star the Adventure Mode missions.

Overall, I highly enjoy this game and it's my new go-to for Tetris over Nullpomino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079273996', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1532380463}
review:
High quality gamemodes, decent game, but a mess compared with the far superior console versions. Ranked mode has a big where some deliberate disconnects in specific scenarios get both players effectively a win, so rank doesn't really mean skill, even more than without the glitch with a ranked system that's about who plays the most rather than who is actually better. The game has frozen on me in ranked, and on an otherwise fine computer for running things, has lag. I could still play single-player, but Nullpomino is much better for that since I play Tetris a lot more than Puyo.

 I'd say it's an alright game, but the console ports are far superior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819473422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3559, 'last_played': 1552671908}
review:
This game is the SOLE reason I have invested myself into both Puyo Puyo and Tetris. From watching clips of it on Youtube to seeing people playing it online, I have been interested in this game for a long time. This game was one of the first games I have ever bought on Steam, and one of my most played to date.

(For those busy with reviews, skip to the last paragraph. For those wanting to hear my reasons for LOVING this game, continue on.)

First off, the most important to most people, the gameplay. For those who don't know, Puyo Puyo was in the form of "Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine" and "Kirby Avalanche", which were both Sega and Nintendo's attempts to see how audiences would like the core game. Gameplay is similar to those games, except that both were at Puyo Puyo's earliest mechanics. The core mechanic is still the same, with matching colored blobs in groups of four or more. By matching them, you can build up combos and bury your opponent in garbage puyos, making you the victor. I like this because of how it allows you to make combo strategies and catch your opponent off guard. Combine that with the line-matching gameplay of Tetris, and you have an intense game of "Bury the Player".

Now for the Story. I find it both simple yet enjoyable in how it tries to explain how both Puyo Puyo and Tetris even combined in the first place. The characters in the game are very expressive and true to their personality. For Puyo fans, most of the main series characters are unlockable and seen in the story mode. For Tetris fans, the characters representing the game also have their own unique personalities that can be enjoyable to see. Fun Fact: the Tetris characters are all named after each block in the game. 

As for any extra things, the game has plenty of those to go around. 5 playable modes are available in both Single-player and Multiplayer mode, making it so that you can experience the same type of challenge with friends or the computer. Online mode allows anyone to compete with players who also have the game, testing their mettle against pros or new players. The shop in the game allows players to spend credits to unlock new types of Puyos or Tetris blocks, and even alternate character voices. For those who played the original Puyo games, Japanese audio is also available so that you can hear the characters in their original Japanese voices. Finally, there's a training mode for those who have trouble figuring out the gameplay for both Tetris and Puyo Puyo.

(Now for the Final Results)

The game does a lot to let fans of both games get used to the mechanics of both in no time. The gameplay is easy to comprehend (given training mode), the story and characters are enjoyable, there is a variety of things to do even outside of story mode, and you can find some kind of topic to talk about with this game.  I personally like this game a whole lot, and so do my friends, so I happily recommend it to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447061680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1822, 'last_played': 1590243376}
review:
I bought this game on the summer sale and don't regret it. It takes a while to learn how to get good at both game modes, but I really suggest looking up tips and stuff. Learning how to Perfect Clear, build chains, etc. is essential for tougher matches. It's fun even if you're not too good, though.

The story isn't any literary masterpiece, but I found myself having a good time with all the characters and the light-heartedness of the game itself. It has a lot of charm.

While matchmaking can be unbalanced at times (I've found myself against 15k players a few times when I'm only 2000-ish in rank), Free Play is a good option to play without worrying about that. Just find some friends or a random stranger. That doesn't mean regular online is bad, though. You can learn a lot from that, although you should probably complete story mode and some CPU matches first.

Overall, a fun game for fans of both series... or neither, if this is your first exposure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034328396', 'num_games_owned': 1852, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3061, 'last_played': 1641027759}
review:
This game is great! Seriously the best iteration of Tetris you can play on the PC (officially), it also has a wholly different puzzle game in Puyo Puyo, which is also great, and good to see on the PC! Controls are responsive and smooth, only ever being interrupted by the game's less-than-perfect netcode (it sucks when I'm hard-dropping a piece that didn't rotate because of lag!). The content here is also insanely good for the price, with a full story mode, arcade modes for both games, a fully featured series of tutorials (that actually give you insight on higher tier tactics), and plenty of unlockable backgrounds, characters, voices, and skins for your Tetris blocks or Puyos. 
If you care about fun puzzle games, then you're only hurting yourself by not playing this. Also, PC is the only version to have the Japanese dub, which is [b]miles[/b] better than the English one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198328462746', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2121, 'last_played': 1650982476}

와! 게임한지 1시간만에 랭커를 만날 수가 있는 갓겜이잖아?

어려워도 이 게임 온라인 하실꺼면 기본적인 초반빌드 몇개외우시면
랭커급은 아니여도 초반은 버틸 수 있습니다.

저는 개인적으로 나올때부터 존버까고 할인하자마자 산 본인으로써
핸드폰 테트리스로 연습하던 유저라 재미있게 즐기고 있습니다.
사실 이렇게해도 승률 안나옵니다.

친구가 하기싫다고해서 친구랑 해본적이 없긴한데 친구들이랑 하시면 재미있게 하실겁니다.
...아님말구요.
(아싸라서 같이하실분 구합니다..)

후기도 잘안쓰는데 쓰다보니 장문이 됬네요. 죄송합니다. (꾸벅)

요약 : 개인적으로는 꿀잼, 고인물겜, 친구와 멀티 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 828, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1547779517}
review:
5.5/10

After the recent announcement of Tetris Effect, I realized that I didn't have a good Tetris game in my Steam library. I first played Tetris on the original Gameboy, and had since played off and on with variants such as "Acid Tetris" that I found online. Upon searching the catalog, I located Puyo Puyo Tetris and the horrendously-received Tetris Ultimate. Although I wasn't particularly drawn to the Japanese cartoons and had no experience playing Puyo Puyo, I decided to give this one a shot.

I had no idea what a Tetris "campaign" would look like, but in game it just appears to be various AI duels. You'll play one of four types of matches: Tetris vs. Tetris, Puyo Puyo vs. Puyo Puyo, Tetris vs. Puyo Puyo, or Puyo Puyo vs. Tetris. I quickly realized that I didn't really care for Puyo Puyo - the aesthetic and strategy just wasn't as pleasing to me. I wasn't interested in the competitive multiplayer aspect of the title.

In addition, Puyo Puyo Tetris is interested in a certain type of Tetris. In the past, I'd always played a sort of "survival" or "marathon" Tetris. I would attempt to survive in longer games as the blocks began to come faster and faster, most often achieving one or two-line clears. I would periodically achieve a tetris (four-line clear), but I didn't actively pursue them. In Puyo Puyo Tetris' duels, this is an awful strategy. It puts little pressure on your opponent as they can easily deal with the drip feed of trash you send to their side of the board, and it often took me 15 minutes to complete matches that had par times of perhaps 2-3 minutes. Puyo Puyo Tetris is all about the big clears.

After I'd had enough of the campaign, I went looking for standard Tetris in the game's Arcade menu, but it was challenging to find. You'll need to extensively navigate the game's menus (which appear to be designed for mobile devices), taking the "solo arcade" option, clicking on "challenges," then "marathon," and then navigate to a separate options menu where you'll set "endless" to "yes" before getting started. This mode works well, and is absolutely the highlight of the game for me. However, I didn't even know I could play standard Tetris in this game until a forum post online told me how to set it up.

Some of the other modes are mildly interesting, but in terms of scoring the game, these are offset by the irritating cartoon aesthetic of the whole package. One interesting "twist" on the Tetris formula can be found in the Tetris mobile game, in which there are preset configurations of blocks that you must remove through standard Tetris play. Perhaps if I'm looking for a twist on standard Tetris play, I should see if any more levels have been released on that version.

If you're interested in having a solid, basic Tetris game in your Steam library, it can be found here, buried in the menus. However, it's a shame that it's surrounded by so much mediocre fluff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125594617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1540591588}
review:
Unless you are the literal god of Puyo Puyo or Tetris, do not buy this game. I bought it thinking I would have a fun, relaxing time playing this game against opponents, but no. This is mostly because the matchmaking system is terrible. On almost every single game, I was paired with one of the best people in the world. As you can expect, I lost very quickly. This happens almost every single time if you try to play online. Unless you plan on playing only offline, then it's a pretty fun experience. HOWEVER: You still need to have a pretty good grasp of how to play Tetris or Puyo Puyo because the AI is pretty good.

If you want just a good Tetris experience that has [i] ACTUALLY FAIR [/i] matchmaking, just go to tetrisfriends.com

review:
Great game to play with friends. Matchmaking could be better, the balance of Puyo vs Tetris is wack (Puyo dominates around beginner to mid-high, Tetris has the main advantage at top-level gameplay), but overall, it's super addicting. 

I would also like to point out if you're not looking forward to the Tetris aspect of this game, get Puyo Puyo Champions. And yet, that game didn't bring back Oshare/Dapper Bones or Skeleton T. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198050654158', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 7175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6888, 'last_played': 1590980184}
review:
Although i love this game i can't recommend the Steam version.
The main appeal of the game is battling other people, and it does the job perfect when you're playing local, but online multiplayer is a total mess, you get people that are on the top 20 of the world to go against you in matchmaking, the game crashes a lot (making you lose some of your rank as you disconnect), there's a lot of network errors and somehow the game sometimes can even have input lag and desync with your oponent.
If you really want to play the singleplayer or have a group of games to play local, go for it, but as for online, i recommend playing Nulpomino, a open source Tetris game with netplay option, as for puyo unfortunately i don't know any better way to play online.
EDIT: Nulpomino is dead, but at least i tried.
Also, there's an online Puyo game called Puyo VS (with netplay), and people say there's a lot of players on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076006521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1531416473}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tsu is the greatesest  vs puzzle game ruleset of all time.

This game provides acccesiblliy and speed in finding opponents, giving it a population advantage over something like Puyo Puyo Vs. 

I know a Tetris Ultimate player who reports the same convenience for Tetris vs Tetris compared to other options.

However, the game does have a weak point - The actual Tetris x Puyo modes.

Swap mode - In my experience, you do all your offense during the Puyo part, and just stall out during the Tetris part.

Fusion mode - Will not live to be a long-lasting variant ruleset  because of being very silly - The core idea is fine, but Also allowing you to continue to place pieces while chains are resolving and the .5-1 second grace time for adding onto combos is overkill (and unknown to both source games) 

Finally, you can simply have one player do Tetris 100% of the time and the other do Puyo 100% of the time - This is controvertsial but I actually like it - The thing about this mode is the garbage and multiplier balancing between the two games but I actually like it.

Many people think it's entirely one sided, but there's actually a lot to look into, especially compared to (either games) default formulas which are obviously only balanced against their own games- The way I see it, Tetris players have the advantage at low skill levels, Puyo players at Medium skill levels, Tetris have the advantage again  at high skill levels, and finally Puyo becomes top again at the end. [strike]except against Japanese players who used to play on arcade boards [/strike]  I think the main problem people have is that making each leap up requires a lot of mechanical skill practice (moreso for the tetris player). The speed at which you can dig down, or how high you can chain in the first 30 seconds are very important.Personally, I kind of think Puyo being better  (for a wider region of time) is good, but that's just my bias toward a game I see as having the flexibility to include timing and incentivising watching both yourself and the opponet as opposed to only your own screen.

The game has a better in-game tutorial than most Puyo games, although it still ends about 1/3 of the way compared to what you can would be drilled to do by  [url=https://puyonexus.com/wiki/How_to_Play_Puyo_Puyo]  the community[/url] However, I think it's admirable that it gets up to sandwich, even if it's not quite GTR... compartively, that at least prepares you for the hardest level AI compared to other games.

The in-game story follows the Puyo Puyo tradition of being comedic - It's one of the silliest, although it's a single story game instead of a personal story for each charather. However, being able to go to a level select and having score goals per level helps make it interesting compare to the marathon (arcade style) of other games.  Personally I didn't find it that hard, but Puyo Puyo IS originally an arcade game - it ramps up drastically in midgame and again at endgame. I didn't have much chance to tell since I threw big chains at everything, but from what I've seen of steam reviews and (the day I forced my niece to play) it's a surprisingly stiff challenge. The computer's start to actively set up chains around chapters 5-6, and is where I suspect that non-puzzle fans get stuck . I did find the late-game Tetris missions to be a little stiff to beat myself, byt I enjoyed them for getting me out of my comfort zone. The end-game chapters kind of weirdly scale down, probbably because they are intended as a tutorial for the Fusion mode instead of challenging either your puyo or tetris skills. (The computer is awful at Fusion mode because tthey repeatedly drop tetris pieces through Puyos, and the animation playing out drastically slows the rate at which they place new places)

Recomendations 
+ Longtime Tetris VS or Tertis Ultimate player
+ Longtime Puyo Player
+ Passable Party game (big bang mode preffered for this, since winning by score lets everyone at play out the full time and although the one serious player will still almost always win, it crushes their spirits less than seeing their entire screen filled with garabge)

- Modes where Puyo and Tetris interact.
- If the thought of running into extremely skilled opponenets in the matchmaker is a turn off.
- While it is compartively more welcoming of people new to the genre than usual, it still gets scary fast, both computer wise and online wise

The game is intended for Console first, but the PC port is fine from what I've seen of it. I like it as a Puyo fan, because i find it more reliable than Puyo VS, and I actually enjoy the competetion. Personally I despise Multiplayer Tetris and only like Tetris as a singleplayer score attack game, but it's not too difficult to get good enough to at least power through the forced tetris missions in the story even with no previous Tetris VS experience (the reverse is a bit more of an uphill battle). The bonus modes and variant rulesets give you some fairly light puzzle challenges, which are fun, but probbably only going to need a single weekend to do their job.

I don't care which game my opponet plays, as long as I get to play Puyo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060769335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1538609069}
review:
Get 2 games for the price of 1 with this steal of a deal! Not only do you get puyo puyo you also get tetris! All for the low low price of $19.99!

Puyo Puyo Tetris Is probably the best competitive puzzle game you can get on the market currently. The game is built around your skill as a player as you work tirelessly to improve your speed and stacking abilities in hopes that you will be able to reach the top... or at least as close to it as possible. Challenge your friends, family, and even strangers online to test and improve your skill. While both Tetris and Puyo are quite easy to pick up and play mastering them is an entirely different story. It's a mixture of speed, precision, and skill wrapped up into one package where you can constantly improve. If your not a super competitive individual that's just fine because this game has got you covered. The single player adventure mode is extremely fun with lots of humor along the way. It progressively gets more difficult as you progress through each level but it rewards you with new characters and unlockables along the way. There are also training rooms where you can endlessly stack tetris blocks or puyo blobs to your heart's content. If you have any love for Puyo Puyo or Tetris then this is the game for you. I highly recommend it!

review:
문의할곳을 제대로 못찾아서 혹시해서 여기에 글을 올려봅니다
제가이 poyopoyo tetris를 45을 플레이 했습니다 정말 재밌게 하고 있었구요 그런데 갑자기 어느날부터 실행을하면 검정색화면만 나오고 실행이 되질않더군요 아마 puyo puyo tetris 게임내의 설정 문제같은데 게임 파일 무결성 검사도 해보고 컴퓨터의 여러 잡다한 업데이트들도 다확인 했는데 별 문제가 없어 이렇게 판단하였습니다   혹시라도 가능하시면 제  puyopuyo teris 계정내에서 설정한 옵션들을 초기화 해주셧으면 합니다 해상도나 캐릭터 이펙트 등을 말이죠 물론 안된다면 아예 계정을 초기화 해주셔도 됩니다 이 게임 유저로써 너무 재밌게 했고 앞으로도 재밌게 하고싶습니다 부디 오류좀 고쳐주시면 감사하겠습니다

author: {'steamid': '76561198044961483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 4102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3563, 'last_played': 1578623183}
review:
I like puzzle games and I like anime. This game has both. The gameplay is great, addictive, and the mods for the PC version can be really fun! The best part about this version is that you can change the music very, VERY easily, which is a godsend since you can't change the music in VS mode. You can also change the voices to japanese if you get sick of the defaults, and since there are alternate voices for each, there are 4 different voices for each character, which is pretty awesome.

Speaking of VS mode, I would highly recommend you play with FRIENDS since everyone online can and will kick your ass and, if you don't like losing a bunch of times, can be disheartening. The game has been out for YEARS overseas, even before the game came out on the Switch and PS4 last year in the US, so there will be people who are infinitely better than you. But, if you think you can do it, go for it, my man.

review:
I played Tetris and Puyo since I was 9 years. Then I saw every Tetris games which each of them has different features. Even I disappointed since this game has been released in PC 4 years later, I'm really having fun for this game[spoiler], instead of stress thinking about work [/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198057764083', 'num_games_owned': 3181, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 6099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5279, 'last_played': 1584115330}
review:
장점: 뿌요뿌요 테트리스
단점: 개발진이 소닉팀

테트리스야 그 자체로 완성형이고 완벽한 게임이라고 생각하는 사람으로서, 게임 자체는 한번 잡으면 손에서 놓을 수 없을 정도로 굉장히 재밌다.
블럭 쌓는 찰진 손맛도 제대로 살아있음

☆

근데.. 소닉팀 말고 좀 실력있는 개발진이 만든 멀쩡한 테트리스 게임을 보고 싶다.
최적화건 운영이건 개발진 마인드가 블루홀 급이라 300시간 넘게 하면서 세가에 대한 악감정만 생김

솔직히 정말 재밌게 한 게임이라 비추천 주기는 아깝긴 한데, 세가 놈들 일 똑바로 안 하는 거 보면 왜 소닉이 죽어버렸는지 알 거 같음

시벌 버그 망겜

author: {'steamid': '76561198101083526', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1234, 'last_played': 1574146652}
review:
WARNING: I CAME INTO THIS GAME WITH A FEW HUNDRED HOURS ON OTHER TETRIS TITLES INCLUDING THE GBA, AND NES VERSION SO DONT THINK IM TRASH 

Pros:
-Worth every penny on sale or not just by the offline content alone
-Net code is really good 
-really fun game modes to play with freinds
-Lots of unlockable content WITHOUT ANY LOOT BOXES OR PAID DLC
-Really easy to get into and learn puyo if you dont know how to play it, or tetris, or even both!
-Really nice graphics, so any system can run it at 30 frames min!

Cons:
-Story is a bit meh and easily forgetable
-(this is just a me thing but there might be someone elsewho thinks this)The only endless mode is for puyo
-some of the minigames although original are really obnoxious and dont make any sense ( i think its called fusion where it combines both puyo and tetris into just some god awfull chaos)
-the only people playing the game online are the only ones who play the comp mode and the have 10,000+ ranking (everyone starts at 2,000)

Soooo yea, if you want to get this game for offline mode or to play online with freinds, go for it, it is really good and worth the full price tag. But if you are going to get it for the online only and with no freinds, dont since the game has almost no playerbase (its constant but extemely small so not dead) dont get it or get ready to spend a couple hundred hours learning each game mode and all the strats for both tetris and puyo (or witchever one you dont know).

author: {'steamid': '76561197975250625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1617148163}
review:
I don't even know what to say, other than that I think this game is awesome. I don't think I need to go into too much detail on how both Tetris and Puyo play, but this is a solid version of both of them. At the same time. Or mashed together. Your choice. If you like either Puyo or Tetris, this game is definitely worth it. Puyo has always had charm to it's good to see a game in the series FINALLY come out outside of Japan for the first time in like 15 years. 

I hope SEGA releases more Puyo outside of Japan, and as a side note, this is waaaaaaaay better than Ubisoft's shitty Tetris Ultimate that they're peddling on Steam. Believe me, that one's a total scam. This is a much better option. And you don't need shitty UPlay for this one either. 

Overall, the game is colourful, it has excellent music including some classics and even some songs you'll recognise as having been in Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine. I highly, HIGHLY recommend this game for puzzle fans, and non puzzle fans alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215517320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1532749119}
review:
플레이하면서 느꼈던 단점

1. 맞지않는 밸런스
 뿌요뿌요와 테트리스간의 맞지않는 밸런스. 동실력이라면 뿌요가 훨씬 유리. 애시당초 다른 장르끼리 왜 대전이 가능하게 만들었는지 모르겠음.

2. 꼬릿꼬릿한 렉 
 유저수가 적어서 그런지 외국유저들과 하면 특유의 꼬릿꼬릿한 렉과 적의 공격받을 때 순간 조각 움직일때 렉이 걸려서 실수를 할 확률이 높음.

3. 이상한 매치메이킹
 처음 랭크 돌리는데 100위권 안쪽의 유저랑 매칭시키는 갓 게임. 이럴거면 레이팅을 왜 만들었나 싶음.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962308346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1641620276}
review:
For what its worth, I have hours on the PS4 and Switch versions of this game, along with Steam.

Come for the cute art style and characters, stay for the intense competitive puzzle environment.

Music is okay. I tend to just hang around the regular Puyo and Tetris themes, as well as the vocal themes.

Story mode's plot is simple, but engaging and amusing nonetheless. The English VA fit their characters, and there are a couple particular innuendo-filled scenes that got me busting a gut. In terms of difficulty, it starts off in baby mode, but there is a certain spike after a few chapters, so learn some chaining fast.

If you're a fighting game and puzzle game buff, I highly recommend getting into Puyo Puyo to learn chains and jump into VS mode. At higher levels, it's not just about who can make the highest chains, since if your opponent manages to match or outdo your chain while you're waiting for it to finish, the game will add a counter bonus to theirs. So, it's all about mind games to mess with your opponents chains by frequently dropping garbage on them. 

Unlike Tetris however, Puyo Puyo is entirely dependent on having an opponent to play against to practice chaining efficiently. If you don't feel like challenging other human players offline or online, the game offers an Endurance Mode in Solo play, which lets you play against a series of AI battles until you lose. Think of it like a Survival Mode from fighting games, if you will.

Tetris is always good, and it's matchup against Puyo is surprisingly fairly balanced for the most part. You can also do Endurance Mode with Tetris, as well. Marathon and Endless Marathon are included too.

Unlocking all the extra voices, Puyo/Tetrimino skins, etc. is quite daunting though. There is an unlock cheat code that immediately unlocks all the story-based unlockables (such as certain voices, and hidden characters), but it won't give you the things you have to buy from the in-game shop. Grinding the currency to unlock everything in the shop may take a while. Granted, playing any mode in the game will give you coins after a match.

2-4player multiplayer (online and offline) is a blast, with the option of free-for-all or team battles.

Party Mode adds items in your matches that can either help you or mess with your enemy (such as activating a garbage shield or preventing your opponent from rotating their next few pieces). I don't play it very much, however.

Fusion Mode combines both Puyo and Tetris pieces on a larger board. It is pretty intimidating to try at first, but I personally began to like it after I got a feel for the mode.


Anyway, this game is great. Puyo Puyo is a great competitive puzzle series that deserves more recognition in the West, and it combined with Tetris make for a great entry to the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139716817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1530131483}
review:
6/10 - Consistent Inconsistency 

Before I got this game, I had played Tetris a lot on websites, such as tetrisfriends.com or tetris.com.
When I got this game, I thought it would be similar to the other tetris games but it is not.

Pros
It has different types of modes which I like (tetris and Puyo)
It a story line and lessons to help teach you if you are new.
It has more variety with modes, voices, characters, etc.

Cons
The ranking system is absolute  t r a s h... For example, when I play online mode, Puzzle league, I can get put with people far below me or above me.
Many people seem to sue lag-switches... From my experiences, whenever I play against those who Puyo, we both lag and then whenever the opponent has a combo ready, the lag magically disappears and all the combos come straight- lag free.

Aside from those it is a good game. I would probably continue to play this but it angers me about how fucking trash the online mode is (from my experience)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037999326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1708912910}
review:
its tetris with a visual novel. what else could you want ?

Edit: after playing for 9 hours on puzzle queue I would like to add my thoughts on many of the reviews.

The matchmaking seems to be fine. You get to see who you're playing against before you play them. You can easily back out of a match if you see they are too high ranked to play with you and just play around your level. I don't understand why people complain about this. It is a different thing if you lose points if you leave the lobby when you see someone with a high rank but you don't lose anything except maybe a few seconds. 

As for lag, I do agree. There are some issues with lag where it becomes almost unbearable and takes a few seconds between each action but I'm not sure if this has to do with internet connection since it only happens once in maybe 20 matches for me. 

When it comes to Puyo Puyo completely outclassing Tetris, I don't seem to understand why this is a common sentiment. I was afraid when I started playing in Puzzle League that this would be the case but I have yet to find any evidence for it.

I admit I am biased since I have been playing Tetris for over 5 years and currently my best sprint time is sub 60, but that really is nothing compared to actually good Tetris players. The sprint record is sub 20 so I am probably average or below average when it comes to Tetris players.

I really have seen no issues with Puyo Puyo being better than Tetris in the hours of matches I have played in Puzzle League. If anything, you will find that most people are interested in playing Tetris as compared to Puyo Puyo when you go against others so I don't even know if this is the truth. I feel like if Puyo Puyo was that OP then we would have most people playing Tetris.

It seems like people might be salty because they aren't good enough at Tetris. That leads to one thing that I do find that this game does not do very well. If you are a beginner and don't know how to play Puyo Puyo or Tetris, this game will not teach you. You will have to look up guides online and watch youtube videos to figure it out on your own. There are "Tutorials" ingame but they are extremely minimal and not very helpful. I am struggling with Puyo Puyo a lot since I have never played it before and am actually having a lot of issues even one starring the Puyo Puyo campaign levels.

For people who are a little experienced and like playing Tetris though, and probably for the people who like playing Puyo Puyo, this game is great. You can play 1v1 live with an online playerbase in the hundreds and there is a visual novel element to the game which makes it fun.

Honestly if they keep releasing Tetris visual novels like this I will pick up every one of them and play them. Don't even have to change the game, just change the story. Since I love playing Tetris so much.

review:
장점
-캐릭터가 이쁨

단점
-서버 관리 없음

-전세계 단일서버임
-서버가 똥이라 한국인이어도 렉 겁나 심할 수 있음.
-한국인끼리 4인방 만들어서 해도 튕길 가능성 매우 높음
-키씹힘 심함
-랭크전에 인공지능들 돌아다님
-뉴비 없음
-고인물 존나많음

-하지만 강등전은 그런거 없이 패우자마자 바로 나옴

-한글 닉네임 지원 안해서 공란으로 보임
-지원만 안하는게 아니고 한글 닉네임인 상대랑 게임하면 튕길 가능성 굉장히 높음

review:
I'm also a person who used to play tetris a lot, more than a decade.
But even I think the matchmaking system has a bunch of problems.
Not to mention, server. Full of lags and network errors, even some user use this as a way to avoid getting defeated.
I'm a bit of a tetris-snob who likes to play online, but I was VERY disappointed and refund the game.
The game itself(such as single) is nice. However, if I have to pay more than 30k won to enjoy only that, I would skip it.
4/10

테트리스를 약 10년 넘게 즐겨했던 사람입니다.하지만 제가 보기에도 매칭 시스템 밸런스는 문제가 많네요.서버는 말할것도 없습니다. 렉이랑 팅김이 산재해서 어떤 놈들은 지기 싫어서 이걸 악용하더라고요.테트리스 나름 썩은물이었고 온라인 플레이도 좋아하지만, 굉장히 실망했고 결국 환불했습니다.
게임 자체(싱글)은 좋아요. 근데 그거 하나 바라보고 3만원을 내야한다면 전 패스합니다.
4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078474234', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2338, 'last_played': 1689750083}
review:
Bienvenido al mundo de los juegos de ports de consola-PC nichos japoneses. Como muchos otros juegos del mismo origen, tienes que [b]orar[/b] al juego [strike]y a la tumba de Compile[/strike] para que al menos puedas cambiar la resolución. [i](Como poco)[/i]

 Lo recomiendo igualmente, ya que no es el peor Port que he visto. A mi experiencia es incluso es mejor que mediocre. [spoiler]Esta vez tuve que sacrificar un par de cabras para hacerlo correr.[/spoiler]

 [h1]Es basura, basura encantadora. [/h1]

Contiene modos de juego en la cual podrías quedar boquiabierto por horas.

 El juego tiene muchos problemas de balance entre Puyo Puyo y el Tetris si no juegas de forma competitiva. Y te podrías llevar un disgusto o dos si te dedicas a jugar a Puzzle League [i](Ranked)[/i] debido que tendrás una posibilidad muy grande de poder tener privilegio de encontrarte con los [b]Top 10[/b]. Directo a al matadero, podrías encontrar una experiencia similar en el online de Skullgirls. 
 Está la forma de jugar partidas amistosas en las salas de Free Play, nadie lo usa excepto cuando está en rebajas, recomiendo usarlo para jugar con gente de tu mismo nivel. [b]Cuando veas gente de tu mismo nivel, intenta agregarlas, para invitarlas otro día.[/b] [i]Estás personas, que tienen el coraje de entrar en el online a pesar de su habilidad, son muy pocas. Aprécialas.[/i]

 La historia del modo aventura te introduce a los personajes principales de la saga Puyo Puyo [i]Madou Monogatari[/i] envueltos [i](como siempre)[/i] en una historia alegre y despreocupada, [u]apta para todo público[/u], sobretodo niños. Y con cada capitulo que pasa, te enseña a prueba y error, a tener tu propio estilo de juego, con una dificultad que aumenta de forma gradual. Totalmente recomendado antes de usar el online. [spoiler]Spoiler! Esto no te va a salvar de los top 10. Y seguramente serás pulverizado en segundos.[/spoiler]

 El modo online es muy básico, y con muchos problemas debido a su simpleza. La intefaz gráfica es una copia directa del formato consola, ni te molestes en usar el ratón. Llevan varias actualizaciones y la demanda de los jugadores por una mejor experiencia en PC son muchas. El juego contiene DRM Denuvo, y que a pesar de que haya mejorado, sigue siendo invasivo para los estandares de ciertos jugadores en Steam.

 Para mí es una bendición que este juego que haya tocado las costas de Steam, y es [u]la mejor experiencia de Puyo[/u] que he encontrado [u]en PC[/u] debido a la poca competencia. Si no fuese por Sega con la decisión de llevar a PC juegos que ni teníamos pensado que iban a salir fuera de Japón, no tendriamos este milagro en Steam.

[i]No recomendaría el juego comparándolo con otros títulos más pulidos de Puyo Puyo que aún no han salido de Japón.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023367384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1589571461}
review:
일단 뿌요테트 게임인데
가격이 다른버전보다 비싸다
그래서 만약 가격이 거시기 하다 느껴진다면 플스버전 사면 된다

게임자체에 대해 말하자면
튜토리얼이나 연습모드가 있긴한데
정말 스스로 동기부여해서 연습하질 않으면 온라인 모드에서 살아남기 힘들다

매칭도 그닥 잘 안되는것도 그럴수밖에 없는게 정말 이 게임은 하는 사람만 하는 게임이다보니 똑같은 이름이 자주 보인다는 것이다

온라인 랭크 엘리트 찍은 뿌요 유저로서 말씀 드리자면

대부분은 테트리스를 어중간하게 하는 유저들이 뿌요나 테트고수들에게 양민 학살 당하는게 대부분의 케이스

그렇기 때문에 테트리스를 조금 하는 유저라면 DT 캐논이나 게임 시작시에 쓸수있는 각종 더블 티스핀 트리플 티스핀 셋업을 터득하고 랜과 테트리스를 빠르게 쌓는거 연습하고 온라인 모드를 시작해야한다

뿌요 역시 마찬가지로
GTR 셋업 배우고 시작해도 되고 다 좋은데 일단 상대방의 화면을 보고 공격하는 연습을 하자 테트도 이걸 잘해야 되지만 뿌요는 특히 중요하다

그래서 결론은 썩은물이 넘쳐나는 게임이고 나도 썩은물이다

그래서 함부러 추천하긴 어렵지만
개인적으로 추천하는 이유는

뿌요뿌요팬으로서
특정 콘솔도 아니고 PC 스팀으로 유일하게 할수있는 공식 뿌요뿌요 게임이고
같이 할 사람이 있다면 몇박 시간해도 안질릴 게임이다

같이할사람 없어도 온라인 모드에서도 할만하면 그것도 오래 즐기는 방법이다

뿌요와 테트와의 배틀시의 벨런스는 영 별로지만 게임이 안되는 수준은 아니다
(물론 고레이팅가고 프면 테트리스 연마하는걸 추천)

뭐 그렇다 이 정도까지만 이야기 했음 여러분들 스스로도 살지 말지 결정할수 있을것이다

author: {'steamid': '76561198041047134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 34087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3884, 'last_played': 1694440210}
review:
Gonna edit my review a bit. Experienced tetris or puyo players will like this game.
There are a bit of minor setbacks though that can be quite the deciding factor.

- Matchmaking doesnt care about your rating so you can be paired up against the best players.
- Not as much happening but lag issues can make tetris extremely frustrating

Although it has many different modes you can challange yourself in like sprint, endurance and even ultra.
This game can also be modded, different characters, different puyos or minos and even custom nuisance indicators (which I did by taking the icons from puyo~n)

All in all, a great game, nicely to pick up when you get it at a discount

author: {'steamid': '76561198115090506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4315, 'last_played': 1710246545}
review:
시간이 가면 갈수록 서버 렉이 점점더 심해지고 매칭또한 너무 심각하게 차이가 납니다.
인원이 없다고 하지만 연패하는 상황에서 갑자기 레이팅만 2만점 차이나는 상대랑 매칭되는 이상한 시스템 개선이 시급하고,
현재 제일 심각한건 렉이 제일 심합니다.
내가 블럭을 하나 내리고 생성되는 동안 뿌요는 3~4개의 뿌요를 쌓지않나
상대가 테트리스라면 이미 공격할 준비가 다 되어있는데 나는 블럭이 안나와서 쳐맞기만 합니다.
그나마 렉 없으면 또 양심없는 매칭으로 레이팅 1만~2만차이 상대와 매칭.
진심 최악입니다. 
온라인으로 즐기는 것이 아닌 싱글로 즐긴다 생각했을때 32,000 상당히 비쌉니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165131929', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 18433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17773, 'last_played': 1637206351}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 is coming out! Rewriting a review given my two years of extra experience since the last review.

Puyo is probably unknown to you if you're some common guy from any place that's not Japan. It's nothing like Tetris, but it grew on me pretty fast even though I originally got the game for Tetris. I'm now at least top 15 regional for Puyo.

Tetris is Tetris. There's probably at least one thing you don't know about modern Tetris if you're just getting into the series, but it shapes out to be a really fast, rewarding game; less foresight and arguably less sheer mental focus than Puyo, but far more physically optimizable. Whatever floats your boat. I got damn good at Tetris too, just nowhere near top regional.

Both of these games are sometimes combined into other modes, but the indisputably most competitively viable is Swap, which tests both games, and has been a staple in tournaments. Swap is also as fun as normal Versus (well, for me, only if my opponent is competent lol).

So I've sank 600+ hours into these games and their derivatives (about half on Switch) and enjoyed them all so much.

Now, moving onto PPT2 hype. There was one great thing that held this game back: the forced Puyo vs. Tetris matchups in online. The former is going to be addressed in PPT2 with the addition of Mixed, Puyo-only, and Tetris-only lobbies. That's huge; it gives the game both a pure-Puyo league and a pure-Tetris league, while also being an official game ported to other platforms like Switch and PS5. The game will most likely be drawing in tons of players to all three leagues (and maybe less to the "skill battle" one lol) since it's now a viable competitive outlet for both games.

Should you get PPT1? Maybe not, if you're planning on getting PPT2. Incredible game with nothing uncalled for. Normal Puyo, normal Tetris, wrapped into one as the leading official Puyo and Tetris game for online matchmaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209319167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1703125370}
review:
Puyo Puyo & Tetris est un jeu qui a été créer par la Sonic Team et édité par Sega. En tant que fan de la série des jeux Puyo Puyo, non seulement j'avais décidé de me l'acheté, mais ça m'a permit de découvrir Tetris qui est lui aussi un très bon jeu de Puzzle. Après avoir passé de nombreuses heures de jouer à ce titre, voici ce que je pense de sa réalisation...

Points forts
-Plusieurs modes de jeux offerts. Il y'a Versus, Fusion, Swap
-Graphismes très beaux. Les couleurs et les décors sont très jolies et les personnages sont bien dessinés d'un style mangas.
-Musiques très bonnes et bien variés. Les mélodies sont très agréables à écouter.
-Jouabilité excellente, facile à prendre en main. Les blocs ne pas difficiles à enligné. Il n' y a aucun problème de ralentissement, ni de lourdeur.
-Durée de vie très bonne. On peut y'jouer pendant plusieurs heures

Points faibles
-Scenario pas intéressant.
-La difficulté est parfois très corsé et frustrante. Surtout quand on joue contre un adversaire très expérimenté qui effectue plein de combos pour remplir notre écran plein de blocs gris.
-Le mode Online est amusant, mais il est plus réserver pour les joueurs très expérimentés. J'aime bien joué à Puyo Puyo et Tetris. Mais je ne suis pas un champion. Je préfère y'jouer simplement pour la détente tout en m'amusant.

Conclusion
Puyo Puyo & Tetris est uns des meilleurs jeux de Puzzle que Sega a créer de toute son histoire. Avoir réunis ces 2 franchises dans le même jeu avait été une excellente idée. Vous y'jouerez pendant des heures tellement qu'il y'a de mode de jeux intéressants pour vous occupez pendant des heures. Il vaut vraiment le coût d'être acheté.

Note: 8/10

review:
[h1]Daddy, what is Puyo Puyo™Tetris®?[/h1]

[b]Well son, I think it's time that we have that talk about the birds and the bees! ;D[/b]

You see son, when two great games of the same genre with distinct game style from two separate worlds get attracted to each other, they compete with each other over dominance on who's going on top of the other in the ring of honor.

It's love at first, but it get's really intense.

You start hitting each other casually, stacking and clearing with passion. You send garbage to each other showing your pure affection for the other as tokens of love. The two gracefully flirt with each others hearts, one combo at a time. Oh, it is ever so beautiful!

Then, it get's rough.

The two start ****ing off violently at their A-game to the point where it becomes a game of domination, in a more pleasurable way. One get's butt hurt salty from the other's intense skill, and then the opposite would scream in agony from a long chain of garbage. ****'s really scary, and hot.

But in the end son, the two loved each other and produced a baby of it's own that adopted both wonderful mechanics from their parents.

And that, my son, is how you were born! :3

...

...

...

...

...

... Waht? D:

[b]10 out of 10, your adopted! :D[/b]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198173572302', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1680301556}
review:
Even though for now i only played this game for 2.5 hours. I am really surprised how amazing this game is. I'm still ongoing with the "adventure" before i jump into any kind of online games. The story is acually not that bad, i would expect it to be really bad, but as far as i am its really good. It even made me laugh a few times. I come straight from Tetris, im still a bit noob at tetris. Im terrible at Puyo Puyo, but i really think mixing these two fandoms / games together will make more players known to Puyo Puyo and vise versa. Overall i would give this game a five out of five stars! 
★★★★★

author: {'steamid': '76561198070796571', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 6654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1655571716}
review:
Let me preface this review by saying that despite how negative I may sound I am forced to still give this game a positive review as it's the best I've got on PC as a Tetris fan, and as far as difficulty may be concerned I have played very little Puyo Puyo but am a former Tetris Ultimate WR holder.



The game is a pretty fun mash-up of Puyo Puyo and Tetris, but it's not without flaw; the game is absolutely unbalanced, here's why. 

-A triple combo in Puyo (something I can easily manage and I'm terrible at Puyo) has potential to have about the same impact as a back-to-back tetris; this is absurd and broken.

-When all players choose the same game they will not receive the same pieces, I don't know if this is standard in Puyo Puyo or not as I have very little experience with it but I can say for certain that in a Tetris game you DEFINITELY should be getting the same pieces or the better player could still lose due to RNG.

-In "story" mode (Adventure? Is that what it's called?) the AI can tend to go ballistic and get 8-9 combos in Puyo leading to an instant loss, and I know they're not programmed to be this absurd surely, but it happens a little too often to be mere chance that they're getting insanely lucky.



Now that balancing gripes are out of the way onto other concerns:

-Netcode is pretty decent, ignore the people complaining about that, the reason for that is that I assume they're playing with Japanese players, hence the lag.

-In single player (haven't tested online yet) picking the same character will ALWAYS yield the same pieces if it's the first time you booted the game, as a dev myself I assume the logic behind this is that the pieces are "randomly" generated BEFORE even loading in, making it not random; I ran into a problem like this whilst making a random hero selector for Overwatch, the results would SEEMINGLY be random, but the "randomly" selected heroes would unintentionally be in the same order everytime.

-DENUVO. Are you serious? Who in the hell would pirate this that may have had any intentions of buying it in the first place?

-This isn't really a true problem but how in the actual fuck do you not have Alexey Pajitnov in the credits? If not for him Tetris literally would not exist, Sega. *EDIT: I noticed that Alexey Pajitnov actually IS credited, but it's during the introductory splashscreens and not the credits.



All in all it's about a 6/10 Tetris game, however this is raised to an 8/10 simply due to lack of competition on PC. I'm not really into Puyo so I can't judge it on that, but I'd give it about a 7/10.

Should you wait for a sale? If you're just buying this for the Tetris aspect then quite possibly, however I haven't witnessed it go on sale even once, so do with that what you will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119702048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1122, 'last_played': 1699433723}
review:
身内とキーボードで対戦したい！って方以外は大人しくPS4かswitch版をオススメします。

回線が尋常じゃなく酷いです。（当方有線接続）
普段テトリスでプレイしてますが、野良試合の半分はラグで置きミス、硬直で火力が出せずに海外勢はサクサク動いて攻撃してきます。
回線マッチング設定は最高にしていてもまともに対戦できた試しがありません。
鯖の問題でしょうが、どうにかならないかと思いつつ、残念ですが現状はオススメは出来ません。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969905274', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1527426068}
review:
Avoid.

Online the game is literally unplayable. Matchmaking is atrocious, and the latency in games is the worst of any game I've played this year. After clearing lines in Tetris it'd take 3-5 seconds to register, and each new piece took 1-2 seconds to load in. If you play Tetris competitively at a fast pace, this is unacceptably long time.

Offline was better but not great with random stuttering. Also the options are very bare bones and the lack of controller customisation is poor. Why can I not set specific buttons to left and right rotate? Menus are also convoluted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091716240', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1584988448}
review:
Incredibly disappointed.

I owned this game on the Nintendo Switch for a long time before this game and was excited when this was announced. After four patches I'm done giving the game the benefit of the doubt.

This game is colorful and fun and gives Tetris  a great deal of personality (something I'm glad it does personally, although purists may dislike it). It's a shame it doesn't make up for the incredibly poor balance the game suffers from. This game's balance is all over the place. For most players, Puyo will be a dominating force, nearly impossible to overcome. For big name players, Tetris easily takes wins. Big name puyo players can still make a name for thesmelves here despite competition from Tetris players, so if you really really need to play a localized version of the game, Puyo Puyo Tetris will do fine. Otherwise move over to Puyo Puyo Chronicle. For us Tetris players not named Jesus we'll just have to tough it out until the next game comes out, and hopefully it's not another Tetris Ultimate.

But now I'll delve into the real reason I'm giving this game a thumbs down. We've had four patches for this game since its release in (basically) March 2018. The console versions have had a single patch since their release in the west in (again, basically) May [b]2017[/b]. The console version patch was a rebalance that was applied to the PC version upon release. So what exactly needed to be fixed on PC? The numerous bugs it had (and still has), obviously!

The developers attempted to fix this game four times and still have not made a truly equivalent game. Although no longer an issue since the first patch, the issue was so amazingly bad it's honestly shameful the game came out in this state. Upon release, players were unable to filter out game modes. This meant modes highly unsuited for competetive play (Big Bang, especially) could be queued for, even if you filtered them out.

Since release, in Puzzle League (the game's ranked queue) the game seemingly makes no attempt to pair you with someone of similar skill. This leads to obvious problems like brand new players running into gods which results in incredibly one-sided matches nine out of ten times. You can also simply avoid fighting players who might beat you, since you will constantly be running into plenty of small-fry. This isn't a problem in the console versions of the game. There was also an exploit that could be used to quickly gain points without actually playing a match. Word has been going around that the exploit was fixed, but I've also heard that a new exploit is working, or that the old one might still actually be working.

The game also seems to have completely awful lag compensation. Either that or it literally will just blatantly ignore your connection filter and pair you with people who have awful connections. You can't tell, because unlike the console versions of the game, when you meet someone in the ranked queue, you can't see how many "bars" they have. The game doesn't simply disconnect you if the match becomes too laggy like it does on the console versions (noticing a pattern?) of the game.

Many people have also stated that playing the game with keyboard feels incredibly unresponsive compared to other tetris games. I'm inclined to agree. While I don't have a controller with a good enough D-Pad to play the game on, when playing on a controller my inputs feel much more instant and more responsive. There are a bunch of different reasons this could be, but I still think it's worth mentioning, especially because so many players prefer a gamepad to keyboard. Popular recommendations are the DualShock 4 controller and the Pokken Tournament DX controller.

When it comes down to picking which version to play, I guess it kinda depends.

[b]If you don't own a Nintendo Switch of PlayStation4:[/b] You don't really have an option here. PC version is fine. You might even enjoy it without being able to compare it to the console versions.
[b]If you own a PlayStation4:[/b] It really depends. If you are incredibly good and can be active at some weird hours (to compensate for the primarily Japanese playerbase) you'll probably enjoy this game. If you only care about offline I absolutely recommend this version of the game over the PC version.
[b]If you own a Nintendo Switch:[/b] Definitely the definitive "version" of the game. None of the bullcrap on the PC version with an active playerbase online. Get it here if you possibly can. I recommend digital purchase because it's more of a "between-games" type thing for most people, and also is 10 USD cheaper digitally,

author: {'steamid': '76561198304166952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4991, 'last_played': 1573012934}
review:
I love love love this game. It's fun and addicting, but not perfect. The story is kind of weak and the characters are hard to connect with unless you are familiar with the extended puyo puyo universe (which I didn't know was actually a thing until I started playing this game), and playing online with others is difficult because the lobbies are usually empty and even when they're not there's usually people there that are way above your level (literally my second game online was with the number 1 person in the world). Other than those things, it's great. 

Overall, I would recommend it. It's helped me improve in tetris a lot and the art style is cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009468163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2054, 'last_played': 1550584668}
review:
그냥 갑자기 테트리스가 하고싶어져서 충동구매를 했는데 생각보다 재밌게 하고있다.

하지만 고인물의 원조와 원조격 되는 게임 둘이 뭉쳐있으므로 청정수는 입문하기 정말 힘들다는 단점이 있긴 하다.

하지만 그런 청정수는 비슷한 청정수와 같이 게임을 하면 정말 재밌게 할 수 있을거라 생각한다.

현재기준 34시간 플레이했어도 아직 리그? 래더?를 무서워서 못뛰어 봤는데도 싱글플레이에서 연습 및 친구와 플레이만으로 이정도 즐겼어도 만족한다

앞으로 심심할때도 계속 건드려 볼 수 있을만한 게임.

단점이라면 조금씩 렉이 걸리기도 한다 (서버렉도 포함인듯)그리고 한글패치가 없다는 것 정도..

author: {'steamid': '76561198304888732', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 21097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7671, 'last_played': 1700517501}
review:
[h1][/h1][h1]Tetris meme review[/h1]
pros: t-spin duodecatris mini is a thing (thanks fusion)
cons: o-spin somewhat exists (thanks hold glitch) but not really usable[h1][/h1]

[h1][/h1][h1]More serious review[/h1]
Pros: Puyo players waited for a Puyo game out of japan in years, Tetris players wanted something on PC that wasn't garbage for competition, I wanted an official game where I could experiment modern Tetris rules convieniently. Everyone's happy cause that game is good.
Cons: Everyone's at a slight disadvantage and the game is somewhat more buggy than its PS4 or Switch counterparts (though it's being worked on and has improved a lot). Singleplayer could have used more modes IMO, like Tetris big mode (thing that Sega made an entire game about, see Tetris Giant/Dekaris) or a Puyo chain simulator.[h1][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141824856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6056, 'last_played': 1603927292}
review: Puyo Puyo Tetris is a wonderful game. It's vibrant, fun, and a bit addicting. Long time Puyo Puyo fans and long time Tetris fans will find enjoyment in the game in no time. Theres also a lot learning on both endings of the spectrum, and many reasons to come back to this game. It has a mulititude of modes, like Adventure, Solo and even an Online mode where you can compete against other players in a rank based system. Its quite easy to play with friends and many game modes you can play together, such as Swap, Fusion, Party, Big Bang, and of course Puyo Puyo vs Tetris. I would recommend an instant buy of this amazing puzzle game, if it wasn't for two big problems. When this game came out, it was riddled with many bugs and glitches. SEGA is trying to fix the bugs the best they can, however, even with patches, some bugs still remain. Lastly, the online matchmaking is horrendous. If you are a beginner, you'll more than likely go against top 20 players world wide. Since many beginners went against many top players, they have dropped the game and the online has become empty, you are more than likely to see the same players over and over again. I recommend Puyo Puyo Tetris on Playstation 4 and Nintendo Switch before I would recommend it for Steam, as none of those problems exist on those consoles. It's a great game, ruined by being a bad port.

review:
[list]
[*] [b]World's worst matchmaking system[/b] that matches newcomers to the world's top class players.
[*] The Tetris control method is full of artificial delays so [b]no one can play with their full capable speed[/b].
[*] Full of players who willingly use any method to win the game -- you'll experience lots of matches in which you place a single piece and have to wait the opponent to place 71 pieces so you can place your second piece after.
[/list]
[list]
[*] It works perfect on Linux, for only first 3 minutes. It's in my opinion worse than just not being able to run at all.
[*] Why the hell they set different prices for different regions?
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198003954938', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 7238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1697143438}
review:
Fan de Puyo puyo depuis mon plus jeune âge sur megadrive, quel plaisir de retrouver une de mes licences préféré sur Steam! Tous les défauts des anciens après Puyo Puyo 2 sont corrigés! Pièce identique pour les deux participants! (ou plus)
Le côté Tetris est vraiment bien intégré dans le jeu, tout en laissant les modes classique, ils ont su créer des modes inédits qui sont bien emboité avec Puyo! Un pur régal, sans oublier les voix Jap qui sont pour ma part une bénédiction divine (excepté pour O avec ses "Pipipipipiiii....")
N'hésitez pas à m'ajouter pour jouer à ce magnifique jeu!


ENG :

Fan Puyo puyo since my youngest age on megadrive, what a pleasure to find one of my favorite licenses on Steam! All the defects of the old ones after Puyo Puyo 2 are corrected! Identical piece for both participants! (or more)
The Tetris side is really well integrated into the game, while leaving the classic modes, they have created new modes that are well nested with Puyo! A pure treat, not to mention the Jap voices which are for me a divine blessing (except for O with his "Pipipipipiiii ....")
Feel free to add me to play this wonderful game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996501124', 'num_games_owned': 7813, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1605455868}
review:
It doesn’t matter if you want to pop or drop, Puyo Puyo Tetris satisfies with a wealth of ways to play and a solid puzzle experience. If this is your only option, the game is still worth seeking out. It’s easily one of the best Tetris releases on the market. However, if you have a PlayStation or especially Switch, you might want to consider picking up the game there for the smoothest possible experience.

Want to know more? My full thoughts have been captured in a Coverage Club entry over on [url=https://techraptor.net/content/coverage-club-octogeddon-tetris] TechRaptor	[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198043928876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7900, 'last_played': 1581257498}
review:
今作をぷよぷよファンという視点から一言で評価しますと、
『かゆいところに手の届かない作品』です。
これまでに実装できていたものがなくなっていたり、逆に小さなバグを沢山実装したりと、
現時点では今作に対する不満点が非常に多いです。

不満を列挙すると、
・日本語音声はあるのに日本語字幕は公式サポートしていません。(ファイルはあるそうです)
・アス比は固定です。
・本数カウントは1-3本までです。連戦には向いていません。
・PS4には実装されていたセットカウントがなくなりました。
・ちびぷよやミックスにはフィバのツモが実装されていて、フィーバーもあるのに対戦にフィーバールールはありません。
・適正レートに上がるまでが結構大変かつ、適正レート以外ともガンガンマッチングします。
・対戦の勝ち抜きでは、相手キャラクターが読み込まれる瞬間だけ動作が重くなります。
　勝ち抜き人数が増えると落下速度が非常に早くなるので、結構致命的です。
・コントローラの〇×がXbox準拠で変更不可

私はPCでぷよテトが遊べるという一点で嬉しいので買いましたが、
細かなバグが多く、細かいところに手の届かない残念な出来です。
ちなみに、オンボードのノートパソコンでも快適に動作するくらいには軽量です。
（※ノートPCではVSの勝ち抜きしかしてないので、普通の対戦時の負荷については分かりかねます）

ぷよぷよテトリスというゲームの本質的な点に関して言うと、
バランスも個人的には昔に比べてかなり改善されていると思います。

以上の点から、私は『ファンとしては垂涎のPCぷよだが、出来はイマイチ』という評価です。
ゲーム自体は大きな問題なく遊べるので、細かいバグを気にしない方ならオススメです。

これからはeSport大会も開かれ、ゆくゆくは世界大会の開催も視野に入れているそうなので、
皆さんも一緒に盛り上げていきましょう！
