author: {'steamid': '76561198025412019', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1689015818}
review:
Poco puedo decir que no sepáis de Tetris, porque es la fórmula que todo Cristo debería conocer hasta la saciedad. Sin embargo, [i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] es algo más peculiar y creo que se necesitan unas explicaciones que pongan en contexto este juego. 

[i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] representa la unión de esfuerzos por parte de SEGA de extender y hacer atractiva la franquicia Puyo Puyo a nuevos jugadores incluyendo su propia versión de reglas de Tetris. Este juego salió en todas las plataformas disponibles en Japón en 2014 (3DS, Wii U, PS Vita, PS3, PS4, One), y posteriormente en el resto del mundo en 2017 (PS4, Switch), marcando así la primera localización occidental de Puyo Puyo después de 13 años (Puyo Puyo Fever).

En Puyo Puyo Tetris, los universos de ambas partes chocan para combinar las modalidades de ambos juegos. La parte del juego menos conocida en occidente es, evidentemente, Puyo Puyo. Si bien es similar a Tetris, las figuras de colores llamadas «Puyos» caen de dos en dos y desaparecen cuando hay cuatro del mismo color conectadas. Se consiguen más puntos cuando la distribución de los Puyos permite que estos reaccionen en cadena. ¿Os acordáis de [i]Columns[/i]? Es más o menos parecido, solo que rotando las figuras. ¿Quizá [i]Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine[/i]? Es el mismo juego con un lavado de cara para MegaDrive. ¿O puede que os suene [i]Kirby's Ghost Trap[/i] o [i]Kirby's Avalanche[/i]? Es también el mismo juego, pero para Super Nintendo.

El diseño de [i]Puyo Puyo[/i] viene de la mano de Kazunari Yonemitsu, que lo concibió como un [i]spin-off[/i] de un juego de rol de la compañía Compile, donde trabajaba. Ese juego de rol se llamaba [i]Madou Monogatari[/i], y tampoco es muy conocido en occidente, pero eso es harina de otro costal.

Llevaba años deseando que trajeran algo de Puyo Puyo a occidente y me sorprendió la estrategia de localización para consolas, y ahora en PC. Me compré la versión de Switch y, sin dudarlo ni un momento, compré también la de Steam. Mucha gente descarta comprarlo porque «no es más que Tetris», pero es muy injusto calificarlo así. Los controles, los gráficos, la música, los efectos de sonido casan a la perfección y resulta muy satisfactorio y divertido, como jugar a Tetris DS. Y además se incluyen un montón de modos de juego, entre ellos online competitivo y amistoso.

El juego es apto para expertos de cualquiera de las dos facciones y también para novatos en juegos de puzles, porque dentro hay numerosos tutoriales y modos de juego sencillos de juego para novatos. Y además, los canales oficiales de 
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HyNDaUSqgE0]SEGA América[/url] y [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HWG16uAeNwo]Deep Silver[/url] en YouTube tienen vídeos para aprender técnicas más avanzadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261144311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 30788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5838, 'last_played': 1686924470}
review:
쓰레기 게임, 콘솔버전 일본 선 발매 후에 글로벌 출시를 하고 pc버전 글로벌 동시 출시 또한 했음에도 그 긴시간 동안 테트리스가 겪는 넷플레이 렉에 대한 해소는 전혀 이루어지지 않았다. (심지어 국내인과 대전해도 조작을 서로 빠르게하면 잔렉이 걸린다.)

콘솔버전의 큰 문제는 저 문제 하나였지만 pc버전은 더 꼬집어야할 점이 많다.
콘솔버전을 pc로 이식을 하면서 발생한 수 많은 버그들을 체크도 안하고 냈고 현재까지도 대부분이 패치되지 않고있다.

1.싱글 플레이 도중 pause를 누르거나 게임이 끝난 후 혹은 리플레이 시청 중 혹은 끝난후 start over를 누르면 상대 쪽 혹은 양쪽 모두 캐릭터 보이스가 안들린다.
2.몇몇 캐릭터들의 뿌요뿌요에서의  대연쇄 중에 후반부 연쇄주문이 들렸다 안들렸다 거리고 몇중으로 겹쳐서 들릴때도있다. 
3.리플레이를 선택하여 작업을 선택하고 작업을 실행하는 과정에서
마우스를 사용시 리플레이 선택후 작업을 선택한 뒤 작업을 선택하기위해 움직였던 마우스가 있는 위치로 커서가 가면서 작업선택 이전에 선택했던 리플레이가 실행되는것이 아닌 커서가 가리키는 리플레이가 작업 실행된다.
즉, 리플레이를 삭제할때 마우스를 사용하다 다른 리플레이를 삭제할 수 있다는 이야기다.
4.스프린트 기록 등에서 버그가 발생, 아는 사람이 직접 보여준 버그로 14라인을 지운 기록이 스프린트 기록으로 저장되었다.
자세한 과정은 모르지만 존재는 했으며, 아마 아직도 패치가 안됬을지도 모른다.
5. 이건 해결된 것 같지만 넷플레이에서 매칭되는 룰을 제한할수있는데 발매 초기 이 기능이 반쯤 먹통이 되서 vs룰만 켜놨는데도 빅뱅,스왑,믹스,파티룰로 매칭되는 버그가 있었다.  
6. 보이스 언어설정 변경 후에도 게임을 종료 후 재시작하지 않으면 캐릭터 선택시의 음성의 언어 변경만 안된다.
7. 대기실에서 채팅로그 사용시의 효과음이 잘못 나오는거 같다. 

그 외 캐릭터 보이스가 뒤바뀌었다던지 무음이라던지 bgm의 반복재생 구간이 이상하게 
세팅되있다던지 자잘한 문제가 많았다.

+ 2018/03/16 추가 내용
3월 16일 패치로 대부분의 버그가 해결되었다. 
다만 3번은 해결 안되었다. 4번 역시 패치내용엔 없는 듯 한데 버그를 일으키는 방식을 모르다보니 직접 확인이 불가능하다.

온라인플레이시 대전 환경에 대한 개선내용이 하나도 없는 것을 보면, 여전히 테트리스 플레이 중 미세한 렉 부터 큰 렉까지 다양하게 걸리는 것은 마찬가지일 듯 하다.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


그 외 자잘한 비판점

기존 pc 테트리스를 즐기셨던 나름 탁한 물이신 분들은 좌 우 이동속도가 느리다거나 이런걸 떠나서 하드드롭 후 이어서 회전을 매우 빠르게 누르거나 홀드를 누를시 반응이 씹혀서 매우 불편할 것이다. 이는 패드로 조작하던 콘솔버전에서 십자키의 활용도에 따른 정확성을 생각하여 추가적인 보정을 해놓은 것이라 생각된다. 실제로 패드 꽂고하면 콘솔버전이랑 조작감 면에서 이질감이 크게 느껴지지 않는다. 
그러나 pc 버전의 조작체계는 키보드고 게임도 키보드에 맞는 입력 제어를 지원해줘야 했다, 이 녀석들이 게임에 조금이라도 정성을 들였다면 위에서 말한 버그는 물론이고  
벨런스를 콘솔버전과 다르게 라도 해서 이런 불편함을 제거하고 온라인플레이 중에 잦게 발생하는 잔렉도 해결 했을 것이다.

+ 2018/03/09 수정 내용 + 2022/01/07 추가 수정

하드드롭 키 이후의 미노스폰타임(ARE) 의한 문제로 하드드롭 이후에 매우 짧은 시간 동안 좌우 이동과 제외하고 홀드, 회전키의 입력이 일시적으로 제한됨 좌우 이동 또한 미노스폰타임 중에는 DAS 충전만 가능
이같이 처리한 이유는 역시나 위에서 추측하듯이 콘솔버전에서의 잔재인 듯 하다. 

버그로 레이트 복붙버그가 있다, A라는 컴퓨터가 있고 B라는 유저가 랭매에서 레이트 18000점를 세워놨다 가정하자 이때 C가 처음으로 게임을 사서 A컴퓨터로 뿌테에 접속한다
C의 레이트가 2000점이 아닌 18000레이트가 되버린다

이는 이 게임이 서버로 보낼 레이트 데이터를 컴퓨터의 보조기억장치에 파일 형태로 저장해놓았다 보내기 때문이다, 여러 사람이 다른 계정으로 같은게임을 할거라는 생각도 안했는지
검증, 분할 같은거 없이 무조건 복붙 해버리는 것이다
심지어 이 파일을 뜯어서 레이트 값을 바꾸고 게임을 키면 그대로 서버에 전달되어 덮어씌워진다 
unsigned short 최대값인 65535까지 등록되며 정상적인 플레이로 도달가능한 레이트값은 50000점이다   

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

pc로 나온다고 구매하시는 분들도 많을텐데 이 글을 보고 한번 더 고려해보시길 바란다.

작성자는 콘솔버전 포함 플렛폼 통수만 3번 당했다.
(psvita(일본인들마저 테트리스할때 잔렉, 렉 걸림, 벨패 안해주고 결국 버려짐)->ps4( 벨런스 조정, 한글판 출시했길래 샀는데 해외인과 대전시의 잔렉, 렉 해결 안해주고 문의 답변도 뭣같이 옴, 국내인과도 넷플레이 렉 존재)->pc(위에서 말한대로)) 
이거 잘 안팔리기라도하면 얘내 벨런스고 버그고 패치할 생각도 안가질거라고 봄.

+ 2018/03/16 추가 내용 + 2022/01/07 추가 수정

버그가 모두 해결되더라도 넷플레이 렉이 해결되지 않는 이상 최종평가는 변치 않을 것이다,
물론 초보레벨 분들은 이제 사 볼 법하다 생각한다, 애초에 퍼즐게임은 적은 유입 고려와 싱글에서 직접 학습+ 탐구를 통해 얻는 실력과 재미가  더 있다 생각되서 싱글 플레이 겜으로 생각하고 구매해보는 것은 나쁘지 않을거 같다. (특히 뿌요뿌요의 경우 넷플레이 잘해도 스트레스 어디 안간다, 운빨 망겜, 견제 망겜이기 때문, 운적 요소와 철권 7의 붕권 마냥 살인적인 견제 데미지를 금기사항을 지켜가면서 쌓으면서 2중 3중 발화구 설계하는 것으로 다른 생각 없이 최대한 운요소를 회피하려는 식으로  해결하려다보니 그에 준하는 실력 요구로 진입장벽이 너무 높아지고, 그러한 실력 조차 없거나 그러한 실력이 있더라도 운에 대한 어이없는 패배 등으로 스트레스를 엄청 받게된다.  실제로 넷플레이를 거진 접고 싱글플레이에서 자신만의 미학을 갖고 이것저것 해보시는 분들도 많다.)

퍼즐겜인데 불구 하드웨어 성능이 상당히 필요하다, 노트북에서 돌리기엔 빡센 정도인데  이 또한 비추천 이유 

현재는 어지간하면 추천할만한 게임이 아니다 하단의 2021/10/16 추가 내용 참고

이제 하다못해 상위권 유저들이 어뷰징으로 레이트 주작함 하루 넘짓 지났는데 아직도 처리 안됨.... 역시 갓겜. Singen777,z2Sam,ookamisuketodara,wumbo(어뷰징 하던
 둘을 상대한 것 뿐이나 의심의 소지가 많음) 이렇게 4명이 추궁받고 있는 중. wumbo를 제외한 셋은 사실상 확정
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+2021/10/16 추가 내용 + 2022/01/07 추가 수정

뿌요뿌요를 좋아하는 사람은 뿌요뿌요 챔피언즈를
테트리스를 즐기고싶으신 분은 테트리스와 매우 유사한 Tetr.io를 추천하며
Tetr.io 마냥 너무 빠르지는 않은 모던 테트리스를 좋아하는 분들에겐 테트리스 이펙트: 커넥티드 구매를 추천함

 뿌테 혹은 뿌테2의 경우 뿌요vs테트 전을 정말 즐기고 싶은분들에게 한해 50퍼 이상의 큰폭으로 할인을 할때가 오면 그때 구매하시는 것을 권장함

사실 뿌테나 뿌챔이나 스위치 있으면 온라인플레이 패스 비용 내더라도 스위치버전으로 하는게 좋다 봄, 휴대성도 휴대성이지만 유저풀의 규모 차이가 압도적임

*테트리스 이펙트의 경우 스위치, 플스, pc, 엑박판 등 출시한 전 기종에 있어서 크로스플렛폼을 지원하고 넷플레이 환경도 매우 준수한 편이여서 휴대하면서 할거면 스위치, 그게 아니면 pc판 구매하시는게 좋을거같다. 이외의 콘솔버전은 pc의 그래픽카드의 스펙이 최소사양에 비해 꽤나 떨어지는 상황일때 권장함. (르누아르 4650g 내장으로 돌려봤었는데 옵션타협하니 충분히 잘 돌아갔음)

테트리스 이펙트 역시 콘솔로 먼저 나온 게임이라 위에서 말한 십자키 조작을 위한듯한 보정이  들어가있긴함
국내에선 미노스폰타임, 해외에선 ARE라 불리고 있는 시스템으로 해제는 안타깝게도 불가능하나 ihs와 irs를 지원하여 미노스폰타임 중 das충전 이외에도 홀드와 회전을 선행입력할 수 있음
테트리스 이펙트가 크로스 플렛폼 매칭이 가능한 게임인걸 생각하면 그래도 이해는 가는 부분

review: Finally a Puyo Puyo game for PC, the last one was Fever AFAIK. The good thing is.. JAPANESE VOICES!! and I hope we can see Steam workshop in this game soon for official mods, just like old music, adding characters like puyo vs (rip puyo vs, kek) and those things that some guys doesn't give a *** but some others, really want it as a must.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084667749', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1538, 'last_played': 1612548128}
review:
If you like connecting blocks or blobs while anime characters and humanised tetriminos shout at each other, this is the game for you.
Puyo Puyo Tetris has five main modes.
Versus - A simple 1-on-1 match, where you can pick Tetris (which is at a slight disadvantage) and Puyo (which is OP). If you're used to Guideline Tetris, that's what's being used, save for a few adjustments made for balancing. Prepare to be four-wided if you're playing against Tetris.
Swap - Puyo and Tetris. You swap between the games and can get "swap combos", which are OP. Prepare to be four-wided.
Big Bang - Puyo or Tetris, with preset boards which you have to clear. The more you clear, the more damage you do. Tetris is OP and Puyo cannot beat it.
Fusion - Puyo and Tetris on the same board. It's weird, janky, you can get a 99 chain and cover your opponent's board in garbage. Schezo and Klug are OP, apparently.
Party - The mode nobody likes. It's unfair no matter which gamemode you play. Characters have different dropsets and chances of what powerups get. Schezo and Klug are OP apparently.

Despite it's shortcomings and this port being buggy, it's a good game. What I've said is cynical, yet most of it is accurate. Don't be scared to play, though, the game will mostly pair you with the right people...
...except... sometimes, you get matched with some top-ranked people.

I recommend playing through Adventure mode first before going to online, since it introduces you to every mode and has a pretty okay difficulty curve. Online, you can choose which mode you're the best at (besides Swap and Fusion, which are both), so if you can only play Tetris, then play Tetris with your heart's content.

Is it worth 20$? Maybe not in it's current state. This is a buggy port that likes to crash. However, I know in the future it will be worth it, so buy it if you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061686401', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1532668817}
review:
Easily one of the best puzzle games on PC, and without a doubt the best version of Tetris on Steam. [i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] combines the two titular puzzle games into one along with some fun spins on them.

Pros

+ Tetris and Puyo Puyo are a blast to play.
+ Adding to the above point, this game is basically two puzzle games in one with extras.
+ Cute story with challenges in each level.
+ Colorful visuals.
+ Lots of game modes ranging from regular Tetris/Puyo to fun twists on both puzzles.
+ Tons of ways to customize the music/visuals.
+ Up to 4 people can play against each other locally or online.

Cons

- Music loops are really awkward since the songs just end abruptly and replay.
- Most of the time when an error happens online, I have to alt-F4 out of the game since it would just keep me in the disconnected game.

This game is very addicting and made even better with friends. A must have for puzzle fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005372822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1601280125}
review: Not reccomended you go into the Ranked mode. the top level players are actually hackers, Played against the 5th "best" person in the world and watched them closely.. cleared one line. ONE. and mine was instantly filled up and crashed the game as I assume it was filled up with an amount of lines that was impossible for the game to handle... and even then.. lets talk about match making. when you're put in the pool... you'll be put in a pool with everyone. all players above your rank all the way up to Rank 5 in the world at the very highest I've run into. you don't get to chose your mode you want to play as, it's pure random chaos on that part. like tetris? TOO BAD you get to be forced to play switch where over hald the time can by puyo puyo. don't like the weird Hybred game? TOO BAD, over 50% of my matches were exactly that. don't like the weird Puzzle mode that makes no sense in how damage is delt? TOO BAD thats in the pool. please, if you want a better review from me, or at least to not piss off anyone besides the most hard core players of the game who want to venture into the Ranked mode. FIX YOUR GAME. Let people chose their ranked mode so they can play what they are good at with out it punishing them for not being good at every conceviable game mode. don't want to be forced constantly to play against play ranked 100 and up in the world? set the match making to put you in matches against similarly ranked people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296713891', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1702140935}
review:
[h1]日本語化有り・よくエラー落ちする方へ[/h1]
puyo様(@puyonihongo)より[url=https://app.box.com/s/ddiv2hxq4nse5mzpoeihybjgjex7cqtt] 非公式日本語化パッチv7 [/url]が出てます。
感謝しつつ導入しましょう。(03/15現在最新)
　
プレイ中頻繁にエラーを起こし落ちてしまう方は、
コントロールパネル＞管理ツール＞サービス
または
Windowsキー+R を押し「services.msc」と入力しエンター
より、
"Touch Keybord and Handwriting Panel Service"
というサービスを無効、停止し適用することでエラーを(ほぼ?)無くす事ができます。
少なくとも自分はできました。
無効のままだとキーボードが上手く動作しないので
遊び終わったらサービスを有効・開始し適用するのを忘れずに。
　
[h1]ソニックに並ぶセガの代表作は健在[/h1]
数年前にぷよぷよを遊んだ思い出に誘惑され衝動買いしました。
上手くないので現在はアドベンチャーモードを楽しんでいます。
ぷよぷよしか出来ないのに序盤からテトリス勝負だったり、
パーティという中々うんちなルールを指定されたり四苦八苦しますが、
この世界の登場人物は相変わらずみんな愛らしく、とても楽しめています。
　
既にテレビゲームでヒットしていた本タイトルなので、
ぷよぷよファンも、テトリスファンも、ぷよテト経験者も、
初心者から上級者まで安心して始められると思います。
初期設定だと英語の音声と字幕なので、そこだけ注意です。
英語音声はシグが普通に男声で初見時は困惑しましたｗｗ
設定のAudioの項目から音声を日本語にし、再起動すれば変更されます。
字幕は英語しかありません。なんでや…
　
日本だけ1400円ほど高かったり、
他の楽しそうなセガのゲームが日本で買えなかったり、
少し寂しいので今後は色々気軽に遊ばせて欲しいなぁ(願望)
　
まだリリースされたばかりで不具合もあるようなので、
字幕の公式日本語化もあわせて対応して欲しいですね。
あと欲を言えばコントロール設定を
ぷよとテト個別で細かく設定できたら嬉しいです。
　
ぷよぷよばかり言及していますが、テトリスもキャラ良し、奥深さ良しです◎
これを機にテトリスの上達にも期待しています。
アドベンチャーモード残り40%、オール☆3挑戦してきます！！
　
[追記]
終盤のシナリオのぷよテトミックスというルールが激ムズすぎて☆3辛いです…
[追記2]
クリアしました！
ぷよテトミックスの攻略法ですが、ぷよをひたすら3つ繋げて
テトをある程度綺麗に積んだらテトを最初に数ライン消して
ぷよを畳みかけるように消し続けると勝てました。
☆の条件がスコアの時はわざと長期戦にしてコツコツ稼げば☆3も出来ました。
パーティーは運が結構絡むので未だに安定法が掴めません。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198055545271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1560563233}
review:
I am an old Tetris fan, it's a relaxing and fun way to pass the time, and I'm always looking for modern equivalents without too many extra bells and whistles. This game has that AND the bells and whistles, but what I love is that so much of it is optional, depending on how you want to play. I've played Puyo before on other platforms, and likely the only reason I'm not more into it is that I'm not very good at it yet. Hopefully this game changes that. I'm in love with the characters, interface, and style of the game very much, they did an excellent job of it. The only problem is, as many reviews have mentioned, a lot of sound bugs and lagging. I actually almost refunded my purchase in the hopes that I could purchase it on another platform that might run better, I wasn't sure how quickly SEGA would release a patch. Lo and behold, they did, and I'm glad I didn't jump the gun and refund it after all. I hope the devs continue to work on the port. 

All in all, a solid, bright little puzzle game in the midst of a serious lack of good tetris versions for PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279758766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 3828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1607466976}
review:
[h1] Puyo Puyo Tetris [/h1]
[i]Reviewed as of 3/3/2018. Subject to change as patches and updates are released[/i]
[i]Categories are rated via a 5-Star system, then their average is multiplied for a total score out of 10.[/i]

[b]Quick Look[/b]
[table]
[tr]
[th]Category[/th]
[th]Score[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Visuals ★★★★☆[/td]
[td]4/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Interface ★★★☆☆[/td]
[td]3/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Gameplay ★★★★★[/td]
[td]5/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Multiplayer/Online ★★★☆☆[/td]
[td]3/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Story/Progression ★★★★☆[/td]
[td]4/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Soundtrack ★★★☆☆[/td]
[td]3/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]DLC/Other ★★★★★[/td]
[td]5/5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]---[/td]
[td]---[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td]Overall[/td]
[td]7/10[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]


[h1] Overall: 7/10[/h1]
[b]Overall, Puyo Puyo Tetris is currently the best offering for a puzzle game of this nature on Steam. It offers a solid version of both games with tight controls and satisfying feedback, entertaining multiplayer for casual and competitive play, and cute added bonuses with adventure mode and its entertaining character interactions. However, minor issues stain the game and make it seem less polished, and some issues in multiplayer (some cheaters, unbalance between Puyo and Tetris scoring) prevent this from being a viable game at a highly competitive level. However, if you want a good version of Tetris or Puyo, grab this. If you want to try out a clever mashup of the two offering solid gameplay for both individually as well as brand-new modes that are both challenging at a high skill level and fun in a casual environment, grab this. It is a competent mashup of two beloved puzzle games.[/b]


[h1]Categories:[/h1]
[i]Bullets marked with a '+' are pros and ones marked with '-' are cons.[/i]

[th][b]Visuals / Graphics / Design[/b] [i]4/5[/i]
+ Consistent cartooney art style and aesthetic that is pleasing to the eye
+ Well-defined and distinct characters
+ Easy to read / keep track of 
     + Well-defined boundaries, clearly visible ghost blocks
+ Cosmetic changes via customization
     + May conflict with art style, but most options look nice (subjective)
+ Satisfying animations and visual reaction to chains and combos

[b]Interface (Ease of Use / Utility / Navigation)[/b] [i]3/5[/i]
+ All options are clearly defined in large tiles in the main menu
+ Text for buttons is minimal and to the point
- Some options such as making marathon mode endless are tucked away until the very last stages of changing settings
- Shop and other features are tucked away and grouped with 'Options' rather than its own category
- No quick start to launch directly into Tetris marathon or Puyo modes (something simple like marathon still requires clicking through many screens)

[b]Gameplay[/b] [i]5/5[/i]
+ Keyboard controls are very responsive
+ Satisfying feedback for chains and combos
+ Engaging audio feedback
+ Fluid transitions between modes and in combined modes
+ Variety of gamemodes including many new unique ones
+ Still enjoyable if you are not great at both games

[b]Multiplayer/Online Functionality[/b] [i]3/5[/i]
+ Variety in gamemodes
+ Gameplay remains smooth along with transitions
+ Entertaining and engaging with a full set of four people
- Tetris & Puyo are unbalance in a competitive setting; Puyo builds up scores much higher than can be competed with in Tetris simultaneously
- Ranked play is unfair at first (matched with high-rated Tetris player in first ranked game, destroyed within seconds) and some high rated players are likely cheating
- Unable to find rooms in Free Play (unclear if it is low player count or an actual issue)
___
Multiplayer is great overall for casual play and play with friends

[b]Story / Progression[/b] [i]4/5[/i]
+ Delightfully cheesy story in adventure mode; perfect for a puzzle game
+ Fun characters, lighthearted tone
+ Doesn't take itself too seriously
+ Characters & Interactions parody gaming and anime tropes
+ Adventure unlocks new backgrounds and music for arcade play
+ Variation throughout adventure mode (combinations of Puyo vs Tetris, Puyo vs Puyo, etc.)
+ Easy to get into, CPU opponents offer greater challenge as you move forward
     + Forces you to practice both modes (I'm not great at Puyo, but breeze through the Tetris bits. Encountering a Puyo level offers more challenge and requires a change of pace)
- A bit one-trick (as expected). Once you play through all combinations of the two games once, you don't really need to continue with Adventure mode unless you want to enjoy the characters.

[b]Soundtrack / Sound Effects[/b] [i]3/5[/i]
+ Simplistic, fun songs fitting of a puzzle game
+ Fun, positive feedback for combos and chains
+ Characters call out attacks and offer other quick interaction mid-game as large combos are unleashed
- Some tracks don't work well in the repeating format (get annoying way too quickly)
- Awkward stops when repeating; song will abruptly end before starting over

[b]Other (Microtransactions, DLC, etc)[/b] [i]5/5[/i]
+ Cosmetic shop using in-game currency obtained via normal gameplay (skins for puyo and tetronimos, alternate voice packs for characters)
+ Currency earned at a steady rate via repeated play of solo arcade modes or online play
+ Changes are purely cosmetic and subjective; no advantage is given for spending more

author: {'steamid': '76561198049190316', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1601856506}
review: After playing this at the PC Gamer Weekender event and throughly enjoying myself, and it not being expensive, I thought I might as well give it a go in the comfort in my own home.  I do really like the game, the story mode is strangely all fully voiced which I wasn't expecting, there are improvements that I think could be made, I don't enjoy being matched up with the champion players that are a way higher rank than me, more and more I find myself getting absolutely destroyed by a random Japanese person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025271200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1606181510}
review:
It's just Puyo Puyo and Tetris thrown together.... I have time for a few quick rounds, right?

*Several hours later...*

...Wait, where did all that time go?!  Oh well!

Anyways, I'm glad to finally see a good Puyo Puyo (And Tetris) port come to the PC. It's been a long time coming. Yeah, it's based more on the Puyo world characters and their nothing-ever-changes except Teris is thrown in this time plot  (Yes, this is very much a SEGA-made title), but if you're looking for some hot Puyo or Tetris action, this title will fill both desires comfortably. This seems to be a pretty good all-ages and skill levels game.

UPDATE: After some messing around in each of the game modes and Adventure Mode, I found that Tetris isn't as well suited for the much faster paced Puyo format (Most notably in the mixed modes), as most of my victories are coming off the much easier  to pull off Puyo chains rather than clearing Tetris lines in chains -  a powerful Puyo chain is usually more than enough to obliterate your opponent (Often several times over), whereas you have to have a long line chain (Or clear multiple Tetrises in a row) to have a shot at taking a Tetris player out.

It's a fun game concept that can easily suck several hours out of your day when you're not looking... but if you're on the fence, the usual wait-until-it-goes-on-sale rule applies.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998922078', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1520042182}
review:
TRIGGER WARNING: UNPOPULAR OPINION AHEAD

You will see reviews and videos say this game is worth it, even if you're only looking for Tetris. I couldn't disagree more.

If you're looking for Tetris, and only Tetris, stay far, far away, even if the Tetris mode IS slick and nice. this game is cringe-incarnate, unless you turn off voices and music, which then creates a massive void of anything interesting going on but it's more bearable than the voices, childish music covers and bicycle horns. 

Even then, once you've made the game bearable to play, you can't help but notice the game is very much pushing for Puyo Puyo. The only three Tetris modes include "sprint" (40 lines, best time), "marathon" (classic-ish) and "Ultra" (3 minutes, high score)

The game talks to you as if you've just learned to read, 
"Instructions etc,"
"Ready? Okay!"
"This is going to be fun!"

While I'm sure Adventure mode gets more challenging, playing through the first world is a snore.

For clarification, I've no issue playing games made for a younger audience, but this game is nauseating and honestly offensive to anybody over the age of 7.

I just want Tetris... Only Tetris... Hell, it could be Marathon only and I'd be more than happy, but not at $26 CAD. I had my hopes up for this game to surprise me. Until something better comes along, this has just finalized my decision to buy a copy of Tetris fucking DS off eBay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042343474', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1306, 'last_played': 1559411825}
review:
Review from a random guy who likes and is Ok at Tetris and who likes and is not the worst at Puyo.

Pros:
Is a Tetris game.
Is a Puyo Puyo game.
Both have been combined into one.
Lots of different game modes.
Waifus.
Singleplayer, local multiplayer and online multiplayer.

Cons:
Capped at 60 fps.
Online matchmaking doesn't function very well/at all. I've been ranked against the second best player in the world and I suck. This might be due to the fact that there are barely any players online, in non-ranked you are lucky to find one party to play with.
Too easy to 130% story mode.
Music doesn't loop properly.
Denuvo.
No mods, yet! Custom skins/music/sound effects would be wonderful. I would really like a Mean Bean Machine mod, if the tools become availible and this hasn't been made then I'll make one.

Personal opinions:
Party mode would be a lot better without a time limit.
Z's voice sounds way cooler in Japanese, he has a cool filter which isn't applied with English voices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274296955', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 4668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1602552404}
review:
Puyo Puyo! If you live in Japan, odds are, you know about this series. America however.... yeah. Due to how Compile back in the day did not think the game suited American audiences, they ended up doing 2 things: not releasing the game, or editing it into another game like Kirby's Avalanche. On the rare occasion it does get a US release, we can shout HOORAY! This is one of those times. Originally, this game was released in Japan back in 2014 and was not localized until 2017 for Switch and PS4 and 2018 for PC! Crazy, I know! Now, was Arle's current adventures worth the 3-4 year wait, or was this just a bad game? Let's find out!

Gameplay: Gameplay seems simple and self-explanatory. You have 2 playstyles: Puyo Puyo (which I am better at) and Tetris. It's not rocket science. The playstyles work how they have been ever since. Match 4 Puyos to pop them and potentially make chains to drop Nuisance Puyos to the other side. Create a line to clear some Tetriminos and do some in a row to build up a combo. There are also some side modes too. Besides the zany story mode, you also have arcade mode. It features regular play, where you lick a character, your playstyle, and there you go. Swap lets you have both playstyles and it swaps. Big bang is completely insane as you use Fever mode to make sure that your screen is protected from meteors. It's hard to explain. Party mode is endless where you need to get the most points, and you get powerups to help and can powerdown your enemy. Finally, Fusion mode has you play both at once, and it can be crazy! Most of these modes if not all can be taken online for some crazy fun, but be warned: Japanese player + Tetris = the same chaos as giving a kid a gun and 200lb of sugar. Insane. In the end, it all works out and is a balance for the fans of both series. Great job, Sonic Team!

Graphics and Presentation: HISTORY LESSON!!! Back when Compile made Puyo Puyo, they went for a more detailed and anime styled art style. This stuck for some time. However, when they went out of business and SEGA bought the rights to it, after Puyo Puyo Advance and Tsu Perfect Set, the art style changed to a more simple, cartoony style. Now, it's subjective on which one is better, however, I still think it looks nice. The well optimization gives a smooth 60FPS, which is needed of a game like this, and the animations look great. It definitely does it well, and yes, the game does serve up the promised adorableness. Even if you have no idea what species Carbuncle is supposed to be (I legit have no idea).

Sound and Soundtrack: Man, this stuff rocks! The OST is so well made! Many classic Puyo Puyo songs are remade like Theme of Puyo Puyo (great name) and much more. For Tetris, the classic theme will play as an Italian-like style that is so well done, that as someone that is part Italian (without knowing the language) I was not offended by it.... but why would I? I am not an SJW that gets offended by basically everything. The sound design is also great! Popping Puyos is satisfying from the sound that plays and dropping Nuisance Puyos feels great and devilish! Tetris block placement sounds great too! That sound that plays when you get a Tetris..... OOOOOOOOOO! I can't explain more because I am still at awe, but I can mention the voice acting: it is good. The main voices sound well and don't normally get annoying. Plus, you can buy the Japanese voices with credits that you earn by, well, playing the game. You can buy more, but it is a surprise.

Replayability: Here is where things get dicey. This is a puzzle game, with a few modes. There really isn't much that you can do besides those modes, which can also be played in local multiplayer. Now under normal circumstances, that would be bad.... EXCEPT THIS GAME IS SO ADDICTING! Man, it is hard to put this game down! I spent SOOOOOO much time on the Switch demo that it practically is the replayability itself. In reality, there may not seem much, but from what there is, you cannot put this game down!

Final Thoughts: After going over everything, I feel that this game deserves this score. However, you may have different experiences and thoughts, and might disagree with me. That is fine, everyone has opinions. However, from my experiences, I feel this game deserves a 9/10 with a side of a full Puyo chain. This game is just too much fun! Who knows how much time I'll spend online after beating story mode... this game is too much fun, that is all I can say. I recommend this game like crazy! Now this game does have Denuvo like Sonic Mania and Forces, but DON'T make that make you want to avoid this, trust me, you won't regret buying this. Outside of PC, this game can also be bought on PS4 and Nintendo Switch. The Switch version obviously can be taken on the go. The original 2014 release in Japan however, included a PS3, PSVita, 3DS, Wii U, and XBOX ONE versions. Those versions are only out in Japan and can only be played through importing. Besides those ports, this was the most recent Puyo Puyo game that reached America since Puyo Puyo Fever back in 2004. Whoa. Also, why does Puyo Puyo hate being on XBOX consoles for America?

Something that annoys me: This is just me I think, but WHY?! A series staple character is Satan. He was the main antagonist since the first game, and since then.... is kinda a joke. I mean, how else can you describe him? He dressed as Santa once for crying out loud!!!! But what annoys me is despite EVERYONE knowing him as Satan, the game calls him "Dark Prince." I know, the (crappy) original translation of Puyo Puyo 1 called him that (for censorship) but considering how every other character from that game got their Japanese name back, there is no reason that they can't call him Satan. Also, when Schezo is introduced in story mode, they screwed something up for him too. A running joke with him is that he acts like a pervert and does not admit to it. However, he is called a "creeper" in this game! It bothers me, but not as much as "Dark Prince" because it sends off the same message. But still, WHY?!?!

Side note: I know I am basically beating a dead bush, but this game has HORRIBLE matchmaking. You could literally be starting out, and the game will put you against top players around 20 times. Plus, from the 3 patches so far, none of them fixed this issue. This is the one issue Sonic Team is ignoring and I don't know why, since it really needs to be fixed. This issue can bring my score down to an 8/10 if you play mainly online.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197968285815', 'num_games_owned': 1042, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1680644871}
review:
This is the best version of Tetris you'll find on Steam. It's also the only version of Puyo Puyo you will find, excluding the emulated version of Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine. However, it is the only version with modern rules.

Both are very well excecuted, with a lot of modes, including training videos that teach you how to play both games.

There are also mixed modes where every 25 seconds it switches between puyo and tetris, and a fusion mode which combines they two concepts into a whole new game.

So basically you're getting 3-4 games in one here.

The story mode is good, it slowly introduces the concepts of the game and increases in difficulty.

Graphics and sound are nice, so is the music. Previously there were some audio balance and music looping issues, but those were fixed in a patch.

I haven't touched any of the multiplayer features yet, but I hear that's where these games really shine, so I look forward to increasing my skills to have some confidence to jump online and get destroyed by pros.

Highly recommend, it's quite the bargain. Would be a no brainer to get this on sale, just to have a few really good falling block games in your Steam library.

[h1]日本語化あり[/h1]
https://twitter.com/puyonihongo

PUBGやDota2やらがひしめくSteamでわざわざぷよテトを買ってオン対戦する奇特な人しかいないのでレートが機能してないです

というかレート関係なくマッチングが完全にぶっ壊れてます
初心者でも即ランカーと戦える神ゲーです


やばいマッチングの例

https://i.imgur.com/fKSo86y.jpg　アメリカ1位


回線やばい人とマッチングするとラグで操作不能の間でも相手は普通に積んでくるので対戦フィルターから回線状況でフィルタかけましょう←これやっても普通にヤバい人はいるので諦めましょう


超初心者だとテトリス、初心者中級者だとぷよ、上級者だとテトリスが強いっぽいです 
同じ実力くらいの人とマッチングすると白熱してめっちゃ面白いです（まああまり居ないんですけど…）


[spoiler]正味な話ぷよぷよ、対戦テトリスが初めての人だと本当に時間の無駄になりかねないです マジの初心者はコンシューマー版をやろう レートがあるゲームなのに勝率が20％を切り僕は途方に暮れています[/spoiler]

review: The menus in this port can be a little obtuse (especially exiting to desktop) and the story in this game is pretty skip-able. The tetris and puyo puyo mixed modes are pretty fun, though you won't find many varients on tetris or puyo puyo by themselves. But the tetris and puyo puyo are good, even great, versions of those games, and they are fantastic games (especially tetris, which this version is a snappy joy to play).

author: {'steamid': '76561198219363867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1535125524}
review:
I haven't played this type of puzzle game since Tetris on the Gameboy and Columns on the Game Gear and had forgotten just how much fun they can be! I'm playing through the story mode and the challenge curve seems just about right so far. Things get really hectic once they start mixing up Puyo Puyo and Tetris. Perfect game to play when you want a quick break from work or studying.

The music is playing fine on my laptop, but it did crash to desktop once (but the autosave system means I didn't lose any progress).

author: {'steamid': '76561198032638894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1520352064}
review:

それで難しさが上がる。落ちてくるブロックやぷよの形が合わせにくいものになるという難しさでは無い。安易で理不尽な難しさが大きくなる。これで3千5百円は高いね。350円でもよいと思いました。

author: {'steamid': '76561197976577050', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1520896767}
review:
The good: while this is a pretty no-frills port and apparently introduces some weird bugs, this is the same game as Puyo Puyo Tetris on PS4 and Switch in its full glory. Puyo Puyo Tetris is a pretty awesome game, and if you like Puyo Puyo or Tetris I honestly don't really need to explain why, just that it's the absolute best PP out there and one of the best Tetris games.

The bad: again, this is a pretty no-frills port, and might not play nice with your computer if you have a nonstandard setup. Also, if you're buying this game for online play, DO NOT get the PC version as of release; it functions just fine, but every single player you will encounter, regardless of rank, is an insane Tetris or Puyo grandmaster who will hand you your ass on a silver platter. I'm honestly kind of stunned at just how badly I've been getting my ass beaten online at this game, I haven't had an experience like this since the 360 version of Marvel vs. Capcom 2.

The verdict: Buy, but with slight reservations, and prepare to have to git gud if you're playing this version online because the playerbase is superhuman.

review:
I was hoping for a tetris game to be on steam and they delivered.
Puyo Puyo tetirs is a mix between tetris and Puyo and in some game modes, fuses the two together.
cast of playble characters with more to unlock. I like the save replay option so I can watch my replays so I can learn from them and get better. I'm good at tetris but puyo is new to me so it's a bit of a learning curve when it comes to puyo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090026955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 733, 'last_played': 1560538507}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris  is a puzzle game, bringing two of the well known puzzles titles into one single game.
Know that this is *i think* a port over from the PS4 and Nintendo Switch but it seems to run quite well, with one exception at least for me which i will explain later.

The game plays two ways, via Puyo Puyo, which is a match 4 game, matching 4 of the same colour to pop them, creating chains into other 4 colour groups to raise your score/attack the enemy, or via Tetris, which is creating a straight line from left to right with blocks, the bigger the line popped, the more points/damage to the enemy.

The game features various modes to try out, including a adventure mode, which is your story mode, a lesson mode, which teaches you the basics of both Puyo Puyo and Tetris and how to play them, and even has online which i will also get to in a bit.

As for game modes in the game, you have basic Versus, which can be played with 4 people, Swap, where you play both Puyo Puyo and Tetris on seperate boards which swaps around at set times, Big Bang, which is like Fever mode in the Puyo games where a set stack is built and using the puyos/blocks to rake up a huge score more than the enemy to damage them, Party, which is like Versus but with a timer and random power-ups that appear to hinder the enemy in various ways, and Fusion, which you use both Puyo Puyo and Tetris on a single board. There are also other single player modes based off Puyo Puyo and Tetris but i rarely ever play them, however they do appear during the Adventure mode.

Regarding Online mode, you have Puzzle League which is your Ranked mode, and Free/Friendly game *forgot the name* for Unranked mode lobby games.
In the Puzzle League you are given various ranks, your Main Title which is affected by how you play, for example if you play mostly Puyo Puyo, you could get a Title called 1st Class Puyo, vice versa if you mostly played Tetris you could get 1st Commander Tetris *or something simular*, there is also your rating, it starts at 2000 and winning will increase the rating, where as losing decreases it, you are also ranked via the Region you live in, finnaly you have your Class, which will rise or fall after a number of wins or losses.
Note if you are going to spend alot of time on the Puzzle League, if your not super at the game like me, be prepared to lose alot, there are many fast and professional players online that makes me question how they are able to pull such feats or if they are bots, for now i'll just say they are smart and talented.

The only complaint i have would be the music looping, where it would play normally and i assume where the track ends it would abruptly restart the song from the beginning rather than looping where it would normally would, however its nothing major, i'm sure theres a fix somewhere but i can put up with the abupt looping.

All in all, its a fun puzzle game, definately worth getting, alot of fun to play with the family.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031477243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1521421109}
review:
Quick Review: A great combination of Tetris and Puyo Puyo. You might face some bugs with sound, and it might crash (from what the reviews say, haven't found one tho) but NO GAME-BREAKING BUGS. Online seems to work fine and great time with the Solo Arcade and Adventure mode.

And now, a little statement about the negative reviews:
I do not understand these negative reviews. People are saying the game crashes alot, yet, on my 11,5 hour of gameplay, my game has not crashed ONCE, did not face huge lag problems, and only found a slight bug with the voice lines of the characters, wich won't play when you retry a stage on Adventure mode. 

People are giving it negative reviews as if this sound bug is game-breaking, and add the "IM RANK 10, BESHT ON MY CUNTRY, SO MY OPPINION ISH VALIDTH" thinking it's gonna make their review legit. 

Nobody cares that you're rank 5, 4 or even fucking 1 worldwide, you don't come to the reviews to **** on the sound bug and give it a bad review as if it ruins the game. Is the gameplay good? "THE SOUND BUG IS SHIT" ok, so it has a sound bug, but is it good? "THE SOUND BUG IS A PIECE OF SHIT" ok, I get it, but IS THE GAME GOOD?! "DIDNT YOU HEAR ME AT FIRST?! THE SOUND BUG IS FUCKING SHIT!"

It's fine if you didn't like the game, sure, fine by me. However, these reviews MAY be exagerating when it comes to these sound bugs. They say its EVERYWHERE, yet, I only found ONE on Adventure mode, and it's not close to being game breaking, hell, not even 1/5. Sure, it's annoying, but only happens when I rety a stage. And if I re-retry it, the sound goes back to normal. The music loop is not a bug, more of a mis-design from SEGA's part. 

Am I saying to stop hating on the game? No. What I'm saying is do not exagerate on the so-called "SOUND BUGS". And about the game crashing, still haven't run to one, and from what I see on the positive reviews, the reviewers haven't run to one either, so it might just be a small portion of players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020092964', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1607450799}
review:
Im marking this as DO NOT get because there are so many flaws and bugs with this port of the game that NEEDS to be fixed ASAP. I dont understand why these are problems in the first place, changing the resolution just fucks up my computers applications since I have a 4k screen. Also ALT + Tab ing the game is not something you want to do unless you're idling the main menu. The sound is a little wonky and too low even at the highest setting and seems unbalanced. I can barely hear my characters voices over the music and sounds of the game and i shouldnt need to lower anything just to hear that. 

Playing multiplayer on this game is so bad. The lobbies are usually laggy and drop in fps throughout the entire game for certain modes and modes like Big bang are unplayable with two people let alone 4 people. This needs to be fixed somehow or its just not worth buying.

The Nintendo switch port of this game is absolutely the definitive version if you have a switch but this isnt even worth buying if you cant buy the switch port. Unless they fix all these bugs and gameplay issues, this is a terrible port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038102976', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1676585550}
review:
[b]Edited after patch #2 on 15th March 2018: A bunch of the problems I previously listed have been fixed thanks to this patch. The fixed problems that I previously listed have been removed. However, after some more play testing, I've found some issues that I hadn't noticed before that are still present.[/b]

After playing a bunch of the Switch version of this game, I find it hard to reccomend this version in its current state. Even in my short playtime, I've encountered a few issues with the PC port not present in the Switch release that i'll list here:

[*]The Switch version of the game has quick start buttons on the title screen that take you to each of the main modes. These are completely absent in this version.

[*]Even running on a fast SSD, the game's loading times are a few seconds slower than the Switch version. The loading icon animation is choppy as a result. A minor problem, but probably worth noting for those thinking of installing on a HDD, which I've yet to test it on. I've also noticed that the game freezes for a moment whenever character sprites are swapped in and out during the adventure mode scenes.

 [*]Weird artifacting issues sometimes appear on the character sprites. Not encountered this one personally, but i've seen screenshots of what appears to be a giant block appearing over Ringo's character sprite in a story cutscene. Perhaps a giant Tetromino is attacking her?

 [*]When running the game in windowed mode, the game doesn't let you choose what resolution to run it at. Instead, you have to manually resize the window by dragging the edges of the window to whatever size you want.

 [*]After disconnecting and reconnecting my headphones while the game was running, the game audio was completely absent, and I had to restart the game for it to work again.
 
[*]In adventure mode, you have to cycle through each act one at a time. You can't simply hold right or left on either controller or keyboard to continue cycling in one direction as you could on the Switch version.

Other than the listed problems, and perhaps a few I haven't encountered yet, the game runs just like it should. However, until these problems are patched, I can't reccomend this version of Puyo Puyo Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069902955', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1666481254}
review:
I've played the PPT Demo countless times on the switch so when I saw it was on PC for only £14, I thought "how the hell could I pass this up?"

Little did I know I would be getting so majorly fucked over when it comes to the ranked system. My first time trying ranked, rank 6XXX, I get put against Rank 6 in the fucking world, who by the way full-clears before he makes any other row.

What the fuck?

I still recommend it though, because it's without a doubt one of the best ways to play Puyo-Puyo or Tetris (or both!) on any recent machine. Even If It doesn't call you after it fucks you in the ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124278341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1658156229}
review:
One of the best Puyo Puyo games of all time (and the Tetris part is good too, but this is a Puyo game first and foremost). This is a very well-thought-out mashup, for the most part, although competitive play can have the occasional issue. The story is typical Puyo Puyo quirkiness, and pretty much all of the game modes are fun, be they Puyo Puyo, Tetris, or both.

This particular version's option to change the voice acting's language is very nice, particularly since some of the English voices can be slightly annoying at times. This version also has Denuvo, unfortunately, which is... slightly less welcome, but it hasn't caused any noticeable problems for me so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031412973', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1520538687}
review:
This game can get really fun i enjoy Tetris a lot when i grew up so this games helps i wish for 5 things

1: Solo Tetris mode: For people who like the Classic Tetris

2: Customizing our controllers: whats really weird... is that we can customize our inputs for the Keyboard  and mouse but.. not for our controllers... and the options for the controller are REALLY limited i wish we could customize it so new players and experince players can feel confortable with it

3: If its not to much to ask other then "Tertis mode" and "Puyo Puyo mode" i was hoping for "Tetis Attack Mode" THAT would really spice up the game a WHOLE lot

4: A Online Skill ranking system where depending on your skill you will go up agianst players that match your skill level rather then facing ANYONE that can litterly destroy you in 5 seconds flat...

5: with "Online VS" i wish we can have a 4 on 4 free for all that will be crazy!

to me this game is better enjoyed with local friends and family rather then online agianst random players there will destroy you

i give it a 6/10

For me it's also a plus that this game doesn't demand too much of your hardware, it runs well on recent Intel HD Graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209036008', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1607385061}
review: Okay, so this port is good... but it is very close to being bad. Audio glitches are frequent: sometimes characters have no voice at all, and sometimes their voices are swapped. The music also does not loop properly, despite the relative ease of creating loopoints. It comes off feeling like a lazy solution. Some of the new Ui is also pretty bad (the quit button looks terrible). Finally, crashes. My game only crashed on me once (despite me having a sucky laptop), but I hear that crashes are rampant on other systems. But, the positives slightly outweigh the negatives. The option to select the Japanese voices is awesome; it's very intresting hearing diffrences between the original recording and the dub. The gameplay is also still really solid. I have yet to run into a single gameplay glitch. The gameplay overall saves the port, as the game is just as fun to play here as it is on other systems. I would say to buy the game if you don't have it on another system, or if you are a rabid Puyo fan. I also recomend having a decent computer due to the afformentioned crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987968313', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1519859729}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060973461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1655867450}
review:
I've been waiting for this game for the switch for a very long time. But because it came on steam, I'm excited for this game.

So the whole game is a multiplayer battle using the gamemodes of both Tetris and Puyo Puyo. Tetris with its line clearing fun and Puyo Puyo with its chain madness. Players have the option to fight each other using one or both of the game modes using Tzu or Fever or arcade rules (I'm more used to Tzu and Fever).

I would say this. For people who love tetris and want something similar, choose this game. For people who want some puzzle fun, this game is great for that addiction. For people who want to pit mind against mind, this game will test every cell of your brain to its limits.

Currently I think there is an issue/bug with the audio where restarting a game would nuke the voice clip audio while the popping audio and music will still play. But since it has been 2 days since it's release, I think SEGA will address this issue.

Overall 9.5/10
Gameplay 10/10
Music 9/10
Story (yet to finish)
Tutorial 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060257622', 'num_games_owned': 1500, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1558806791}
review:
EDIT: Almost missed the date thanks to paperwork, but I switched the rating now, as promised. Original review below.

PuyoPuyo is a great game. Tetris is a great game too. PuyoPuyo Tetris is an awesome game.

I've waited to play this for way too long. Almost took the Japanese version on Vita back in 2014, then was glad to hear it came to the Switch last year, but thought it would remain a Switch exclusive... until the PC version was announced. Yay!

The port itself is fine (and I would have had questions if it had not been good) (note: still haven't tried online play), the game is affordable, and it's great. Plus the PC version has dual audio. So I recommend it.

The only negative points I could find about this port so far are the fact the tutorial only displays keyboard and mouse controls (as opposed to the control scheme you're currently using, so if you're using a controller, you might be puzzled at first [pun intended, I'm sorry])... And a much more controversial one, Denuvo.

Before anyone jumps the gun, I buy all of the games I play. My concerns about Denuvo are for legacy issues. As Denuvo Anti-Tamper is supposed (primarily, though it does other things) to protect sales at launch, it doesn't make sense to keep it if the game isn't updated with new content or fixes, and increases the risk to have the game being unplayable later down the road (the same goes for other DRMs). So if in one year from its release, this game still has Denuvo in it, I'll change my rating to "Not recommended", unless it is also actually used to prevent cheating online (which I doubt). [spoiler]What I still don't understand is "why putting it into such a small game", but hey... it's SEGA's loss, I guess.[/spoiler]

Copy protection systems are not the problem; it's the way the publishers use them that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012123927', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1593600345}
review: Sonic Team did someting right for once. They should rename themselves Puyo Team

author: {'steamid': '76561197998851748', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1519850031}
review:
If your looking for Puyo Puyo, this is an absolutely fine game.

If your looking for Tetris, your probably better off looking elsewhere.


The game feels more like it's based around puyo puyo first, and tetris is an afterthought they tried changing the mechanics of scoring on to try and make it feel fresh, but instead comes across as destroying the basis of why you would even have tetris in the first place.
Trying to play the tetris portion of this game like you traditionally would, making your perfect stacks to try and and get a one/two whammy of tetris clears while also clearing the board will not reward you like you want, in fact you will never win against anyone playing a puyo board this way.     Instead the way they want you to score now is to make uneven stacks with holes in them to spin blocks into to try and clear multiple lines with to generate your actual score and attacks against other boards.   While this makes the act of playing tetris more complex, it also begs the question of why even include tetris at all if a tetris stack clear - the act of using your straight tetrimino to clear 4 stacks - is made worthless?

The game isn't terrible, at least not if you enjoy playing Puyo Puyo, but the tetris half of it feels like an exercise in futility, since the majority of the game is based around Versus aspects, playing tetris in it's traditional fashion against a puyo board will have you lose every time, no matter the skill level of the puyo player.
Puyo is kept intact fully with no changes, and the versus mechanics are absolutely fine as it looks like it was fully intended for that in mind.  All actions for scoring in puyo naturally reward you how you would expect from the series.  

This is the game's main flaw. When all your avenues of traditional scoring and clearing stacks results in minimal reward (Little to no garbage being pushed to opponent's boards) when using a Tetris board, and a Puyo board can do far more damage in even the hands of a beginner because all scoring actions result in attacks, tetris boards are at an extreme disadvantage and need far more skill and time to setup any kind of combo or attack.  Any veteran of tetris needs to adopt a totally new mindset and strategy for playing as old strategies do not translate over.


Summary:  The Puyo half of the game is totally fine, the other (Tetris) half takes a step towards trying something new while ruining everything that a tetris player would come to know the game for.

Y'a un sticky dédié dans les forums au moment ou j'écris, vous devriez probablement le consulter.

Et moins cher que sur console.

Et apparement une serie de patchs est en route.

A acheter une fois les problemes corrigés.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972427409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1519849939}
review:
Crisp visuals, a solid single player story and ample offline options to play as you like.  I'm pretty awful at Puyo Puyo and find Tetris more elegant and enjoyable but perhaps that will change with practice and experience.

The online filters are slightly unreliable at launch and can drop you into a match with unexpected rule sets. It's also difficult to compete against opponents of a similar skill level which is swiftly demoralising.  There are some truly amazing players out there, although I respect their skill I doubt it's much fun for either of us.

Impressive performance on low-spec hardware, I wasn't expecting native 1800p via onboard graphics (Intel HD 520). Really pleased with the package overall, recommended for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064665965', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1603352551}
review:
[b]This review has been changed 2 times to reflect patches:[/b]
[i]First Edit: March 2 (Addressed Patch 1)[/i]
[i]Second Edit: March 27 (Addressed Patches 2 & 3)[/i]

I knew I'd want PPT after seeing others play it on the Switch, and it's solid.  (If you want a Tetris game on Steam you'll enjoy, this is your best bet by far; I've not played Tetris Ultimate, but I hear from many people that it's not very good.) 
[i]Changed:[/i] My thumbs-up is bigger now, as they've fixed online match filter issues.  After that, they fixed the dialogue crash and volume balance issues, so now 3 out of 4 of the major issues this game once faced are fixed.

Here are the issues that bugged/are bugging me, which I've been updating to address whether or not said issues have been fixed by patches:

[strike][b]Issue 1: Crashes During Adventure Mode Dialogue[/b][/strike]
[i]Status: FIXED by Patch 2[/i]
[strike]> Like others, I am experiencing occasional crashes when viewing dialogue scenes.  I suppose it isn't the biggest issue ever, as it happens uncommonly and progress is auto-saved, but it still needs to be fixed.
>>Patch 1 Edit: This remains unfixed as far as I'm aware.[/strike]
>>Patch 3 Edit: If I'm not wrong, patch 2 fixed this specific problem ("Fixed an uncommon audio crash"), so all should be well on this front now.

[strike][b]Issue 2: Online Match Filters Not Working[/b][/strike]
[i]Status: FIXED by Patch 1[/i]
[strike]> I too have seen how the online match filters at least occasionally just don't work.  This must get fixed as well, or I don't see myself playing online very much.[/strike]
>>Patch 1 Edit: This problem is now FIXED thanks to patches, and is no longer an issue.  This was probably the biggest problem that actually affected game playability, and I'm glad it's fixed.

[strike][b]Issue 3: Voicework Volume Practically Unhearable[/b][/strike]
[i]Status: FIXED by Patch 2[/i]
[strike]> I agree with the others who say the voicework could use a BIG volume boost.  At default volume, you can't hear anyone talking pretty much at all.  I had to turn the music down to a practically-unhearable level to hear the characters talk (which may explain why I didn't witness the music not looping properly).
>> Patch 1 Edit: This remains an issue as far as I know.[/strike]
>> Patch 3 Edit: The audio balance has been corrected, so this is no longer an issue. 

[b]Issue 4: Online Matchmaking Not Prioritizing Very Well[/b]
[i]Status: Still an Issue (Address attempt made, did not fix satisfactorily.)[/i]
> I'd also appreciate if online matchmaking made some attempt to match me with someone who's actually around my skill level.  I played about a dozen matches really early this morning and was completely annihilated by everyone I played against.  Care to actually implement those titles you give us into your matchmaking, Sega?
>> Patch 1 Edit: The first patch now prioritizes seeking similar skill level over finding someone close to you.
>> Patch 3 Edit: Though patch 1 did make this situation marginally better, the matchmaking software still seems to enjoy putting you up against people you have no business playing against.  As such, this issue is not yet fixed to my satisfaction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198301683371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2195, 'last_played': 1642712807}
review:
Full Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aDqS2NxSqnI

I've been a long time fan of Tetris, so this review might be a little baised. 

All in all, I like it. 

I'm more a fan of Tetris than Puyo Puyo, but I liked that game the one time I was into it about 10 years ago. I forgot it existed until today, so I may very well be getting back into it. 

There are lots of different game modes featuring purely Tetris style gameplay, purely Puyo Puyo style gameplay, and a mixture of both. I think the way they incorporated these two games is well done. 

I do have a couple gripes though. First being that you can't play multiplayer in the challenges (AFAIK) like Sprint, Marathon, etc... 

Second, the CPU difficulty isn't clear. You can handicap yourself or them, but it doesn't seem to do much. Perhaps their difficulty is tied to the character you select for them, but I haven't tested it yet. The ones we did fight though are horrible. Regardless, I didn't find a simple setting to make them easier or harder.

And finally, I wish there was an option to set the delay between when you hit the right or left button, and the tetrimino actually fast-moving across the board. It's not a huge deal, the default delay feels good. A tiny bit slower than I've been used to, but it's okay in general.

I've only tried the online play twice, and it's fine for the most part. When clearing lines, there seemed to be a short delay. That may have been my opponents network and mine too far apart. Thankfully there wasn't any lag while placing pieces. That would've been gamebreaking.

All in all, if you're a fan of Tetris and/or Puyo Puyo, I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059971262', 'num_games_owned': 2465, 'num_reviews': 632, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1613020077}
review:
This is by far the best version of Tetris available on Steam so far. 

Puyo puyo is also a great game, but it's honestly worth it even if you only like Tetris.

Puyo puyo Tetris is a great mix of the two games, with a story full of humor, the usual modes, even online multiplayer! 

It's a really great game for fans of puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044012091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1536201081}
review:
I haven't encountered any bugs or anything serious, although I've only played for about an hour. Quick first impressions: very bright, vibrant game, eases you in with adventure mode and lessons mode.

I came in knowing only how to play Tetris and I was able to pick up the Puyo Puyo part really quickly! Very interesting game; can't wait to play more of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015108384', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1677023786}
review:
Before saying anything, you may want to hold off your purchase or download until a patch rolls off, as there is quite the bunch of bugs, most of them related to sounds, but other than an input lag issue related to V-Sync, it's perfectly playable.

Now, with that being addressed...

The easiest way to describe Puyo Puyo Tetris is that it's the Marvel vs. Capcom of puzzle games. The falling blocks version of the Federer-Nadal Battle of the Surfaces (imbalance included).

Keep in mind the order in the title. It's a Puyo Puyo game with Tetris added on top of it, not the other way around.

Pros:
- It's the first Puyo game for PC since Fever.
- Hardly any gimmick modes.
- The signature long story mode with plenty of comedy moments Puyo is quite known for. Chapter 9 in particular - there's something inside of it that I can't resist.
- The dub is actually quite good. The voices may come as quite off if you've played Puyo before, but at the very least the dubbing is solid. Especially Schezo's lines.
- For Tetris fans... it's the first Tetris game since that abomination called Tetris Ultimate. And this one actually works.
- VERY cheap compared to the PS4 and Switch versions. I'm talking about around half the price depending on the region.
- Dual audio if you don't like the english dub.
- Launch-day issues aside, the experience is just like the one you'd find in the PS4 and Switch versions. That includes the lack of crossplay, though.

Cons:
- Few gimmick modes, but one (Party) is annoying and another (Fusion) is very confusing. Big Bang is okay, though - still better than Endless Fever.
- No Fever mode.
- The Puyo player is at an extreme disadvantage.
- (Should no longer apply after a patch) Buggy audio everywhere at launch day.
- Denuvo. It's very overblown, but it's still a DRM that does nothing it's intended to do.

Still, it's the best (and only, to be fair) official experience for both Puyo and Tetris on PC right now, but you'll enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013880008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1526891075}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris is that one game you may have heard of from SEGA that reached grand levels of popularity. Combining the thrill of Puyo Puyo (or Bean Machine, Avalanche, whatever you're familiar with) with Tetris multiplayer into one neat little package, there's plenty of fantastic story to experience alongside solid gameplay. Many people joke about how PPT is the next big fighting game, and after playing the game you too will see how much those jokes are actually based on reality.

I'm already a big fan of Puyo Puyo Tetris, with hundreds of hours of gameplay clocked in for the Switch version. After a few hours of playing the PC version, my thoughts can be summarized as such:

- Yes, it has Denuvo. If that's a deal-breaker for you, there's not much anyone can say to convince you otherwise anyway.
- If you've been wanting to play a new Puyo Puyo game, or perhaps an official Tetris game that isn't garbage and is actually good, you may already be interested in Puyo Puyo Tetris. If you don't already own the game for a different console, the PC version is a decent consideration at this time.
- If you already own PPT for a different system, hold off the PC version for now.

Note the lack of confidence in recommending this game to anyone, especially newer players. At the time of this review I've only hit 3 hours, but the number of issues I and plenty of others have experienced indicate that the PC port is not the best it could or should be. The game runs absolutely fine on all other systems, so it's a bit disappointing to see this new port immediately have problems.

- The game may experience sluggish performance, which is not ideal for a fast-paced puzzle game.
- Online ranked matching is sometimes restricted to the region you choose to represent, meaning you might never see a player to fight against.
- You can turn off certain modes for ranked mode so they never show up for you. Unfortunately, the game will occasionally ignore your settings and make you play a mode you turned off.
- Free battle mode, where you set up a room for others to join, is busted. No one can seem to find any rooms that are available despite other members of the community saying they've opened one up; some have had luck after restarting the game a few times.
- Various audio issues are present, such as poorly looping BGM tracks or incorrect voices for characters in matches.
- Some users have reported game crashes; I have yet to experience any myself at least.

I do not blame you for holding off purchasing this game at this time if the above issues sound like too much. However, if you are fine with experiencing single play modes to enjoy Puyo Puyo and Tetris without needing to bother with online modes, the game now should be sufficient. SEGA lately has been pretty good at making sure their game releases aren't terrible, so PPT for PC will likely see some fixes in the near future.

For now, the game is playable. I just hope this PC version gets fixed so it can catch up with its currently-superior console siblings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002465515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1520417945}
review:
Two puzzle games that dont sound like they would mesh well together wind up going as well together as peanut butter and chocolate.

The jist of this is that its a puzzle battle type game where your objective is to make the other player(s) run out of available space to play, or just to outlast them. However, there are some solo-play training modes.

Alongside modes that merge or have you swap between each game style, you can focus on just playing Puyo Puyo or Tetris.
Puyo's and Tetramino's both offer their own strengths and weaknesses, so do be mindful of that.

This game also sports a story mode that weirdly expects you to be familiar with the world of Puyo Puyo (most people recognize the game from Dr Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine than they do its real IP), and then introduces a cast of characters to represent the Tetris brand, so they can do a proper story thing. The art style of the characters gives a pretty strong indicationof the tone of the plot.

Beyond that, you got various cosmetic options, modes I am probably forgettign as this is a very robust game, and online multiplayer. Also, for whom it may concern, The PC version is the only version of the game to support Dual-Audio.

If this sounds intruiging to you, or you just really want a non-buggy version of Tetris of off Steam, I highly recommend it.
Its going to be my go-to puzzle game for the forseeable future when I get that specific itch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042876171', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1667513177}
review:
I'm only 8 hours into this and finished the Adventure Mode, but I will safely say that I am VERY glad Sega decided to port this to PC, which makes it much more accessible to people who want to play this game. If you had been eager to try this but didn't own a PS4 or Switch, now's your chance! This game is more than worth the 20 dollars, especially if you want to just jump in and play.

That said, there are a couple of minor issues with the port. Most of these have been summed up in other reviews, but to recap: The music doesn't loop properly, sometimes the character voices blank out after retrying a stage or having a rematch, and there are times I've had the game crash (thankfully only during cutscenes). There was one point where the box below the characters during a cutscene was VERY out of place on the screen as well. All of these, however, are minor nuances that likely (and hopefully) will be fixed in a coming patch. If these are fixed, then you can safely ignore this part of the review~ My only personal problem was Fusion Mode...it seems WAY too confusing. But that's just a personal thing.

Minor problems or not, this is still a game for Puyo and Tetris enthusiasts to pick up.~ You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029936364', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1532976009}
review:
Puyo Puyo + Tetris should be an instant buy for everyone tbh.
If you're not familiar with Puyo Puyo, you might be familiar with Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine, which was one of the very few north american localized versions of PP that we managed to get.

+Great netcode
+Fantastic soundtrack
+Contains old school Tetris gameplay in its entirety if you don't want to learn Puyo Puyo
+A metric fuckton of game modes
+EN and JP voices
+Supports up to 4k resolution

-Experienced a few crashes in multiplayer so far, hopefully will be fixed soon
-Puyo Puyo is ABSOLUTELY easier to win with at a low/mid level of play

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198210446132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1704056491}
review:
首先，方块模式，明显吞键。（因为我手太快？排行榜前面的爷爷们能同意？）
技术上我能看出是因为设置了出块延迟（ARE）。
其他著名方块系列比如TGM、Tetris Friends里都有初始旋转和hold系统（IRS/IHS）的，即会处理ARE过程中按下的旋转和Hold。

但是PPT（可能只是PC版吧）不仅没有这俩系统，ARE还不短，这期间的旋转Hold就直接【忽略】了。
TOJ也没有这两个系统，但是非消行放块的ARE基本上是一帧，真的是要同时按才能触发问题。
爷爷们是能通过刻苦练习，恰好在ARE之后才按下hold/旋转，并且把我爆出翔。没问题。
但是我不能忍。

然后，毫无预兆多次崩溃。

追加：并且，网络对战卡（我中午玩还行，下午基本上每次落块都要等0.2秒才能消行，还随机直接卡掉线？？）

修好再改好评。

Firstly, It swallows Input in Tetris. (Because I'm too fast? Huh? You sure?)
Technically, I'm aware of the little ARE time (the time before each piece enters the field).
Usually, in other games like TGM series and Tetris Friends, there are IRS/IHS (that processes the rotation/hold key you pressed during the ARE time).

However, in PPT (probably just PC edition) there's not. And the ARE time is not short, it simply 【ignores】 rotation/hold keystrokes during this time.
TOJ doesn't have them either, but for pieces without line-clear, the ARE is as short as like just 1 frame. You need to push some keys really simutanously to trigger the ignorance problem.
Monsters may practice to avoid pressing rotation/hold too early while beating me into the ground. No problem.
Just I can't stand it.

Secondly, it crashes randomly. For no reason it seems.

EDIT: Also, online play is getting laggy (forced to wait for like 0.2s before each piece locks, randomly freeze and then disconnection)

Will recommend once those problems are solved.

----

更新 edit

经过几次更新崩溃问题基本好了，游戏内bug少了一些。

with some patches relased, issue of crashing and other bugs are partly solved.

但是这个手感还是不能忍。
我刷40行的时候（当然不是在ppt，在这上面三盘就想砸键盘），换其他方块玩一段时间再回去，总会更容易有几盘很好的成绩，甚至破纪录。
广泛称作屁牌换游戏提高法（
但是ppt，是我目前遇到的第一个换过来玩了之后回去刷40行就感觉残废了的游戏。

i still can't stand the input ignorance problem.
when i used to play sprint (of course not on PPT sprint, where i'll crush my keyboard in no more than 3 games), i encounter bottleneck / speed drain after long time of play. i'll switch to other tetris games and play it for a while, and then i'll recover very fast or even break my PB when i returned.
a.k.a the so-called "farter's switching strategy"
PPT is the first version of tetris on which this method works the opposite way. it feels like having polluted my tetris ability when i returned to a tetris i'm familiar with after playing PPT.

----

所以仍然并不满意。毕竟还是第一次花钱买的俄罗斯方块呢。
（而且还是国区原价。没有跟随某茶管去俄区买俄罗斯方块（滑稽）。所以要求当然要高点呢（

----

另外，一个从首次看到PPT（准确地说，PvT对战）就想要吼出的强烈建议。
与puyo的风格相同的玩法的俄罗斯方块，并且能实现比现在强行调数据带来的好得多的平衡的，是，quadra，或者说官方的cascade模式，可以有一次消10行的地狱火，也可以有SZ贴边上面放I的真·俄罗斯方块连锁。
虽然觉得希望很渺茫，但是仍然要提出。哪怕被未来某家脑子同样秀逗了想抄PPT的竞争对手看到了也好（笑）

besides, there's an advice i've had since the first sight on PPT (more specifically, PvT mode).
the variant of tetris which has most similar mechanics to puyo, imo providing far better balance than the current status of sticking to the original tetris, is Quadra (or in Guideline, Cascade mode). it has hell-fire-like move (10 lines at once) and also true big chains by cascading (S Z in 3w with I above).
though i know there's little hope of being adopted, i'll still shout it out here. there will still be chance that some other puzzle game developer eventually see this idea someday. lol.

review:
Puyo Puyo™Tetris® appartient au genre de jeu que j'aimerais voir plus souvent sur steam.
